phrase.main: 礼物；礼品（gift）：

example.main: birthday / Christmas / wedding presents 生日/圣诞节/结婚礼物
buy / give / open a present 买/送/打开礼物

phrase.main: 颁发；授予；赠送to give sth to sb, especially formally at a ceremony：

example.main: The Grammy Awards are presented every year in the music industry in the United States. 格莱美奖在美国音乐界每年颁奖一次。

form.main: present sth to sb / present sb with sth:

example.main: The young man presented the water to the old man. / The young man presented the old man with the water.年轻人把水给老人端上来。

phrase.main: 提出；呈递to show or offer sth for other people to look at or consider：

example.main: We presented three options to the Students’ Union for discussion.我们向学生会提出了三种选择以供讨论。
At the end of the programme, the students presented papers on their research. 项目结束时，学生提交了他们的研究论文。

phrase.main: 呈现to show or describe sth / sb in a particular way：

example.main: Classic works, written by masters, present great thoughts through fascinating stories and language.大师们所著的经典作品，通过极具吸引力的故事和语言呈现出伟大的思想。

phrase.main: 招致；带来：

example.main: The EXIT signs could not be seen clearly, which presented potential safety issues.“出口”指示牌看不清楚会带来安全隐患。
Large classes present great problems to many teachers.大班教学给许多老师造成很大的困难。

phrase.main: vt上演；推出

example.main: The theater company presents a new production of King Lear,剧团推出全新制作的《李尔王》。

phrase.main: 目前；现在：

example.main: I’ve decided to live in the present and not spend my life regretting the past or dreading the future.我决定活在当下，不再浪费生命悔恨过去或担忧未来。

phrase.main: [只用于名词前]现在的；如今的：

example.main: the present difficulties / problems / situation 当前的困难/问题/形势
At the present time we have no explanation for this.目前我们对此不作任何解释。

phrase.main: [不用于名词前]在场的；出席的：

example.main: All students are required to be present at the school meeting.所有学生务必出席全校大会。
Everybody present welcomed the decision. 在场的所有人都对这个决定表示欢迎。

phrase.main: [U] & [C]介绍；报告；展示：

example.main: give a presentation of the new project 对新项目进行介绍

phrase.main: [C]授予；颁发：

example.main: the presentation ceremony颁奖仪式

phrase.main: 维护；保护；保存：

example.main: We will do everything to preserve peace.我们将竭尽全力维护和平。
We all share a joint responsibility to protect and preserve heritage sites.我们都有共同的责任保护遗产地。
The Forbidden City is the largest and best preserved collection of ancient buildings in China.紫禁城是中国最大、保存最完好的古建筑群。

phrase.main: 贮存；保鲜：

example.main: Thousands of years ago, people realised that they could preserve meat by burying it in snow.几千年前，人们意识到可以把肉埋在雪里来保鲜。

phrase.main: 总统；总裁；大学校长
压 (push)；按；挤；推：

example.main: press a button / switch按下按钮 / 开关
She pressed her face against the window. 她把脸贴在窗上。
She pressed down hard on the gas pedal and the car leapt forwards. 她猛踩油门，车向前冲去。

phrase.main: 将…塞进：

example.main: She tried to press a five-pound note into his hand.她试图把一张五英镑的钞票塞到他的手里。

phrase.main: 催促；逼迫 (push / urge)：

example.main: When we 're at home, she keeps pressing me to study all the time.当我们在家的时候，她一直催促我学习。

phrase.main: [常与a连用] 按；压；推；挤：

example.main: Give it a press. 按一下它。

phrase.main: 出版社；印刷厂：

example.main: the Oxford University Press 牛津大学出版社

phrase.main: [常用the press] 报刊新闻业；新闻界：

example.main: the local press 当地报刊
the freedom of the press 新闻自由

phrase.main: [U]挤压；(物理学) 压力；压强：

example.main: air / blood pressure 气/血压
The nurse applied pressure to his arm to stop the bleeding. 护士用力按住他的手臂来止血。

phrase.main: [U] & [C](精神上的，外界施加的) 压力：

example.main: pressures of life生活压力
Some people work better under pressure.有些人在有压力时工作表现更好。
I know studying is very important, but my parents put too much pressure on me. 我知道学习很重要，但父母给我施加了太多的压力。

phrase.main: 假装；装作：

example.main: What’s the good of pretending? 装假有什么用呢？
When his mother came in, he pretended to be doing his homework. 妈妈进来时，他假装在做作业。
He pretended to his family that everything was fine.他对家人假装一切都好。

phrase.main: 漂亮的；美丽的：

example.main: a pretty girl 漂亮的女孩

phrase.main: [口语] 相当；很：

example.main: We are pretty busy on Friday night. 周五晚上我们相当忙。

phrase.main: 阻止；阻碍；预防；防止：

example.main: They look for ways to prevent diseases by developing vaccines.他们通过研发疫苗来寻找预防疾病的方法。
There were many ways to prevent this from happening.有多种方法可以防止此事发生。
David had a brain disease which prevent him from walking or running like other children.大卫患有一种脑部疾病，使他不能像其他孩子一样走路或跑步。

phrase.main: 预习；预看；预演：

example.main: It really benefited me a lot to preview lessons.课前预习真的让我受益很多。

phrase.main: (电影等的) 预演；预告片
[只用于名词前]以前的；先前的：

example.main: the previous class' lecture / discussion上节课的讲座 / 讨论
He has no previous experience of this kind of work.他以前没有做这类工作的经验。

phrase.main: [C] & [U]价格；价钱：

example.main: at a high / low price 以高/低价

phrase.main: [常用单数]代价；牺牲：

example.main: We paid a heavy price for the victory. 我们为胜利付出了沉重的代价。

phrase.main: 给...定价 / 标价：

example.main: The tickets are priced at $10 each. 门票价格为每张10美元。
a high-priced / low-priced car价格昂贵 / 便宜的汽车

phrase.main: 无价的；贵重的：

example.main: Good health is priceless. 健康无价。

phrase.main: [U]自豪；骄傲：

example.main: a sense of national pride民族自豪感
I was filled with pride. 我满怀自豪。
Traditional festivals bring us together, shape our national identity and fill us with pride in being Chinese.传统节日将我们聚在一起，助我们形成民族认同，因作为中国人而自豪。

phrase.main: [C]引起自豪的人 / 事物：

example.main: sb’s pride and joy使某人感到骄傲和快乐的人 / 事物
I think he is the pride of our Chinese people.我认为他是我们中国人的骄傲。

phrase.main: [U]自尊；尊严：

example.main: His pride prevents him from doing anything dishonourable.他的自尊使他不会做出任何不光彩的事情。

phrase.main: [U]自负；傲慢：

example.main: Pride goes before a fall.骄兵必败。

phrase.main: 牧师
[常用于名词前]最重要的；基本的；主要的 (main)：

example.main: The primary aim of this course is to improve your spoken English. 这门课的主要目的是提高你们的英语口语能力。

phrase.main: [只用于名词前]初等教育的；小学教育的：

example.main: a primary school 小学

phrase.main: 最重要的；首要的 (main / primary)
原始的；远古的：

example.main: primitive man / society原始人 / 社会

phrase.main: 简陋的；落后的：

example.main: The facilities on the campsite were very primitive.营地的设施非常简陋。

phrase.main: 王子；亲王
公主；王妃
校长 (headteacher)
[C]原理；原则the basic idea that a plan or system is based on：

example.main: the basic principle基本原理/基本原则
Excellent customer service should be our guiding principle.优质的客户服务应该成为我们的指导原则。

phrase.main: [C] & [U]道德准则；行为准则a moral rule or belief about what is right and wrong, that influences how you behave：

example.main: stick to one's principles坚持原则
as a matter of principle作为原则问题
a man of principle有原则的人
I refuse to lie about it; it’s against my principles. 我绝不为此事撒谎，那有悖我的原则。
She’d never ask to borrow money, on principle. 原则上，她从不向别人借钱。

phrase.main: [C](机器等的) 工作原理；(自然界的) 定律；法则a general or scientific law that explains how sth works or why sth happens：

example.main: Archimedes’ principle 阿基米德定律
These machines both work on the same principle. 这两台机器的工作原理是相同的。

phrase.main: vi & vt打印；印刷：

example.main: print the document 打印文件
Six thousand copies of the book are printed.这本书印了6 000册。

phrase.main: vt刊登 (publish)：

example.main: It is his wish that his stories would be printed in local newspapers. 他希望自己的故事会刊登在当地报纸上。

phrase.main: vt印 (照片)：

example.main: It usually takes a couple of hours for the pictures to be developed and printed. 冲印照片通常需要几个小时。

phrase.main: 印刷；印刷字体：

example.main: the print media 印刷媒体
in large / small print 以大/小字体印刷

phrase.main: 打印机；印刷工；印刷商
[U]印刷；印刷术；印刷字体：

example.main: the invention of printing印刷术的发明
3D printing technology三维打印技术
a printing press印刷机

phrase.main: [C](书等的) 一次印刷：

example.main: This is the first printing of the book. 这是这本书的首次印刷。

phrase.main: [C] 优先事项sth that is more important or that you must do before anything else：

example.main: Education is a top priority.教育是当务之急。
Nowadays the priority for travelling is shifted from shopping to food and scenery.如今，人们旅游时优先考虑的事情从购物转移到美食和风景。
The career planning is considered to be a top / first / main priority.职业规划被认为是当务之急 / 头等大事。
Things should be taken up in order of priority.事情应该按优先次序来处理。

phrase.main: [U] 优先权：

example.main: Club members will be given priority. 俱乐部成员享有优先权。
Her family takes / has priority over her work.她的家庭优先于她的工作。
The search for a new vaccine will take priority over all other medical research.寻找新疫苗将优先于其他一切医学研究。

phrase.main: 监狱；牢笼：

example.main: escape from prison 越狱
go to / get out of prison入 / 出狱
put sb in / send sb to / throw sb into prison把某人关 / 送进监狱
Mandela fought for black people and was in prison for almost thirty years.曼德拉为黑人而斗争并坐了将近三十年的牢。

phrase.main: 囚犯；犯人；俘虏
[常用于名词前]私人 (用) 的；个人的；私有的：

example.main: private property 私有财产
a private car 私家车

phrase.main: 不公开的；秘密的 (secret)：

example.main: a private conversation / letter密谈/私人信件

phrase.main: [只用于名词前]私立的；民营的：

example.main: Britain has both state and private schools. 英国既有公立学校也有私立学校。

phrase.main: 士兵
私下地；私立地
[C]特权；优待：

example.main: the privilege of a good education享受良好教育的特权

phrase.main: [常用单数] 荣幸 (honour)：

example.main: It's such a privilege to be a part of these kids' lives, even just for a few hours.能够成为这些孩子们生活中的一部分是如此的荣幸，即使只有几个小时的时间。

phrase.main: 奖；奖品；奖金：

example.main: I won first prize!我得了一等奖！
the Nobel Prize for / in Physics 诺贝尔物理学奖
Tu Youyou is the first Chinese female scientist to win a Nobel Prize.屠呦呦是中国首位获得诺贝儿奖的女科学家。

phrase.main: 很可能的：

example.main: the probable cause 可能的原因
It’s quite probable that Bill didn’t win the competition.很有可能比尔没有赢得这场比赛。

phrase.main: 很可能；大概：

example.main: The writer of the passage is probably a science teacher.这篇文章的作者很可能是位理科老师。
— Will Mrs Johnson be here tomorrow for the meeting? 约翰逊夫人明天会来参加会议吗？
— Probably not.大概不会。

phrase.main: 问题；难题：

example.main: health / family problems健康 / 家庭问题
cause / solve a problem引起 / 解决问题
I’ve been having problems with my computer system.我的电脑系统一直有问题。

phrase.main: (考试、教科书中的) 问题：

example.main: She set her pupils many mathematical problems. 她给学生们布置了很多数学题。

phrase.main: 步骤；手续；程序：

example.main: follow the regular procedure 按正常程序办理
Making a complaint is quite a simple procedure. 申诉的手续相当简单。
The procedure works like this.步骤如下。

phrase.main: 行进；前往：

example.main: Passengers for Shanghai should proceed to gate 25.前往上海的旅客请到25号登机口（登机）。

phrase.main: 继续；继续做；继续进行 (go on)：

example.main: Beethoven proceeded with the composition until his death in 1827.贝多芬继续创作乐曲，直到1827年去世。
She sat down and proceeded to tell me about her skiing holiday.她坐了下来，接着告诉我有关她滑雪度假的事情。

phrase.main: 过程；进程：

example.main: It's the process not the end product that matters.重要的是过程，而不是最终结果。
Getting fit again is a long slow process.恢复健康是个漫长的过程。
We’re still in the process of moving house. 我们还正在搬家呢。

phrase.main: 工序；步骤：

example.main: This was the first stage of the printing process. 这是印制过程的第一道工序。

phrase.main: 加工：

example.main: Fat and salt are required to process the food that we eat.加工我们所吃的食物需要有油和盐。

phrase.main: 审核；处理 (文件、请求等)：

example.main: It will take a week for your application to be processed. 审核你的申请需要一周的时间。

phrase.main: 产生；引起to cause a particular result or effect (bring about)：

example.main: Giving sometimes produces nice results.给予有时会产生好的结果。
Childhood experiences produce far-reaching effect on the health of grown-ups.儿时的经历对成年后的健康会产生深远的影响。

phrase.main: 生产；创作to make, write etc. sth to be bought, used or enjoyed by people：

example.main: In 1914 Henry Ford began to mass-produce cars using assembly lines.1914年亨利·福特开始使用流水线大量生产汽车。
Each year, world-famous artists are invited to design and produce works of art from the ice.每年，一些世界闻名的艺术家都被邀请来用冰块设计和创作艺术作品。

phrase.main: 出产；生育：

example.main: Australia has produced some famous painters and world-class writers.澳大利亚出了一些著名画家和世界级的作家。
He had a cow which produced milk every day.他有一头奶牛，每天都产奶。

phrase.main: 监制；制作 (电影、戏剧等)：

example.main: CCTV 9 broadcast Du Fu: China's Greatest Poet, a documentary produced by BBC.央视9台播出了英国广播公司出品的纪录片《杜甫：中国最伟大的诗人》。

phrase.main: 出示；拿出
(总称) 产品；(尤指) 农产品：

example.main: farm / agricultural produce农产品

phrase.main: 生产者；制片人
[C] & [U]产品；制品：

example.main: When first introduced to the market, these products enjoyed great success. 首次投入市场，这些产品就非常成功。
agricultural / dairy / meat / health products农产品 / 乳制品 / 肉制品 / 保健品

phrase.main: [C]产物；结果：

example.main: The report was the product of four years’ hard work.这份报告是四年的努力成果。

phrase.main: [U] 生产；制造：

example.main: a production line 生产线
The new model will be in production by the end of the year. 新型号将于年底投入生产。

phrase.main: [U]产量：

example.main: As a result of Yuan Longping’s discoveries Chinese rice production rose by 47.5 percent in the 1990’s.由于袁隆平的发现，中国的水稻产量在20世纪90年代增长了47.5%。

phrase.main: [C] & [U](电影、戏剧等的) 制作；上演：

example.main: Music production experience in radio is necessary, along with rich knowledge of modern dance music.(应征者) 必须要有在电台制作音乐的经验，还要有丰富的现代舞曲知识。

phrase.main: 职业；行业：

example.main: A software engineer by profession, Steve was a keen lover of the piano.史蒂夫是名软件工程师，但他非常热爱弹钢琴。
She was at the very top of her profession. 她是她那个行业中的佼佼者。

phrase.main: 职业的；非业余的

example.main: a professional tennis player职业网球运动员
turn / go professional开始走职业道路

phrase.main: 专业的；内行的：

example.main: He dealt with the problem in a highly professional way. 他处理这个问题非常专业。
professional knowledge / skills专业知识 / 技能
seek professional help / advice / opinion寻求专业帮助 / 建议 / 意见

phrase.main: 专业人士；职业选手：

example.main: There will be a rise in the demand for health care professionals.对医疗保健专业人员的需求将会上升。

phrase.main: 教授：

example.main: a professor of history 历史教授

phrase.main: [C] & [U]利润；赢利：

example.main: The Confucius Institute is a non-profit educational organisation run by the Chinese Ministry of Education.孔子学院是中国教育部主办的非营利性教育机构。
Not all advertising is about selling products and services for (a) profit / to make a profit.并非所有的广告都是以盈利为目的销售产品与服务。

phrase.main: [U] [正式用语]好处；利益：

example.main: I have read the book with profit. 我读完这本书后受益匪浅。

phrase.main: [正式用语]获利 (于)；受益 (于)：

example.main: It will profit you nothing to do that. 做那事对你没有任何好处。
Can you patent and profit by / from your idea?你能为你的想法获取专利并从中赢利吗？

phrase.main: 计划；方案：

example.main: a training program for new staff 新员工培训方案

phrase.main: 节目；节目单：

example.main: What’s your favourite TV programme? 你最喜欢的电视节目是什么?
a concert programme 音乐会节目单

phrase.main: 活动安排：

example.main: I know nothing about the programme of the meeting.我对会议的议程一无所知。

phrase.main: 课程：

example.main: The program broadened students’ knowledge. 该课程增长了学生的见识。

phrase.main: (计算机) 程序：

example.main: WeChat mini programs微信小程序

phrase.main: 计划；安排；[program] 编程
计划；方案：

example.main: a training program for new staff 新员工培训方案

phrase.main: 节目；节目单：

example.main: What’s your favourite TV programme?你最喜欢的电视节目是什么?
a concert programme音乐会节目单

phrase.main: 活动安排：

example.main: I know nothing about the programme of the meeting.我对会议的议程一无所知。

phrase.main: 课程：

example.main: The program broadened students’ knowledge. 该课程增长了学生的见识。

phrase.main: (计算机) 程序：

example.main: Wechat mini programs微信小程序

phrase.main: 计划；安排；[program] 编程
程序员；程序师
进步；进展：

example.main: a progress report 进度报告
the progress of a project 工程进展
Thanks to her help, I made great progress in my study.多亏她帮忙，我在学习上取得了巨大的进步。

phrase.main: 前进；行进：

example.main: make swift progress toward the destination朝目的地迅速前进

phrase.main: 前进；进展：

example.main: Medical science is progressing rapidly in our country.我国的医学正在迅速发展。

phrase.main: 进步的；先进的：

example.main: progressive schools 先进的学校

phrase.main: 发展中的；(疾病) 逐渐恶化的：

example.main: progressive memory loss 逐渐失忆

phrase.main: [正式用语] [常用于被动语态] 禁止 (ban / forbid)：

example.main: Smoking is prohibited.禁止吸烟。
Visitors are prohibited from feeding the animals.禁止游客投喂动物。

phrase.main: 计划；工程；项目a carefully planned piece of work to get information about sth, to build sth, to improve sth, etc：

example.main: a three-year research project to investigate the harmful effects of air pollution一项为期三年调查空气污染危害的研究计划
Project Hope is a non-profit program that aims to provide education for children in underdeveloped areas.希望工程是一项旨在为贫困地区儿童提供教育的非营利性的事业。
a project manager项目经理

phrase.main: (学校的) 课题；专题研究：

example.main: We’re doing a science project on pollution.我们正在做一个关于污染的科研课题。

phrase.main: 规划；预计；放映：

example.main: project a film on a screen 在银幕上放映影片

phrase.main: [C]诺言；许诺；承诺：

example.main: his promise to his father他对父亲的承诺
break / make a / one’s promise违背诺言 / 作出承诺
keep / live up to a promise信守诺言
Don’t forget your promise to visit me next week. 别忘了你答应下周来看我。
Give me your promise that you’ll never be late again. 答应我你绝不再迟到了。

phrase.main: [U](有) 指望；(有) 前途：

example.main: Her work shows great promise. 她的工作很有前途。

phrase.main: vt & vi 许诺；保证；答应：

example.main: — She’s not coming tonight. 她今晚不来了。
— But she promised. 但她答应过的。
The new monitor promised to do the best she could for us all.新班长承诺会为我们大家竭尽全力。
I promise that you will get all your money back. 我保证你会拿回你所有的钱。

form.main: promise sb sth / promise sth to sb:

example.main: She has been promised a new bike. 有人答应给她买辆新自行车。
I’ve promised the book to Susan. 我已经答应把这本书给苏珊了。

phrase.main: vt有...的希望；有...的可能：

example.main: Those clouds promise rain tomorrow. 那些云预示着明天有可能下雨。
A timely snow promises a good harvest.瑞雪兆丰年。
It promises to be a fine day. 天气有望好转。

phrase.main: 促进；推动to help sth to happen or develop (encourage)：

example.main: promote international cooperation 促进国际合作
promote traditional cultures / festivals弘扬传统文化 / 传承传统节日
All our projects aim to promote the development of poor and remote communities.我们所有的项目都旨在促进贫困和偏远社区的发展。
We must promote originality, inspire creativity and encourage innovation.我们必须提倡独创性，激发创造力，鼓励创新。
Good listening can show respect, promote understanding, and improve interpersonal relationship.认真倾听可以表示尊重，增进理解，并改善人际关系。

phrase.main: [常用于被动语态]晋升：

example.main: He has been promoted to general manager. 他已被提升为总经理。
While waiting for the opportunity to get promoted, Henry did his best to perform his duty.在等待升迁机会的同时，亨利竭力做好自己的工作。

phrase.main: 促销；推广：

example.main: What is the advertisement promoting? 这则广告在推销什么？

phrase.main: [C] & [U] 晋升；推销；[U] 促进：

example.main: get a promotion 获得晋升

phrase.main: 及时的；准时的；迅速的
发...的音；读 (音)：

example.main: I can pronounce twenty-four distinct vowel sounds. 我能读出24个不同的元音。

phrase.main: 读音；发音：

example.main: Every competitor should speak fluent English with correct pronunciation.所有参赛者都应发音标准、英语流利。

phrase.main: [C] & [U]证据；证明 (evidence)：

example.main: There is no proof that he was on the crime spot. 没有证据证明他当时在犯罪现场。
proof of identity / purchase身份证明 / 购物证明
There is no proof that a falling apple hit Newton on the head.没有证据表明掉落的苹果击中了牛顿的头。
provide / give proof提供证据
concrete / living proof确切的证据 / 活生生的证明

phrase.main: [C] [常用复数]（印刷物的）校样：

example.main: The editor was checking the proofs of a book.编辑正在检查一本书的校样。

phrase.main: [只用于名词前]适当的；恰当的：

example.main: People today spend much time seeking the proper way to raise children. 如今，人们花很多时间寻求恰当的育儿方法。
He wore proper clothes for the party.他穿着得体，参加了聚会。

phrase.main: 合乎体统的

example.main: His mother has trained him to be a very proper young man. 他的母亲已经把他训练成一个举止得体的年轻人。

phrase.main: 正确地；适当地；恰当地 (right)：

example.main: She thinks that children must eat properly as they are growing all the time.她认为儿童必须合理饮食，因为他们正处于生长发育阶段。

phrase.main: 合乎礼仪地：

example.main: behave properly 举止得体

phrase.main: 真正地；实际上；严格地：

example.main: properly speaking (= really)严格说来 / 实际上

phrase.main: [U]所有物；财产；资产；(房) 地产：

example.main: intellectual property知识产权
Information is our most important property. 知识是我们最重要的财产。

phrase.main: [C] [常用复数] [正式用语]性质；性能；特性：

example.main: As a botanist, he takes notes on the properties of any plant he encounters.作为一名植物学家，他会记录下他遇到的任何植物的特性。

phrase.main: [U] 比例；比；[C] 部分；份额：

example.main: The proportion of boys to girls in our club is two to one.我们俱乐部的男女比例是二比一。

phrase.main: [C] & [U] 均衡；相称：

example.main: Children have large eyes in proportion to their heads.与脑袋相比，孩子们的眼睛显得很大。

phrase.main: 建议；提议a formal suggestion or plan：

example.main: put forward a proposal提出建议
He made a proposal that the meeting (should) be postponed.他提议会议延期。
accept / approve / oppose / reject a proposal接受 / 通过 / 反对 / 否决建议
a proposal for a new school club关于学校新俱乐部的提案
the proposal to build more affordable houses建造更多经济适用房的提议

phrase.main: [C] 求婚：

example.main: She accepted / turned down his proposal of marriage.她接受 / 拒绝了他的求婚。

phrase.main: vt[正式用语] 提出；提议；建议to formally suggest sth as a possible plan or action：

example.main: propose a better solution提出更好的解决方案
The report proposes extending motorways.该报告建议拓宽机动车道。
A professor at the Academy has proposed that a fund (should) be established to raise money.学院的一位教授提议设立基金会来募集资金。

phrase.main: vt[正式用语] 打算；计划to intend to do sth：

example.main: He proposed buying / to buy a new car.他打算买一辆新车。

phrase.main: vi & vt求婚：

example.main: I’ve proposed to her.我已经向她求婚了。

phrase.main: [C] [正式用语] (尤指从高处看到的) 景象；景色：

example.main: Behind him the full moon shone down over a distant prospect of great green hills.他身后，圆月当空，旷野下峰峦叠翠。

phrase.main: [U] & [C] 可能性the possibility that sth will happen：

example.main: There's little prospect of better weather before next week.下周之前天气不大可能好转。
There is a real prospect that we will win the game.我们很可能会赢得比赛。

phrase.main: [单数] 展望；设想an idea of what might or will happen in the future：

example.main: The prospect of welcoming exchange students to our country is very exciting.想到迎接交换生来到我们的国家，我就兴奋不已。
She was overjoyed at the prospect of visiting Paris.一想到要去巴黎，她就开心得不得了。

phrase.main: [C] [用复数] 成功的机会；前景；前途the chances of being successful：

example.main: job / career prospects职业前景
There are good prospects for growth in the e-commerce industry.电子商务行业有很好的发展前景。

phrase.main: 兴旺；繁荣：

example.main: Peace brings prosperity.和平带来繁荣。

phrase.main: 繁荣的；兴旺的：

example.main: We should all work hard to help make our country prosperous.我们都应该努力使祖国繁荣昌盛。

phrase.main: vt & vi 保护；防护：

example.main: protect the earth保护地球
We put a sheet of plastic across the floor to protect us from the damp.我们在地板上铺了一块塑料膜以防潮。
Something must be done to protect the environment from being polluted.必须采取措施以保护环境免受污染。
Snow is welcomed by most farmers because it can protect crops from cold fronts and keep the lands warm.多数农民期盼降雪，因为雪可以保护农作物免受冷锋的影响，并使土地保温。
Physical exercise can protect you against heart disease.体育锻炼可以预防心脏病。
Waxing your car will help protect against rust.给车打蜡可以防止生锈。

phrase.main: [U] 保护；防护：

example.main: environmental protection环境保护
fire / flood / sun protection防火/防洪/防晒
under the protection of在…的保护下

phrase.main: [C] 防护物：

example.main: various protections against fire各种防火设施

phrase.main: 给予保护的；保护的
蛋白质
vi & vt（公开）抗议；反对：

example.main: protest a decision (AmE)反对一项决定
Animal rights activists protested against keeping wild animals in unnatural conditions.动物保护主义者反对在非自然条件下养野生动物。
protest at / about / against sth抗议 / 反对某事

phrase.main: vt坚持声称；坚决表示to say sth firmly：

example.main: “That's not true,” he protested.“那不是真的。”他争辩说。
Sarah protested that she wasn't Jim's girlfriend.萨拉坚持说自己不是吉姆的女朋友。

phrase.main: 抗议；反对：

example.main: The film director resigned in protest at the decision.电影导演辞职以抗议此决定。
The workers organized a protest against the wage cut.工人们组织了反对减薪的抗议活动。
a public / peaceful / violent protest公开 / 和平 / 强烈抗议
a protest march / movement抗议游行 / 运动

phrase.main: 骄傲的；自豪的

example.main: a proud look得意的表情
We are very proud of ourselves and believe we can do more for a better world.我们非常自豪，并相信为了让世界更美好，我们可以做得更多。
She is proud to have taken part in competitions and to have broken a record.她对自己参加比赛并打破了纪录感到自豪。
She was proud that her daughter had so much talent.女儿这么有天赋，她很自豪。

phrase.main: [含贬义] 妄自尊大的；自负的：

example.main: She is too proud to see her own mistake.她太自负了，看不到自己的错误。

phrase.main: vt证明；证实：

example.main: Riis believed that poverty caused crime, and he used photos to help him prove his point.理斯认为贫穷导致犯罪，他还借助照片来证明自己的观点。
Just give me a chance and I’ll prove it to you.给我一个机会，我会证明给你看。

form.main: prove sb / sth (to be) + adj / n:

example.main: They put me in prison, but, in the end, I was proved innocent.他们把我关进监狱，但我最终被证明是清白的。
He proved himself (to be) a better driver than the world champion.他证明了自己的驾驶技术胜过世界冠军。
Sarah wants to prove that she has brains as well as beauty.萨拉想证明她既有美貌，又有头脑。
The challenge proved how difficult it is to drive across a desert without guidance.这个挑战证明在没有引导的情况下开车穿越沙漠是多么的困难。
It has been proved that eating vegetables in childhood helps to protect you against serious illnesses in later life.经证实，童年时吃蔬菜有助于日后不生大病。
When I first started this job, I felt I had to prove myself.我刚开始干这份工作的时候，觉得必须证明一下自己的实力。

phrase.main: [用作系动词] 证明是；被发现是 (turn out)：

example.main: The book has proved very successful.事实证明了这本书非常成功。
He proved to be an honest friend.事实表明他是一个诚实的朋友。

phrase.main: 提供；供应：

example.main: Working out in the morning provides additional benefits beyond being physically fit.晨练不仅能保持身体健康，还能给我们带来其他的好处。
Community schools provide good quality education for children.社区学校为孩子们提供高质量的教育。
The job will provide me with a good chance to show my talent.这份工作将为我提供展示自己才华的好机会。
This is a group that specializes in providing housing and services to needy people.这是一个专门为贫困的人提供住房和服务的团队。

phrase.main: 省；行政区
心理 (学) 的
心理 (学) 地；精神上地
心理学家
心理学；心理；心理特征
酒吧；酒馆
[只用于名词前] 大众的；公众的：

example.main: a danger to public health对大众健康的危害
The media has a powerful influence on public opinion.媒体对公众舆论有很大的影响力。

phrase.main: [只用于名词前]公立的；公务的；公共的：

example.main: a public library / school公立图书馆 / 学校
a public official / servant公务员
public transport / transportation公共交通(工具)
“No Smoking” signs will be put up in the public places.“禁止吸烟”的标识将会张贴在公共场所。

phrase.main: 公开的；众所周知的：

example.main: Being a public figure today is a lot more difficult than it used to be.如今，做一名公众人物要比过去难多了。
Some of the world’s heaviest pumpkins were on public display in New York for a few days.一些世界上最重的南瓜在纽约公开展出了几天。

phrase.main: 公众；民众：

example.main: The news shocked the public, leading to great concern about students’ safety at school.这则消息使公众感到震惊，引起了人们对学生在校安全的极大关注。

phrase.main: [U] 出版；[C] 出版物：

example.main: He spent his holiday writing reviews for publication.假期里他写了几篇评论准备发表。
a weekly publication周刊

phrase.main: [U] 发表；公布：

example.main: the publication of the exam results考试成绩的公布

phrase.main: vt出版；发行：

example.main: The company has published all of that author’s works.这家公司已经出版了那位作者的全部著作。

phrase.main: vt & vi刊登 / 发表 (作品)：

example.main: The results of his experiments were published in China in 1966.1966年，他的实验结果在中国发表。

phrase.main: 出版商
布丁；甜食；甜点心
拉；拖：

example.main: Pull the door open. Don’t push it.把门拉开，不要推。
She pulled the chair towards her.她把椅子拖到自己身边。

phrase.main: 拔 (出)；抽 (出)：

example.main: She has to have two teeth pulled.她必须拔掉两颗牙。

phrase.main: (使) (车、船等) 移动：

example.main: My husband pulled our camper out of the garage.我丈夫把野营车从车库中开了出来。

phrase.main: 吸引：

example.main: The commercial pulled young people to the new product.这则广告引起了年轻人对这款新产品的关注。

phrase.main: 拉：

example.main: Give a pull at the rope.拉一下绳子。
I can do ten pull-ups one minute.我一分钟能做十个引体向上。

phrase.main: 脉搏：

example.main: take / feel sb’s pulse测某人的脉搏

phrase.main: 强烈而有规律地跳动；搏动
泵；抽水机；打气筒
抽 (水)；给...打气：

example.main: Pump water from a well.从井里抽水。

phrase.main: 故事、笑话等中的妙语；关键语
准时的；守时的：(on time)：

example.main: Being punctual for classes was essential; no one was allowed to be late.按时到校上课是最基本的要求，任何人都不允许迟到。

phrase.main: 标点法；标点符号
惩罚；处罚：

example.main: be heavily / severely / justly punished by law受到法律的严重/严厉/公正惩罚
The students were punished for cheating on the exam.这些学生因为考试作弊而受到惩罚。

phrase.main: 惩罚；处罚；刑罚：

example.main: escape punishment逃避惩罚
Mum says I had better pass my exams, or she will sell the computer as (a) punishment.妈妈说我最好通过考试，否则她会把电脑卖掉以示惩罚。

phrase.main: 普诺 (秘鲁)
小学生；学生；瞳孔：

example.main: When we look at something nice, our pupils get bigger.我们看见好东西时，瞳孔会放大。

phrase.main: 买；购买；(以努力等) 换得：

example.main: Tickets may be purchased in advance from the box office.可以预先在售票处买票。
They purchased freedom with their blood.他们以鲜血换得了自由。

phrase.main: 购买；购买的物品：

example.main: purchase and sale买卖
That’s really a good purchase.这个买得真值啊！

phrase.main: 纯的；纯粹的：

example.main: pure gold / English纯金/纯正的英语

phrase.main: 纯洁的；纯净的：

example.main: pure water纯净的水
The air is very pure, and it doesn’t snow very much.这里的空气非常清新，而且很少下雪。

phrase.main: [只用于名词前，无比较级] 完全的；十足的：

example.main: by pure chance纯属偶然

phrase.main: 紫的；紫红的
紫色；紫红色
[C]目的；目标the intention or aim of sth：

example.main: What’s the purpose of your visit to London?你去伦敦的目的是什么？
For the purpose of helping protect Grand Canyon, please follow the guidelines below.为了有助于保护大峡谷，请遵守如下准则。
Work gives you meaning and purpose and life is empty without it.工作给了你意义和目标。没有工作的人生是空虚的。

phrase.main: [C] 用途；作用the function of sth：

example.main: Tears serve no purpose.眼泪无济于事。
I haven’t got a pen, but a pencil can serve / answer the same purpose.我没带钢笔，不过用铅笔也一样。

phrase.main: [C] [常用复数]用意；需要 what is needed in a particular situation：

example.main: Using animals for medical purposes should be avoided.应避免用动物做医学实验。
She invited people to donate tissue samples for research purposes everywhere she went.无论她去哪儿，都请求人们捐献组织样本用于研究。

phrase.main: [C] & [U]意义：

example.main: Volunteer work gives her life a sense of purpose.志愿者工作让她的生活有了意义。

phrase.main: 钱包；(女用) 手提小包；[单数] 资金；财源：

example.main: the public purse政府经费

phrase.main: 追赶；追捕：

example.main: pursue a thief 追小偷

phrase.main: 追求：

example.main: pursue a goal / an aim / an objective追求目标
She decided to pursue a career in medicine.她决定从医。
Lily decided that she would settle in New York and pursue her dream of becoming an actress.莉莉决定在纽约定居，追求她当演员的梦想。
Jack had been pursuing her for months without success.杰克已经追求她好几个月了，但没有成功。
pursue an interest追求兴趣

phrase.main: 继续进行to continue (doing) sth：

example.main: A good reporter will pursue a story until he or she knows all the facts.好的记者会一直追踪报道直到了解所有的事实为止。
We will pursue this policy with determination.我们将坚决贯彻这项政策。
I don't think this idea is worth pursuing any further.我认为这个主意不值得再继续考虑了。

phrase.main: vt & vi推 (动) 【反:pull】；按下 (press)：

example.main: She pushed the door open and showed the doctor in.她推开门把大夫领了进来。
She pushed her hair back from her forehead.她把头发从前额往后拨。
push the button按下按钮

phrase.main: vt & vi挤；推挤：

example.main: We pushed through the crowd.我们从人群中挤过。
They pushed their way into the train looking for seats.他们挤上火车寻找座位。

phrase.main: vt劝说；鼓励：

example.main: My teacher pushed me into entering the competition.我的老师鼓励我参加比赛。

phrase.main: vt逼迫；催促：

example.main: Set your alarm clock an hour early and push yourself to work out!把你的闹钟调前一小时，强迫自己去锻炼。
Athletes push themselves to the extreme limit of their body to complete the over 42 kilometers race.要完成超过42千米的赛程，运动员需要把自己的体能发挥到极限。

phrase.main: 推；推动；推进：

example.main: Give the gate a push and it will open. 大门一推就开。
The good news gave us a push.这个喜讯给了我们动力。
do push-ups做俯卧撑

phrase.main: 放 (置) (place)；安装；把...送往：

example.main: Put a little more sugar in this coffee, will you? 请再往这杯咖啡里加点糖，好吗？
I had to put a new lock on the door. 我只好给门安装了新锁。
In 1969 the Americans put a man on the moon.1969年美国人把人送上了月球。

phrase.main: 写上；标上；注上：

example.main: I couldn’t read what she had put in the diary.我看不懂她日记里写了什么。

phrase.main: 说；表达：

example.main: He was too trusting — or, to put it another way, he had no head for business. 他太轻信人了，换句话说，他没有商业头脑。
Put simply, we accept their offer or go bankrupt. 简言之，我们要么接受他们的条件，要么破产。
As news report put it, when women joined the organization it took on a new look.正如报道所言，女性加入那个组织后，其面貌焕然一新。

phrase.main: 提出：

example.main: put a question提出一个问题

phrase.main: 使处于 (某种状态)：

example.main: Put yourself in my position. What would you have done? 站在我的立场，你会怎么办？
I'm afraid we have to put you on a strict diet.恐怕我们得严格控制你的饮食。

phrase.main: 认为；把…视为：

example.main: I put Hemingway among my favourite authors. 我将海明威视为我最喜爱的作家之一。
I put my family before my job. 我把家庭看得比工作重要。
put sb / sth first把某人 / 某事物放在首位

phrase.main: 难题；谜；拼图游戏：

example.main: Why Mona Lisa is smiling is still a puzzle. 蒙娜丽莎为什么微笑仍然是个谜。

phrase.main: 使迷惑：

Responsibility and reliability are necessary qualifications, as well as a friendly and outgoing personality.责任感和可靠性是必需的素质，友善和外向的性格也必不可少。

phrase.main: vt & vi（通过某种考试）具有资格；（使）合格；取得参赛资格：

phrase.main: 文静的；少言寡语的 (silent)：

Earth Day, marked on 22 April, is an annual event aiming to raise public awareness about environmental protection.每年4月22日是世界地球日，是旨在提高公众环境保护意识的活动。

phrase.main: vt & vi阅读；朗读：

example.main: Her books are quite widely read. 她的书有很多人阅读。
He liked reading Harry Potter to his grandchildren.他喜欢给孙子孙女读《哈利·波特》。

phrase.main: vt理解；读懂：

example.main: read the street signs 看懂路标
read sb’s thoughts / mind看透某人的心思

phrase.main: vt(指示牌等) 写着 (say)；(仪器等) 显示；(计算机)读取：

example.main: read the disk 读取磁盘
“Absolutely no smoking,” the sign reads. 告示牌上写着“严禁吸烟”。

phrase.main: vi & vt读到；获悉：

example.main: I was shocked when I read about / of his death in today’s newspaper. 当我从今天的报纸上获悉他的死讯时，感到很震惊。

phrase.main: vi读起来：

example.main: Written communications can often read as cold and dull.书面信息通常读起来既冷淡又乏味。

phrase.main: 阅读；读物：

example.main: Reading makes a full man; conference a ready man; and writing an exact man. 读书使人充实，讨论使人机敏，写作使人严谨。
I borrowed a bit of light reading for my holiday. 我借了一些假期里看的轻松读物。

phrase.main: [不用于名词前] 准备好的：

example.main: Come on! Aren’t you ready yet? 快点儿！你还没准备好吗？
Have you got ready for the exam? 你做好考试的准备了吗？

form.main: be / get ready to do sth:

example.main: Everything is packed, and we are ready to leave. 东西都打包好了，我们准备走了。

phrase.main: [只用于名词前] 迅速的；现成的：

example.main: a ready answer现成的答案

phrase.main: 愿意的；乐意的：

example.main: I’m kind, easy-going and always ready to help others.我亲切、随和，总是乐于助人。

phrase.main: 易于...的：

example.main: Don’t be so ready to find fault. 不要动不动就挑毛病。

phrase.main: 真的；真实的；真正的：

example.main: in real life 在现实生活中
the real world现实世界
a real friend真正的朋友

phrase.main: 实现；使...成为现实：

example.main: realize one’s dreams / hopes / ambitions 实现某人的梦想/希望/抱负
Her wish to become a doctor was finally realized.她当医生的愿望终于实现了。

phrase.main: [通常不用于进行时] 认识到；意识到to understand or become aware of sth or that sth has happened, usually some time later：

example.main: — Can you turn down the TV? I’m preparing for the test.你能把电视音量调小点吗？我正在准备考试。
— Oh, sorry, I didn’t realize that.哦，对不起，我没意识到那一点。
Not everyone has realized that wildlife has thoughts, feelings, and most importantly, equal rights to survive.并不是每个人都意识到野生动物有思想和感觉，最重要的是，（它们）也有平等的生存权。
I never realized how hard it is to run on sand.我从来没有意识到在沙滩上跑步有多么困难。

phrase.main: 现实主义的；逼真的：

example.main: a realistic novel 现实主义小说
a realistic painting逼真的画作

phrase.main: 现实的；务实的；（目标、希望）能够实现的：

example.main: a realistic plan / goal切实可行的计划 / 目标
You need to be realistic about your chances of winning.你对自己的获胜机会要现实一点。
It is not realistic to expect high grades in such a short time.指望在这么短的时间内得高分是不现实的。

phrase.main: 真实；现实；事实：

example.main: a reality show真人秀节目
virtual / augmented / mixed reality虚拟现实 (VR) / 增强现实 (AR) / 混合 (MR)
This is not imagination, but reality. 这不是想象，而是现实。
She refuses to face reality.她不肯面对现实。
Will time travel ever become a reality?时光旅行真的会变成现实吗？

phrase.main: 实现；使...成为现实：

example.main: realize one’s dreams / hopes / ambitions 实现某人的梦想/希望/抱负
Her wish to become a doctor was finally realized.她当医生的愿望终于实现了。

phrase.main: [通常不用于进行时态] 认识到；意识到to understand or become aware of sth or that sth has happened, usually some time later：

example.main: — Can you turn down the TV? I’m preparing for the test.你能把电视音量调小点吗？我正在准备考试。
— Oh, sorry, I didn’t realize that. 哦，对不起，我没意识到那一点。
Not everyone has realized that wildlife has thoughts, feelings, and most importantly, equal rights to survive.并不是每个人都意识到野生动物有思想和有感觉，最重要的是，（它们）也有平等的生存权。
I never realized how hard it is to run on sand. 我从来没有意识到在沙滩上跑步有多么困难。

phrase.main: 真实地；确实：

example.main: I really don’t know what to write about. 我真的不知道写什么。

phrase.main: 非常；极其 (extremely)：

example.main: I haven’t got much sleep this past week, and I feel really tired.上周我没怎么睡觉，感觉非常疲倦。

phrase.main: [表示关心、惊讶、怀疑等] 当真：

example.main: — We’re going to the Great Wall next week. 我们下周要去长城。
— Oh, really? 哦，真的吗？

phrase.main: [C] 原因；理由：

example.main: If you see no reason for giving thanks, the fault lies in yourself.如果你找不到感恩的理由，错在你自己。
The reason why he didn’t pass the driving test is lacking practice.他没通过驾驶考试的原因是缺乏练习。
Cities usually have a good reason for being where they are, like a nearby port or river.城市坐落在何处通常都是有充分理由的，比如靠近港口或河流。

phrase.main: [U] 道理；情理sensible judgment and understanding：

example.main: There is reason in what you say. 你讲得有道理。

phrase.main: vi 推理；劝说；辩论：

example.main: Reasoning with them is a waste of time. 和他们讲道理是浪费时间。

phrase.main: vt 推断；推论：

example.main: We reasoned (that) if we started early in the morning, we would get there by noon.我们推断如果一大早出发的话，中午之前就能到达那里。

phrase.main: 有道理的；合情理的：

example.main: I tried to be reasonable even though I was very angry.虽然我非常生气，但我还是尽量讲道理。

phrase.main: (价钱) 公道的 (fair)：

example.main: Ten pounds for a good dictionary seems reasonable enough. 花10英镑买一部好词典，价钱算是够公道的了。

phrase.main: [常用于名词前]尚好的；过得去的 (average)：

example.main: We have a strong team and a reasonable chance of winning the game. 我们的团队很有实力，很有可能赢得比赛。

phrase.main: 再生；复活；复兴
重建；重新装配；使复原：

example.main: The streets are clear, and many houses have been rebuilt.街道整洁一新，重建了许多房屋

phrase.main: vt 召回；叫回；收回：

example.main: More than 3,000 cars were recalled yesterday because of a brake problem.昨天3 000多辆汽车因为刹车问题被召回。
The commander was recalled from the frontline.指挥官被从前线召回。
Time lost cannot be recalled.时光一去不复返。

phrase.main: vt & vi［正式用语］［不用于进行时］回忆起；回想起：

example.main: I don't recall what I got for my first Christmas.我记不得收到的第一个圣诞礼物是什么。
I can’t recall (that) we’ve met before.我想不起来我们曾经见过面。
“Comfort food” often makes up for bad feelings by helping us recall happy memories of the people, things or places we love.“治愈系食物”常常通过帮我们回忆起所爱之人、所爱之物、所爱之地的快乐往事，来消解不良情绪。
Two people in the flat recalled hearing a loud crash about 1.30 a.m.公寓里的两个人回忆道，大约凌晨1点30分听到一声巨响。

phrase.main: vt［不用于进行时］使想起：

example.main: The danger recalled him to a sense of duty.危险唤起了他的责任感。

phrase.main: [U] 收到：

example.main: We are in receipt of your letter. 我们已收到您的来函。

phrase.main: [C] 收据；收条：

example.main: make out / write a receipt 开收据

phrase.main: [复数] 收到的款项；收入
收到；受到：

example.main: receive a present 收到礼物
He received severe punishment for breaking the law.他因违法而受到严重的惩罚。

phrase.main: 接纳；承认：

example.main: It is reported that the film is well received outside China.据报道，这部电影在国外很受欢迎。

phrase.main: 接待；接见：

example.main: receive foreign guests 接待/接见外宾

phrase.main: 容纳；承受：

example.main: The hall can receive 4,000 people.这个大厅能容纳4 000人。

phrase.main: 收件人；接待者；听筒；接收机：

example.main: a radio receiver 无线电接收器

phrase.main: 最近的；近来的：

example.main: In recent years, learning Chinese has become popular among people around the world.近年来，学习汉语在世界各地的人当中流行起来。

phrase.main: 近来；最近not long ago：

example.main: I caught a bad cold recently. 我最近得了重感冒。

phrase.main: [C] [常用单数] 接待；欢迎；反响：

example.main: He got a warm reception from the crowd. 他受到了人群的热烈欢迎。
His latest album has met with mixed reception from fans. 歌迷对他的最新专辑反响各异。

phrase.main: [U] 接待处；前台：

example.main: Please leave your key at the reception desk. 请把你的钥匙放在前台。

phrase.main: [C] 招待会；欢迎会；宴会：

example.main: a wedding reception婚宴

phrase.main: [U] (无线电等的) 接收效果：

example.main: There was very poor reception on my cell phone.我手机的信号很差。

phrase.main: 接待员
食谱；秘诀：

example.main: — Can you tell us your recipe for happiness and a long life?您能告诉我们您快乐和长寿的秘诀吗？
— Living every day to the full, definitely.当然是充分度过每一天。

phrase.main: vt & vi 背诵；朗诵；详述：

example.main: recite a poem背诗

phrase.main: 认为；估计
[不用于进行时]认出；辨认出：

example.main: The film star wears sunglasses. Therefore, he can go shopping without being recognized. 这位影星戴着太阳镜，这样他就可以去购物而不被认出来。

phrase.main: 意识到to accept or admit that sth is true：

example.main: I recognize my own shortcomings.我承认我自己的缺点。
We recognized that the task was not easy.我们意识到这个任务并不容易。

phrase.main: (正式) 承认；公认；

example.main: The British recognized America as an independent state. 英国承认美国为一个独立的国家。
Arthur Miller is universally recognized as one of the greatest dramatists of the 20th century.阿瑟·米勒被公认为是20世纪最伟大的剧作家之一。

phrase.main: 赞赏；赏识；表彰：

example.main: The Canadian National Institute for the Blind recognized Doris Low for her great contributions.加拿大国家盲人协会因其重大贡献表彰了多丽丝·娄。

phrase.main: 认出；认识；识别：

example.main: facial / speech recognition面部 / 语音识别
The town has changed beyond all recognition since I was last here.自从我上次离开这里，这座小城已变得让人认不出来了。

phrase.main: [常用单数]承认；认可：

example.main: recognition of the importance of career planning认识到职业规划的重要性
seek international / official / formal recognition寻求国际上的 / 官方的 / 正式的承认
There is general recognition that the study techniques of many students are weak.人们普遍意识到很多学生的学习技能薄弱。

phrase.main: 赞赏；赏识；表彰：

example.main: She has been awarded with many awards in recognition of her services to the society.她对社会的贡献使她得到广泛的赞扬，并获得了很多殊荣。

phrase.main: [不用于进行时]认出；辨认出：

example.main: The film star wears sunglasses. Therefore, he can go shopping without being recognized.这位影星戴着太阳镜，这样他就可以去购物而不被认出来。

phrase.main: 意识到to accept or admit that sth is true：

example.main: I recognize my own shortcomings.我承认我自己的缺点。
We recognized that the task was not easy.我们意识到这个任务并不容易。

phrase.main: （正式）承认；公认 (acknowledge)：

example.main: The British recognized America as an independent state. 英国承认美国为一个独立的国家。
Arthur Miller is universally recognized as one of the greatest dramatists of the 20th century.阿瑟·米勒被公认为是20世纪最伟大的剧作家之一。

phrase.main: 赞赏；赏识；表彰：

example.main: The Canadian National Institute for the Blind recognized Doris Low for her great contributions.加拿大国家盲人协会因其重大贡献表彰了多丽丝·娄。

phrase.main: 推荐；介绍to say that sb / sth is good and that sb should try or use them for it (suggest)：

example.main: I don’t know what to read. Can you recommend anything? 我不知道该读些什么，你能推荐点什么吗？
This hotel is highly recommended. 强烈推荐这家酒店。
A balanced diet featuring fresh seasonal vegetables is highly recommended.强烈建议吃含有新鲜时令蔬菜为主的均衡饮食。
I recommend this book to anyone with an interest in art. 我把这本书推荐给对艺术感兴趣的人。
She was recommended for the post by a colleague.一位同事推荐她担任这个职位。

phrase.main: 劝告；建议to advise sb to do sth or should do sth：

example.main: Teachers recommend parents not allow their children under 12 to ride bicycles to school for safety.为了安全起见，老师建议家长不要让12岁以下的孩子骑自行车上学。
The doctor recommended me to take a long rest. 医生劝我长期休养。
I recommend meeting him first.我建议先见见他。

phrase.main: [U] 推荐；介绍：

example.main: a letter of recommendation 推荐信

phrase.main: [C] 正式建议；推荐信：

example.main: follow sb’s recommendations听从某人的建议

phrase.main: 记录；把 (声音、影像等) 录下：

example.main: In a journal, writers also record their experiences.在日志中，作者也记录他们的经历。
Musicians record their songs in a studio. 音乐家在录音棚录制歌曲。

phrase.main: 记录；记载；履历：

example.main: Keep a record of what interests you most. 记下你最感兴趣的事。
a personal record 个人履历

phrase.main: (尤指体育运动的) 纪录：

example.main: in record time用最短的时间
She set a new world record in the 200-meter dash.她创造了200米短跑的新世界纪录。

phrase.main: 唱片：

example.main: make a record录制唱片

phrase.main: 录音机
vt(意识、知觉等) 恢复to get back the use of your senses, control of your emotion, etc.：

example.main: recover oneself 恢复知觉
It took her a few minutes to recover consciousness.过了几分钟她才恢复意识。

phrase.main: vi(从疾病或病态等中) 恢复过来to get well again after being ill, hurt, etc.; to return to a normal state：

example.main: With my special care, my mother recovered quickly.在我的精心照料下，妈妈很快就康复了。
The economy is at last beginning to recover. 经济终于开始复苏了。
How can Linda recover from her illness in this room when it’s so dirty and dusty?在这样一间落满灰尘的脏屋子里，琳达怎能康复呢？

phrase.main: vt重新获得to find or get back sth that was lost or stolen：

example.main: Police have recovered the stolen car. 警察已找回被盗的汽车。
We worked hard to recover the lost time. 我们努力工作以弥补失去的时间。

phrase.main: 痊愈；重获；复苏：

example.main: He has made a full recovery from his operation.手术后他已完全康复。
an economic recovery 经济复苏

phrase.main: [U] 消遣；娱乐；[C] 娱乐 / 消遣活动：

example.main: We play basketball once a week for recreation. 我们每周打一次篮球作为娱乐。

phrase.main: 矩形；长方形
长方形的；矩形的
vt & vi(使) 再循环；回收利用：

example.main: Steel, iron, glass, cloth and paper can all be recycled.钢、铁、玻璃、布和纸都可以回收再利用。

phrase.main: 红色的；(因尴尬或生气) 通红的：

example.main: He turned / went red with anger. 他气得脸通红。

phrase.main: [象征左派革命、共产主义] 红的；赤的：

example.main: the Red Army 红军

phrase.main: 红色：

example.main: a little girl in red 穿着红衣服的小女孩

phrase.main: vt & vi缩减；减少 (cut)：

example.main: The price has been reduced from $10 to $8. 价格已经从10美元降低到8美元。
Eating just one carrot a day can reduce the possibility of getting this disease by 40%.每天吃一根胡萝卜就可以将患这种病的几率减少40%。

phrase.main: 缩减；减少：

example.main: strategies for noise reduction减少噪音的对策

phrase.main: 裁判员；仲裁人
[C] & [U] 提及；涉及：

example.main: Avoid making any reference to his illness. 千万别提起他的病。

phrase.main: [U] 查阅；参考：

example.main: Here is a memo for your reference when you answer the phones. 这儿有一本备忘录供你接电话的时候参考。
reference books参考书

phrase.main: [C] 推荐信；推荐人
[C] 参考书目：

example.main: A list of references must be included.必须包括参考书目。

phrase.main: vt & vi反射 (光、热、声等)：

example.main: Without the forest cover, these areas would reflect more heat into the atmosphere, warming the rest of the world.如果没有森林覆盖，这些区域会向大气层反射更多的热量，使世界上其他地区变暖。

phrase.main: vt[常用于被动语态] (镜子等) 映出：

example.main: Her face was reflected in the mirror. 镜子中映出她的脸。

phrase.main: vt[通常不用于进行时] 反映：

example.main: Mid-Autumn celebrations reflect Chinese cultural traditions. 中秋节庆祝活动反映了中国的文化传统。

phrase.main: vi & vt反思；回想；仔细考虑：

example.main: On the way home he reflected that the interview had gone well.在回家的路上，他想这次面试进行得很顺利。
I reflect on / upon how my day's gone and think about the rest of the week.我反思一下我这一天是如何度过的，并思考着这周剩下几天怎么过。

phrase.main: [U] 反射：

example.main: the reflection of a sound wave 声波的反射

phrase.main: [C] 映像：

example.main: the reflection of the trees in the lake 湖面映出树的倒影

phrase.main: [C] 反映：

example.main: On some level, a student’s grades are a reflection on the teacher. 在某种程度上，学生的成绩是老师水平的反映。

phrase.main: [C] & [U] 反复思考；仔细考虑
vt 改革；vt & vi (使) 改过自新：

example.main: reform an unfair system 改革不公正的制度
The criminal has promised to reform.这名罪犯保证要改过自新。

phrase.main: 改革；改造：

example.main: social / political / medical reform社会 / 政治变革 / 医疗改革
reform and opening-up改革开放

phrase.main: vt 使清新；使清爽；使恢复精力：

example.main: I refreshed myself with a cup of coffee.我喝了杯咖啡提提神。

phrase.main: vt & vi 刷新；更新：

example.main: Click here to refresh this document.点击此处以刷新文件。

phrase.main: 冰箱；冷藏库 (fridge)
退还 (钱款)：

example.main: We will refund your money if you’re not satisfied.如果您不满意我们会退款给您。

phrase.main: 退款
vt & vi拒绝；回绝 (turn down)：

example.main: refuse an invitation拒绝邀请
If given something you don’t want to eat, just refuse politely. 如果别人给你一些你不想吃的东西，你就礼貌地拒绝。
He refused to discuss things further. 他不愿意进一步讨论这些事。

phrase.main: [不用于进行时] 把...看作；认为...是to think about sb / sth in a particular way：

example.main: Some of the plants and animals have survived millions of years, and are regarded as living fossils.有些动植物已经存活了数百万年，被认为是活化石。
Even to this day, Lincoln is regarded as one of the most inspiring figures in the world.即使到今天，林肯仍被认为是全世界最具有感召力的人物之一。
Beijing / Peking Opera is regarded as China’s “national opera” with a history of some 200 years.京剧被认为是中国的“国剧”，至今已有约两百年历史。

phrase.main: [正式用语](尤指以某种方式) 注视；打量to look at sb / sth in a particular way：

example.main: She stood back and regarded him coldly. 她退后站着，冷冷地看着他。

phrase.main: [U] [正式用语] 尊重respect or admiration for sb / sth：

example.main: Burt had high regard for his old law professor.伯特对他原来的法律教授非常敬重。

phrase.main: [正式用语] 关注attention to or care for sb / sth：

example.main: She has no regard for other people’s feelings. 她无视别人的感受。

phrase.main: [用复数] 问候；致意：

example.main: Please give my regards to your parents. 请代我向你的父母问好。

derivative.main: prep [正式用语] (尤用于信函中) regarding

phrase.main: 不顾；不加理会
地区；地带；行政区：

example.main: Declining birth rate is a major problem in many developing regions too.不断下降的出生率也是许多发展中地区的一个主要问题。
Hong Kong Special Administrative Region香港特别行政区

phrase.main: （身体的）区域；部位：

example.main: the lower back region腰部
The young man said he had sharp pains in the stomach region / in the region of the stomach.这个年轻人说他胃部剧痛。

derivative.main: adj[常用于名词前] regional

phrase.main: 登记簿；出纳机：

example.main: a cash register现金出纳机
Visitors must sign the register at the front desk for each visit.访客每次来访都必须在前台登记。

phrase.main: [术语] [C] & [U] 语域；语体风格；[C] 声区；音区
登记；注册；记录to put sb's or sth's name on an official list：

example.main: registered users / nurses注册用户 / 护士
The class is filling up, so you'll need to register for it soon if you want to attend.这门课即将满员，如果你想参加的话，就得赶紧报名。
According to the law, all foreigners have to register with the local police within two weeks of arrival.根据法律规定，所有外国人必须在抵达后两周内向当地警方登记。

phrase.main: 显示（读数）：

example.main: The Wenchuan earthquake registered 8.0 on the Richter scale.汶川地震震级为里氏8.0级。

phrase.main: 后悔；懊悔to feel sorry about sth you have done ; to wish that you had not done sth：

example.main: He who will not learn when he is young will regret it when he is old. 少壮不努力，老大徒伤悲。
If we don't act now to protect the environment, we'll live to regret it (= we'll regret it in the future).如果我们现在不行动起来保护环境，将来就会后悔的。
He did not regret saying what he did but felt that he could have expressed it differently. 他并不后悔说出自己做了什么，而是觉得他本来可以换一种表达方式。
I regret that I didn’t follow your advice. 我真后悔没听你的劝告。
I deeply / bitterly / greatly regret what I said just now.我对刚才说的话感到非常后悔。

phrase.main: [正式用语] 抱歉；遗憾used to say in a formal way that you are sorry about a situation：

example.main: It is much to be regretted that you can’t join us in the trip. 你不能和我们一道去旅行，真是遗憾。
I regret that I will be unable to attend your party.很遗憾我不能参加你的聚会。
I regret to tell that you didn’t pass the examination.很遗憾地通知你，你没有通过考试。

phrase.main: 遗憾；悔恨：

example.main: I have no regrets about leaving. 我毫不后悔离开。
Much to my regret, I am unable to accept your kind invitation.非常遗憾，我不能接受你的盛情邀请。
It is with great / deep regret that I accept your resignation.接受你的辞呈，我感到非常遗憾。

phrase.main: 规则的； 有规律的； 定期的having the same amount of space or time between each thing or part：

example.main: The sides of the building aren’t regular. So the building has an unusual shape.这座大厦的侧面是不规则的，所以有着独特的造型。
The gardeners planted the trees at regular intervals. 园丁按固定的间距种树。
The equipment is checked on a regular basis. 设备定期进行检查。

phrase.main: [只用于名词前]经常的；频繁的happening or doing sth very often; frequent：

example.main: regular customers / readers常客 / 忠实读者
Healthy eating along with regular exercise is probably the only way to become fit.健康的饮食加上经常锻炼可能是健康的唯一途径。

phrase.main: [只用于名词前]正常的；惯常的；普通的：

example.main: a regular school / class普通学校/班
Our regular opening hours are 10 a.m. to 7 p.m. 我们正常的营业时间是从上午10点到晚上7点。

phrase.main: 持久的；稳定的lasting or happening over a long period：

example.main: Maybe a regular job won’t be as dull as I feared.一份固定的工作可能并不像我担心的那样乏味。

phrase.main: [语法] 规则的
有规律地；定期地；经常：

example.main: We meet regularly, once a month.我们每月一次定期见面。
I regularly get up at six in the morning.我通常早上六点钟起床。

phrase.main: 管理；控制：

example.main: regulate the traffic 管理交通
Many countries now have laws to regulate part-time employment for students.目前，许多国家已有法律来管理学生的兼职工作。

phrase.main: 调整；调节：

example.main: regulate a watch 校准手表

phrase.main: [C] 规则；法规：

example.main: fire / safety / building /school regulations防火条例 / 安全条例 / 建筑法规 / 学校规章制度

phrase.main: [U] 控制；管理：

example.main: the regulation of affairs 事务管理

phrase.main: 加强；强化
拒绝；排斥：

example.main: reject an argument / a claim / an offer拒绝接受论点 / 要求 / 提议
I’ve been rejected by all the universities I applied to.所有我申请的大学都没有录取我。

phrase.main: 冷落；嫌弃；厌弃
vt & vi(使) 互有关联 (connect)：

example.main: The report seeks to relate the rise in crime to an increase in unemployment.这篇报告试图证明犯罪活动的增加与失业率的上涨有关。
The chapter relates to the effects of the Internet on teenagers.这一章涉及到互联网对青少年的影响。

phrase.main: vt[正式用语] 叙述；讲：

example.main: He related how the accident happened. 他叙述了事故发生的经过。

phrase.main: vi理解；认同：

example.main: I love technology and try to keep up with it so I can relate to my students. 我热爱技术，并试图跟上技术的发展，因此我可以理解学生的想法。

phrase.main: 相关的；有关系的：

example.main: water-related diseases 与水有关的疾病

phrase.main: [C] & [U] 关系；联系 (relationship)：

example.main: The relation between them is that of teacher and pupil. 他们是师生关系。

phrase.main: [用复数] 交往；事务：

example.main: He established good relations with his neighbors.他和邻居建立了良好的关系。

phrase.main: [C]亲属；家属 (relative)：

example.main: a distant relation远亲

phrase.main: 关系；联系；爱情关系：

example.main: the relationship between teachers and students 师生关系
in close relationship with 与…有密切关系
have a direct relationship to 与…有直接关系
Are you in a relationship?你在恋爱吗？

phrase.main: [C] 亲戚 (relation)；相关物；亲缘动 / 植物：

example.main: friends and relatives亲友

phrase.main: [只用于名词前；无比较级变化] 相对的；比较的：

example.main: She is living in relative poverty. 她过着相对贫穷的生活。

phrase.main: [正式用语] 有关系的：

example.main: a question relative to my plan 与我的计划有关的问题

phrase.main: vt & vi(使) 放松：

example.main: Enjoying art and music is also a good way to relax.欣赏美术和音乐也是放松的好方法。
We get so much homework that I don’t have free time to relax. 我们有很多作业要做，没有空闲时间放松。

phrase.main: 放松；松弛
接替；接力赛：

example.main: the Olympic torch relay 奥运会火炬传递
a relay race 接力赛

phrase.main: 转播；传达：

example.main: In ancient times the Chinese used to relay messages along the Great Wall by lighting fires.在古代，中国人通过沿着长城点燃烽火传递信息。

phrase.main: 放开；松开to stop holding sth (let go)：

example.main: Don’t release the rope.别松开绳子。

phrase.main: 释放；排放to let sb / sth come out of a place where they have been kept or trapped：

example.main: release a prisoner 释放囚犯
The factory keeps releasing smoke, making the air dirty.这座工厂不停地排放烟雾，污染了空气。

phrase.main: 上映 (电影)；发行 (CD、书等)；发布 (新闻等) :

example.main: release a movie / new version 发行影片/发布新版本

phrase.main: 发泄；宣泄：

example.main: Physical exercise is a good way of releasing stress.锻炼身体是释放压力的号方法。

phrase.main: 解雇
[U] [可用单数] 放走；释放；排放；宣泄：

example.main: a release from prison 从狱中释放
the release of homing pigeons 放飞信鸽

phrase.main: [U] [可用单数] 发行；发布：

example.main: The software is planned for release in April. 该软件计划于四月份发布。

phrase.main: [C] 发行的影片等；发布的新闻等：

example.main: the latest release最新发行的产品

phrase.main: 有关的；贴切的：

example.main: relevant experience / information相关经验 / 信息
The sharing economy is increasingly relevant to our daily lives as well as to the global economy.共享经济与我们的日常生活及全球经济的联系越来越紧密。

phrase.main: 可信赖的；可靠的 (dependable)：

example.main: a reliable product 质量可靠的产品
Tom is clever while Jack is honest and reliable. 汤姆聪明，而杰克诚实可靠。

phrase.main: 遗物；遗迹：

example.main: cultural relics 文化遗产

phrase.main: [可用单数](痛苦等的) 减轻；宽慰：

example.main: To our great relief, the accident caused little damage.令我们十分宽慰的是，事故造成的损失很小。
The doctor said it was only a slight wound. What a relief! 医生说只是轻伤。谢天谢地！
Those who suffer from headache will find they get relief from this medicine. 那些饱受头痛折磨的人将会发现使用这种药可以缓解疼痛。

phrase.main: 救济物 (aid)：

example.main: send relief to flood victims 将救济物资运送给遭受洪灾的灾民

phrase.main: 使减轻；使解除 (痛苦、忧愁等)；给（某人）换班：

example.main: Laughter helps relieve tension.笑有助于缓解紧张。
Regular exercise may help relieve psychological anxiety and depression that is common in winter.有规律的锻炼有助于缓解冬季常见的心理焦虑和抑郁。

phrase.main: 宗教；宗教信仰
宗教的：

example.main: Easter is an important religious and social festival for Christians around the world. 复活节是全世界基督教徒的一个重要的宗教和公众节日。

phrase.main: 笃信宗教的；虔诚的
勉强的；不情愿的
停留；逗留 (stay)：

example.main: We were told to remain in our seats meanwhile with our seat belts fastened. 我们被告知系好安全带留在座位上。
The rest of his family remained in Europe. 他其余的家人留在了欧洲。

phrase.main: 留存；剩下；遗留：

example.main: Education is what remains after one has forgotten everything he learned in school.所谓教育，就是一个人把在学校所学的全部忘光后剩下的东西。
Very little of the house remained after the fire. 火灾后，房子所剩无几。

phrase.main: [作系动词] 保持；仍然是：

example.main: remain silent / seated保持沉默/留在座位上坐好
The more we know, the more we feel our ignorance; the more we feel how much remains unknown.我们知道的越多，就越觉得自己无知；就越能感觉到有多少东西是未知的。
In spite of their quarrel, they remain the best of friends.尽管他们有争吵，他们仍然是最好的朋友。

phrase.main: 留待；尚待：

example.main: I never see what has been done; I only see what remains to be done. 我从来不看已经做了什么，我只看还有什么要做。

form.main: it remains to be seen + wh- 从句：

example.main: It remains to be seen whether you are right.你是否正确，尚待分晓。
There remains a certain doubt among the people as to the practical value of the project.关于这个项目的实用价值，人们还是有一些疑虑。

phrase.main: [复数]剩余物；遗迹；遗体：

example.main: She fed the remains of her lunch to the dog. 她把中午的剩饭喂狗了。
prehistoric remains史前遗迹
human remains人类遗骸

phrase.main: [C] 言论；谈论；评论：

example.main: remarks by / from 出自…的话
make a remark发表评论

phrase.main: vt & vi 谈论；评论：

example.main: The teacher remarked that the article was well written. 老师评论说那篇文章写得很好。
It would be rude to remark on / upon other’s appearance. 对他人的相貌品头论足是不礼貌的。

phrase.main: 非凡的；卓越的；引人注目的unusual or surprising and therefore deserving attention or praise：

example.main: a remarkable life / musician / achievement非凡的一生 / 卓越的音乐家 / 非凡的成就
She saw a slow but remarkable improvement in my classroom performance.她看到我的课堂表现有了缓慢但显著的进步。

phrase.main: vt & vi记得；记住；想起：

example.main: I remember my first day at kindergarten very well / clearly.我清楚地记得第一天上幼儿园的情景。
I can’t remember his telephone number.我想不起他的电话号码了。

form.main: remember doing sth 记得曾做过某事：

example.main: I remember meeting her at a party once. 我记得曾在一次聚会上见过她。

form.main: remember to do sth 记着要做某事：

example.main: Remember to turn off the light before you leave. 走前别忘了关灯。
I remember that there was a beautiful valley near the village. 我记得村庄附近有个漂亮的山谷。
Do you remember what you said last night? 你记得自己昨晚说过的话吗？

phrase.main: vt纪念：

example.main: On May 12th, people remember those who died in the earthquake.每年的5月12日，人们纪念那些在地震中离世的人。

phrase.main: vt代...致意；代...问好：

example.main: Will you kindly remember me to your family? 请代我向你的家人问好，好吗?

phrase.main: 提醒to make sb remember sth that they must do：

example.main: Remind you, Jane. Take care. My wife got her purse picked at the station once. 提醒你一下，简，要当心。我妻子的钱包曾在火车站被偷过。
I forgot to remind him about / of the time for the interview. 我忘了提醒他面试的时间。
We put up a board to remind people to protect the trees.我们竖起一块牌子提醒人们保护树木。
She reminded me that I hadn’t called Mother.她提醒我还没有给妈妈打电话。
Do something you’re good at. Remind yourself how good you are at so many things. 做点你擅长的事，要提醒自己你是多么的多才多艺。

phrase.main: 使想起to make sb remember sb that they know or sth that happened in the past：

example.main: Bill reminded him of the day years ago when they had first met. 比尔使他想起多年前他们初识的那一天。
— Brad was Jane’s brother! 布拉德是简的兄弟。
— No wonder he reminded me so much of Jane!难怪他让我觉得他那么像简呢。

phrase.main: 遥远的 (distant)；偏僻的；关系远的：

example.main: a remote village / area偏僻的村庄 / 偏远地区

phrase.main: 移走；移开；搬走 (take away)：

example.main: He was too tired to remove the stone. 他太累了，移不开那块石头。
He removed a notice from the door.他揭掉了门上的告示。
remove banana skins剥香蕉皮
In June 2015, the Tibetan antelope was removed from the endangered species list.2015年6月，藏羚羊被从濒危物种名单中移除。
The Foolish Old Man removing the mountains愚公移山

phrase.main: [正式用语] 摘掉；脱掉 (take off)：

example.main: She removed the diamond ring to cook a meal.为了做饭，她把钻戒摘了下来。

phrase.main: 消除；去掉：

example.main: remove sb’s fear / doubts 消除某人的恐惧/疑虑
We can't remove stress from our lives entirely.我们无法完全消除生活中的压力。
remove dark spots袪黑头

phrase.main: 把...免职；撤去：

example.main: remove a man from office 免除一个人的职务

phrase.main: 复兴
(停下一段时间后) 重新开始：

example.main: renew a friendship重续友谊

phrase.main: 延长 (协议、官方文件等) 的期限；使续期：

example.main: renew sb’s passport / license 续签护照/更新执照
renew a book 续借一本书

phrase.main: 更换；更新
能再生的；可更新的
vt & vi租用；出租；(AmE) (短期) 租借；租金为：

example.main: rent an apartment from sb 从某人那里租套公寓
rent (out) the room to students把房间租给学生
The apartment rents at / for $2,000 a month.这套公寓以每月2 000美元出租。
rent a car租车

phrase.main: 租金：

example.main: pay the rent 付租金

phrase.main: 修理：

example.main: repair a broken watch 修理坏掉的手表

phrase.main: 修理；修补：

example.main: A man should keep his friendship in constant repair. 只有经常维系，方能保持友谊天长地久。

phrase.main: 归还；偿还；报答：

example.main: He promised to repay me the money in a week. 他承诺一周内还我钱。
The hard work that you do now will be repaid later in life. 你现在所做的艰苦工作将在以后的生活中获得回报。

phrase.main: 重复；(数字等) 重复出现：

example.main: repeat the same mistake 犯同样的错误
Will you repeat what you said just now? 把你刚才说的再重复一遍好吗？

phrase.main: 重复 (事物)；重播
重复
把...放回原处：

example.main: Replace the magazines after reading. 杂志阅读后请放回原处。

phrase.main: 取代；接替；更换：

example.main: Personally, I think store shopping will exist along with online shopping but will never be replaced.我个人认为商店购物会与网上购物并存，但绝不会被取代。
The student union will hold a special meeting in January to hire someone to replace the secretary.学生会将在一月份举行一次特别会议，聘请一个人来接任秘书。
We’d be happy to replace the radio for you. 我们乐意为您更换这台收音机。

phrase.main: vi & vt回答；答复：

example.main: reply to a question 回答问题
He replied that he knew nothing about it. 他回答说对此一无所知。

phrase.main: 回答；答复 (answer)：

example.main: I am looking forward to your early reply.期待你早日答复。
make no reply 不作答复

phrase.main: vt & vi报告；汇报；报道：

example.main: They will report the matter in the newspaper. 他们将在报纸上报道这件事。
The school newspaper sent her to report on the contest. 校报派她去报道本次竞赛。
The girl reported seeing UFOs. / The girl reported that she had seen UFOs.该少女报告说，她看到了不明飞行物。

form.main: be reported to do sth / it is reported that ...：

example.main: The accident is reported to have occurred on the first Sunday in February. / It is reported that the accident occurred on the first Sunday in February. 据报道事故发生在二月的第一个星期日。

phrase.main: vt举报；告发：

example.main: I’d like to report a robbery. 我要举报一起抢劫案。
We should report him to the police. 我们应向警察举报他。

phrase.main: 报到：

example.main: All visitors must report to the reception desk on arrival. 所有来访者到达后务必在接待处报到。

phrase.main: 报告；汇报；报道；成绩报告单：

example.main: make / give a report on / of / about作关于…的报告
write a report写报告
a news / weather / book / research report新闻报道 / 天气预报 / 读书报告 / 研究报告

phrase.main: 记者；报告人
vt[正式用语] 描绘；展现to describe sb / sth in a particular way：

example.main: Art is a powerful way to represent life and express feelings.艺术是展现生活和表达情感的有力方式。

phrase.main: vt表示；象征to be a sign or symbol of sth：

example.main: The word “love” is often represented by a heart.“爱”这个词常用心形来表示。
Noodles should be uncut, as they represent long life.面条必须是整根不切断的，因为它们象征长命百岁。

phrase.main: vt代表to officially speak or act for another person or group of people：

example.main: He is the ideal person to represent our class. 他是代表我们班的理想人选。
Her greatest ambition was to represent her country at the Olympics.她最大的愿望是代表自己的国家参加奥运会。

phrase.main: [系动词]相当于to be or be equal to sth：

example.main: A salary rise of 10% represents an annual increase of $3,600 for me. 对我来说，加薪10%相当于全年收入增加3600美元。

phrase.main: 代表；代理人：

example.main: a student / sales representative学生/销售代表
a representative of Russia to the UN 俄罗斯驻联合国代表

phrase.main: 典型的；有代表性的：

example.main: be representative of the people 代表人民

phrase.main: 复制；重现：

example.main: It’s very hard to reproduce a natural environment in the laboratory. 在实验室中重现自然环境很难。

phrase.main: vt & vi 生殖；繁殖
爬行动物
共和国：

example.main: the People’s Republic of China 中华人民共和国

phrase.main: 名声；名誉：

example.main: Typical of the Scotch, Burns had a reputation for being funny and charming. 彭斯是个典型的苏格兰人，他以风趣和富有魅力而闻名。
earn / gain / enjoy / acquire a good reputation as a doctor作为医生获得好名声

phrase.main: （正式的）要求；请求：

example.main: make a request for help请求帮助
In Japan, the “OK” sign is a request for small change. 在日本，手势OK表示要零钱。
The pianist listened to our request that he (should) play in public again. 那位钢琴家听从了我们的请求，答应再次公演。

phrase.main: [正式用语] 请求；要求to ask for sth or ask sb to do sth in a polite or formal way：

example.main: Request the honour of your presence.敬请光临。
You can request a free ticket for the show at the reception desk. 你可以在前台要一张这场演出的免费票。
Visitors are requested not to touch the exhibits. 参观者请勿触摸展品。
We request that the discussion (should) be put off.我们要求推迟讨论。

phrase.main: [不用于进行时]需要；要求：

example.main: If you require further information, phone during office hours. 如需了解更多信息，请在工作时间致电询问。
Our classroom requires cleaning / to be cleaned. 我们的教室需要打扫。

form.main: require sb / sth to do sth:

example.main: Being public figures, leaders are required to appear strong and capable. 作为公众人物，领导者要表现得坚强且有能力。
Our teacher required that we (should) pay attention to our handwriting.老师要求我们注意书写。
The new task requires hard efforts of us. 这项新任务需要我们付出艰辛的努力。

phrase.main: [正式用语]需要 (品)；要求 (物)；必要的条件：

example.main: basic requirements 基本的要求
meet / satisfy a requirement满足要求

phrase.main: 营救：

example.main: She was rescued from a burning building. 她从着火的楼里被救了出来。

phrase.main: 救援；营救：

example.main: come to sb’s rescue 营救某人
Some of the rescue workers and doctors were trapped under the ruins. 一些救援人员和医生被困在了废墟下面。

phrase.main: [正式用语] 研究；探究：

example.main: medical / scientific research医学 / 科学研究
field research实地研究
do research on / into Roman history从事关于古罗马历史的研究

phrase.main: 研究：

example.main: Doctors have been researching that question. 医生们一直在研究那个问题。
research into / in / on ways of improving people’s diet研究改进人们饮食的方法

phrase.main: 研究人员
[不用于进行时和被动语态] 类似；像to look like or be similar to sb / sth：

example.main: Often the lives of writers resemble the lives of the characters they create. 通常，作家的生活和他们所创作的人物的生活非常相似。

phrase.main: [C] & [U] 保留（意见）；存疑；异议：

example.main: I accept your statement without reservation (= completely).我完全相信你的话。

phrase.main: [C] (旅馆房间、剧院座位等的) 预订：

example.main: I’ll call the restaurant to make a reservation. 我来给餐馆打电话预定。

phrase.main: 保留；保存；储备to keep sth for a special reason or to use at a later time：

example.main: Opportunities are always reserved for those who are prepared.机会总是留给有准备的人。
If you order after that, we reserve the right to either accept or reject order requests. 若您在那之后订购，我们保留接受或拒绝订单的权利。
I'll reserve my judgment on this issue until I find all the evidence.在找到所有的证据之前我将保留对该问题的意见。

phrase.main: 预订 (book)：

example.main: reserve a table / room / seat / ticket预订桌位 / 房间 / 座位 / 票

phrase.main: [C][常用复数] 储备（物）：

example.main: oil / gold / fuel / foreign-currency reserves石油 / 黄金 / 燃料 /外汇储备
It took my last reserves of strength to make a dash for the finish line.我用尽了最后一点力气冲向终点。

phrase.main: [C](野生动植物的) 保护区 (AmE preserve)：

example.main: a nature / game / wildlife reserve自然保护区 /禁猎区 / 野生动植物保护区

phrase.main: [U]含蓄；矜持；寡言 (shyness)：

example.main: She finally overcame her own natural reserve and became outgoing and open.她最终克服了沉默寡言的天性，变得外向、开朗起来。

phrase.main: 居民；住户；住院医师：

example.main: rural / urban residents 农村/城市居民
permanent residents永久居民

phrase.main: vi & vt辞去 (职务)：

example.main: resign one's post / position辞去职位
resign from one's job辞职
Tom has resigned his membership of the golf club.汤姆已经退出了高尔夫球俱乐部。

phrase.main: （用武力）反抗；抵抗：

example.main: resist an enemy attack 抵抗敌人的进攻

phrase.main: 抗拒；抵制(oppose)：

example.main: I will always look on the positive side of change and accept it rather than resist it.我将始终着眼于变革的积极一面，接收变革，而不是抗拒变革。
The bank strongly resisted cutting interest rates. 银行强烈反对降息。

phrase.main: [常用于否定句] 忍住；按捺住：

example.main: I can’t resist the temptation.我抵挡不了这种诱惑。
I finished the cake. I couldn’t resist it. 我忍不住把蛋糕吃光了。
He found it hard to resist buying these books. 他发现忍住不买这些书很难。

phrase.main: vt分解
vt解决to find a solution to a problem (settle)：

example.main: resolve a conflict / an issue / difficulties / differences解决冲突/问题/难题/分歧

phrase.main: vt & vi决心；决定to make a firm decision to do sth：

example.main: Instead of resolving to lose weight, try an actionable resolution: “I’ll stop having dessert for lunch.”不要光下决心减肥，要尝试一个可执行的决心：“我午餐不再吃甜品。”
My father resolved that he would stop smoking.我父亲决定戒烟。

phrase.main: vt（经正式投票）作出决定：

example.main: The committee has resolved that the next year's conference be held in Shanghai.委员会已决定明年的会议在上海举行。

phrase.main: 度假胜地
资源；物力；财力：

example.main: natural / human resources自然 / 人力资源
She had no financial resources. 她没有钱。
Online English-learning forums can be a useful learning resource.在线英语学习论坛是非常有用的学习资源。

phrase.main: 尊重；尊敬；遵守：

example.main: The media should respect famous people’s privacy.媒体应当尊重名人的隐私。
She has always been honest with me, and I respect her for that.她一直对我很诚实，我非常敬重她这一点。
respect the law遵守法律

phrase.main: [U] 尊敬；尊重：

example.main: The Chongyang Festival, also called Double Ninth Festival, is a day for people to show respect to / for seniors.重阳节，又称重九节，是向老年人表达敬意的日子。
Friendship is built upon respect for each other.友谊建立在彼此尊重的基础之上。
win the respect of 赢得…的尊重

phrase.main: [复数] [正式用语]问候：

example.main: Give my respects to your father. 代我向你父亲致意。

phrase.main: [C] 关系；方面：

example.main: Tom is really good with computers. He has no superior in this respect.汤姆很擅长电脑。在这方面没人能胜过他。

phrase.main: 恭敬的
vi & vt回答；回应 (reply)：

example.main: respond to a message回复消息
respond with a smile 报以微笑
When asked about the company’s future, the director responded that he remained optimistic.当被问到公司的未来时，董事回答说他依然乐观。

phrase.main: vi响应；有反应 (react)：

example.main: Knowing basic first-aid techniques will help you respond quickly to emergencies. 懂得基本的急救技能将有助于你对紧急情况做出迅速反应。

phrase.main: 回答；回复； 反应；响应：

example.main: make no response to the question 没有对提问作答
bring / produce response 引起/产生反响
Their responses to the questions reflected their true belief.他们对问题的回答反映了他们的真实看法。
You can give / make a brief response to a message with an emoji or a picture.你可以用表情符号或图片简单回复消息。
The film has received a favourable response.这部电影收获了好评。
The response to the invention hasn’t been all positive.人们对这项发明的反应并不都是正面的。

phrase.main: [U] & [C]责任；职责：

example.main: shoulder / take on (a ) responsibility肩负/承担责任
It is our responsibility / We have a responsibility to protect the environment.我们有责任保护环境。
Jenny, you have responsibility for clearing up the room after the class.珍妮，你负责课后打扫教室。
Being the only wage earner put a great burden of responsibility on my father.作为家里唯一一个挣钱的人，我父亲肩上的担子很重。

phrase.main: [U]（对不良事件所负的）责任：

example.main: Taking responsibility for something that went wrong is a mark of great maturity. 对做错的事负责是非常成熟的标志。
No one is willing to accept responsibility for the accident.没有人愿意对这次事故承担责任。

phrase.main: [不用于名词前] 负责的；尽责的having a duty to be in charge of or to look after sb or sth：

example.main: You're responsible for washing out your own lab equipment and putting it away.你负责把你自己的实验设备洗干净并放好。

phrase.main: （人）有责任心的：

example.main: It's time you started acting like a responsible adult.你现在应该表现得像个有责任心的成年人了。

phrase.main: [不用于名词前] 应承担责任；作为缘由的being the cause of or to blame for sth：

example.main: Who should be responsible for the accident?谁应对这次事故负责？
He holds me personally responsible if anything goes wrong.如果出了什么差错，他都归咎于我。

phrase.main: ［常用于名词前］责任重大的：

example.main: a responsible job / position要职

phrase.main: (使) 休息：

example.main: rest one’s brain / eyes / feet让大脑/眼睛休息/歇歇脚
She never had a moment to rest. 她从没得到过片刻休息。

phrase.main: （被）支撑；（使）依靠：

example.main: Rest your head on my shoulder.把头靠在我的肩上。

phrase.main: [C] & [U] 休息：

example.main: Let’s have / take a rest under the tree. 我们在这棵树下休息一下吧。

phrase.main: [与the连用] 剩余部分；余下的人 / 物：

example.main: He lived the rest of his life in the US. 他在美国度过了余生。
Three of us will go; the rest are to stay here. 我们中的三个人去，其余的人留在这里。
The rest of the money is to be sent to her. 剩下的钱就送给她吧。

phrase.main: 饭馆；餐馆：

example.main: run / operate a restaurant 经营餐馆

phrase.main: ［正式用语］归还 (give back / return)：

example.main: That family not only restored the important documents to us that day but also restored our faith and trust in people.那天，那家人不仅把重要的文件还给了我们，而且还让我们重拾了对他人的信心和信任。

phrase.main: 恢复；使复原；修复 (repair)：

example.main: Her job is restoring old paintings. 她的工作是修复古画。
After a week in bed, my mother was fully restored to health.卧床一周后，我妈妈完全恢复了健康。
Day in, day out, Mr Wang and his students spend their time restoring clocks dating back hundreds of years.日复一日，王先生和他的学生们花时间修复数百年前的钟表。
restore sb’s sight / hearing恢复某人的视力 / 听力
The measures are aimed at restoring public confidence in the economy.这些举措旨在恢复公众对经济的信心。
The Xi’an City Wall is the most complete city wall and has now been completely restored.西安城墙是最完整的城墙，现在已被完全修复。

phrase.main: 限制；限定（大小、数量或范围）

example.main: Speed is restricted to 30 kilometres per hour here.此地车速不得超过每小时30千米。
In future we will restrict the number of students per class to 50.以后我们将会把每个班的学生人数限定在50人。

phrase.main: 限制 / 约束（行动或活动）：

example.main: restrict one’s freedom限制自由

phrase.main: [U] 限制；约束；[C] 限制规定；限制法规：

example.main: We go into this place without restriction.我们可以不受限制地进入这个地方。
speed / travel / import / trade restrictions速度 / 旅行 / 进口 / 贸易限制
Many schools have strict restrictions on students' clothes.许多学校都严格限制学生是着装。

phrase.main: 限制 (性) 的；约束(性) 的
[C] & [U] 结果；成果：

example.main: If you believe in yourself and work hard, you can achieve great results. 相信自己并付出努力，你就会得到好结果。
The book is the result of 25 years of research. 这本书是25年研究的成果。

phrase.main: [C]比赛结果；考试成绩：

example.main: the football results 足球比赛的结果
get good results 取得好成绩

phrase.main: 发生；导致
重新开始；（中断后）继续：

example.main: resume negotiations恢复 / 继续谈判

phrase.main: 简历
再讲；重复；复述：

example.main: The students are required to retell the story after reading it.学生需要先阅读该故事，然后复述。

phrase.main: vi & vt(使) 退休；(使) 引退：

example.main: Before people retire, they usually plan to do a lot of great things.人们在退休前通常会计划做很多了不起的事。
At age 68, he retired from the post office, but he never stopped serving the community.在68岁时，他从邮局退休了，但从未停止过为公众服务。

phrase.main: [用单数] 回来；归来；再现：

example.main: the return flight / journey 返程航班/回程
This festival is meant to celebrate the return of spring after winter. 这个节日旨在庆祝冬去春来。
Upon her return home, Alice was filled with joy at the news. 爱丽斯一回到家，听到这个消息高兴万分。

phrase.main: [用单数] 归还；退还；放回：

example.main: The return of a wallet can indicate one's honesty.归还钱包可以表明一个人的诚实。
Your satisfaction is guaranteed, with our 30-day return privilege. 我们有30天退货特权，保证您满意。

phrase.main: vi 回来；返回；重新出现 (go / come back)：

example.main: By the time Jack returned home / to his home from England, his son had graduated from college. 当杰克从英国回到家乡的时候，他的儿子已经大学毕业了。
If the pain returns, make another appointment to see the doctor. 如果疼痛反复，再预约看医生。

phrase.main: vt 归还；送回；放回：

example.main: I returned the book to the library just now.我刚刚把书还给了图书馆
My mother’s call returned me to the real world. 母亲的喊声把我带回到现实世界。

phrase.main: vt (以相同的东西) 回报 / 报答：

example.main: Thanks for helping me. I’ll try to return the favour some day. 谢谢你对我的帮助，有朝一日我会报答你的。

phrase.main: [常用于被动语态]（使）重逢；再次相聚：

example.main: The children were finally reunited with their families.孩子们终于和自己的家人重聚了。

phrase.main: （使）再结合；再联合
重新使用；再使用：

example.main: When the waste water from factory is made clean and reused, a lot of money is saved. 工厂的废水净化后重新使用，可以节约很多钱。

phrase.main: 展现；显露：

example.main: The child raised her head, revealing a tear-stained face.那孩子抬起头，露出一张布满泪痕的脸。

phrase.main: 揭露；泄露：

example.main: He did not reveal his secret plan to us. 他没有向我们透露他的秘密计划。
A natural history museum can both keep and reveal nature's secret.自然历史博物馆既能保护自然的秘密，又能揭示自然的秘密。

phrase.main: 收入；税收
vt 颠倒；改变；vt & vi 倒 (车)
相反；反面；(机动车的) 倒挡
复阅；复查：

example.main: Review your homework before you turn it in. 上交作业前你要再检查一遍。

phrase.main: 复习；温习 (revise)：

example.main: We should review our lessons every day. 我们应当每天复习功课。

phrase.main: 回顾；反思：

example.main: He reviewed the whole of his past life. 他回顾了自己过去的整个人生。

phrase.main: 给 (书、戏剧、电影等) 写评论：

example.main: I only go to see films that are reviewed favourably.我只去看评价好的电影。

phrase.main: [C] & [U]审查；检查：

example.main: carry out / conduct / undertake a review进行审查

phrase.main: [C] 复习；温习：

example.main: The teacher distributed a review for the exam. 老师为考试布置了复习任务。

phrase.main: [C]报告；回顾
[C] & [U]（对书、戏剧、电影等的）评论：

example.main: a book / film review 书评/影评
His first novel has received good reviews since it came out last month. 他的第一部小说自上月出版以来一直备受好评。

phrase.main: vi & vt复习；温习 (review / study)：

example.main: I spent the weekend revising for my exam. 我花了整个周末来复习备考。
After school, I try to use any possible time to revise the things I have learnt during the day.放学后，我试图利用任何可能的时间来复习我在一天中所学的东西。

phrase.main: vt修订；修正：

example.main: revise rules 修正规则

phrase.main: [U] 复习；温习：

example.main: How much revision do you do before an exam? 考试前你做了多少复习？

phrase.main: [C] & [U] 修订；修正
革命；剧烈的变革：

example.main: the Chinese Revolution of 19111911辛亥革命
A revolution in education is taking place.正掀起一场教育革命。

phrase.main: 革命（性）的：

example.main: Copernicus’ revolutionary theory哥白尼的革命性理论

phrase.main: 旋转；环绕；转动
[C] & [U] 报答；报酬；奖赏sth that you are given because you have done sth good, worked hard, etc.：

example.main: My grandmother says that a good deed is its own reward. 我祖母说善举本身就是回报。
This job is difficult, but the financial rewards are great. 这项工作很辛苦，但报酬丰厚。
The school has a system of rewards and punishments to encourage good behaviour. 学校有奖惩制度来鼓励良好的行为。

phrase.main: [C] 悬赏金；赏金：

example.main: The old lady is offering a reward of $50 to anyone who finds her cat for her! 不管谁找到她的猫，老太太都会给50美元的赏金！

phrase.main: [常用于被动语态] 报答；酬劳；奖赏：

example.main: My parents bought me a bicycle to reward me for passing the exams.父母给我买了一辆自行车作为我考试及格的奖励。
The students have been working hard on their lessons and their efforts will be rewarded with success in the end.学生们一直努力学习功课，他们的努力最终会带来成功。

phrase.main: vt & vi绕回； (将影片、录音带等) 倒回：

example.main: rewind the tape 倒带

phrase.main: 重写；改写 (故事等)
[C] 犀牛
[U] 韵；押韵：

example.main: It is a poem written in rhyme. 这是一首押韵的诗。

phrase.main: [C] 押韵诗；儿歌；韵文：

example.main: children’s rhymes and stories 儿歌和童话

phrase.main: vi & vt(使) 押韵：

example.main: “Though” rhymes with “low”. though和low押韵。

phrase.main: 节奏；节律；规则变化：

example.main: She started dancing to the rhythm of the music. 她开始随着音乐的节拍跳舞。

phrase.main: 有节奏的；节奏强劲的
带子；丝带；带状物：

example.main: a silk ribbon丝带

phrase.main: 米；米饭；稻：

example.main: Rice is an important food in India, China, and Japan.在印度、中国和日本，大米是主食。
People in the south love eating rice and those in the north cannot live without wheaten food.南方人爱吃米，北方人则离不开面食。

phrase.main: 有钱的；富裕的：

example.main: a rich nation 富裕的国家

phrase.main: 肥沃的：

example.main: rich soil 肥沃的土地

phrase.main: 佝偻病
谜（语）；难以理解的人 / 事：

example.main: solve / answer a riddle 猜谜；解谜
guess lantern riddles猜灯谜
Guessing lantern riddles started in the Song Dynasty, and it is one of the most important and popular activities of the Lantern Festival.猜灯谜始于宋代，是元宵节最重要、最受欢迎的活动之一。

phrase.main: 骑 (马等)；乘 (车等)：

example.main: ride (on) a motorcycle / horse骑摩托车/马
ride in / on a train 乘火车
ride a bus / an elevator乘公共汽车 / 电梯

phrase.main: 乘车；骑； (游乐园中) 供骑/乘的玩具：

example.main: In the afternoon, I asked Uncle Paul if I could take a horse ride.下午，我问保罗叔叔我能不能骑马？
Shall I give you a ride as you live so far away? 你住那么远，我顺路捎你一程吧？
We went on a lot of rides in Disneyland.我们在迪士尼乐园玩了很多游乐设施。

phrase.main: 山脊；屋脊
荒谬的；可笑的；滑稽的 (absurd)
对的；正确的；正当的：

example.main: Rules often tell us what is right or wrong. 规则往往告诉我们什么是正确的或什么是错误的。
It is right to be kind to other people. 善待他人是正确的。

phrase.main: 右的；右翼的：

example.main: Most people eat, write and work with their right hands.多数人用右手吃饭、写字和工作。

phrase.main: 适当的：

example.main: Learn to say the right thing at the right time. 学会在适当的时候说适当的话。

phrase.main: 正常的；健全的：

example.main: Are you right now? 你这会儿感觉好吗?

phrase.main: 恰好：
