example.main: He seated himself in a chair. 他坐在椅子上。
He seated us in the front row. 他安排我们在前排就座。

phrase.main: 供给...座位；容纳...人：

example.main: Rome's Colosseum was 157 feet tall and had 80 entrances, seating 50,000 people.罗马斗兽场高157英尺，有80个入口，可容纳5万人。

phrase.main: 西雅图 (美国城市)
海草；海藻
第二的；次要的：

example.main: students in the second year of senior high school 高中二年级的学生
As a dancer, he is second to none. 作为舞蹈家，无人能出其右。
In some countries, obesity is second only to smoking as a cause of death.在一些国家，肥胖是仅次于吸烟的第二大死因。

phrase.main: [常与a连用] 又一个的；另外的：

example.main: every second year 每隔一年
A friend is a second self. 朋友是另一个自我。

phrase.main: 第二 (位) 地：

example.main: She finished second in the race. 她在赛跑中获得了第二名。

phrase.main: [句子副词] 其次：

example.main: First, he is young. Second, he is healthy. 首先，他年轻；其次，他健康。

phrase.main: [用在形容词最高级前] 第二：

example.main: Canada is the second largest country in the world. 加拿大是世界上(面积)第二大的国家。

phrase.main: [U] 第二：

example.main: the second of March 3月2日
He was the second to come here. 他是第二个来这儿的。

phrase.main: [C] 秒：

example.main: Every second counts. 一寸光阴一寸金。

phrase.main: [C] 片刻：

example.main: I’ll be back in a second. 我马上回来。

phrase.main: 二手的；旧的：

example.main: a second-hand car 二手车

phrase.main: 次要的；从属的less important than sth else：

example.main: a question of secondary importance 次要问题
One’s attitude is what matters — the ability is of secondary importance.一个人的态度最重要，能力其次。
Working was always secondary to spending time with her family.与陪伴家人相比，工作总是排在她的第二位。

phrase.main: （疾病、感染等）继发性的；间接引发的：

example.main: a secondary infection / effect继发感染 / 间接结果

phrase.main: [只用于名词前] 中等（教育）的：

example.main: secondary education中等教育
a junior / senior secondary school初级 / 高级中学；初中 / 高中

phrase.main: 其次；第二
[C] 秘密：

example.main: let out / keep a secret 泄露/保守秘密
I have no secret from you. 我对你无秘密可言。

phrase.main: [常与the连用] 诀窍：

example.main: Jordan says that the secret to his success is learning from his failures.乔丹说他成功的秘诀就是从失败中学习。

phrase.main: [C] [常用复数] 奥秘：

example.main: I want to bring out the secrets of nature and apply them for the happiness of man. 我想揭示大自然的奥秘，用它们来造福人类。

phrase.main: 秘密的；未公开的；神秘的；偏僻的：

example.main: keep sth secret from sb瞒着某人某事
a secret recipe / talk秘密配方 / 会谈
There's nothing secret about their relationship.他们的关系并不神秘。
a secret valley 幽谷

phrase.main: 秘书；书记；大臣；部长
(事物的) 一部分；(书、报等的) 节；栏；版：

example.main: Read the passage again and divide it into three sections.再读一遍文章，把它分成三部分。
the women’s shoe section女鞋区
the sports / travel section体育/旅游版

phrase.main: 部门；阶层：

example.main: all sections of the people 各阶层人民

phrase.main: 部门；行业
安心的；有把握的：

example.main: She felt secure when she was with her family.她和家人在一起的时候有安全感。

phrase.main: 安全的 (safe)；稳妥的；可靠的：

example.main: a secure job / income稳定的工作 / 收入

phrase.main: 牢固的；坚固的；稳固的：

example.main: Check all windows and doors are secure.检查一下所有的门窗是否都关紧了。
Keep your passport in a secure place.把你的护照放在一个安全的地方。

phrase.main: 使安全；（尤指经过努力）获得；使…固定：

example.main: secure sb against / from attack 保证某人不受袭击
Moore and her father secured their first business meeting with a supermarket owner.摩尔和她父亲争取到了与一位超市店主的首次商务会谈。

phrase.main: [U]安全：

example.main: a sense of security安全感

phrase.main: [U]安全工作；保安措施：

example.main: security checks / cameras安全检查 / 监控摄像头
You have to stay away from the painting for security reasons.出于安全考虑，你必须远离那幅画。

phrase.main: [U] 担保；保障； [U] & [C] 抵押品：

example.main: financial security财务担保 / 经济保障

phrase.main: vt & vi[通常不用于进行时] 看见；看到：

example.main: Seeing is believing. 眼见为实。
I never saw him angry.我从没见过他生气。
I saw them in the classroom. 我看见他们在教室里。
Using a telescope we could see that something was happening.通过望远镜，我们可以看到远处有情况发生。
They waited to see what the rest of the class would do.他们等着看班上其他人会怎么做。
I saw the cat run away a few minutes ago. 几分钟前我看见那只猫跑开了。
From the window we could see the children playing in the yard.从窗户里，我们可以看见孩子们正在院子里玩耍。
We saw the play performed on TV yesterday. 昨晚我们看到电视上播放了这场戏。

phrase.main: vt会见：

example.main: see a doctor 看医生
He is seeing a client at 2:30. 他两点半要见一位客户。

phrase.main: vt & vi[通常不用于进行时] 理解；明白：

example.main: I can’t see the point of spending so much money on a car. 我不明白为什么要花这么多钱买一辆车。
— Look! That’s the solution to the maths problem.看，这是这道数学题的解法。
— Oh, I see. 哦，我明白了。
As far as I can see, he is an honest man. 据我所知，他是个诚实的人。
Can’t you see that he’s taking advantage of you? 难道你不明白他是在利用你吗？
Do you see what I mean? 你明白我的意思吗？

phrase.main: vt & vi[通常不用于进行时] 看待；认为：

example.main: As I see it, you don’t have any choice. 在我看来，你没有选择的余地。
Instead of seeing my boys as losers, I pushed and encouraged them.我没把我的孩子们看作是失败者，而是鼓励他们。

phrase.main: vt遭受；经历：

example.main: This year has seen a big increase in road accidents. 今年道路交通事故大增。
He has seen a great deal in his long life. 他在漫长的一生中经历过很多事。

phrase.main: vt[不用于进行时]想象：

example.main: He could see a great future for her in music.他能看出她在音乐方面很有前途。

phrase.main: [C] 种子；籽；[常用复数] 起源；萌芽
秧苗；树苗
vt & vi寻找 to look for sb / sth：

example.main: seek jobs / work / employment 找工作；求职
a job-seeking guide 求职指南
They sought for a place to shelter from the rain, but in vain. 他们寻找避雨的地方，但没能找到。

phrase.main: vt寻求；谋求to try to get sth：

example.main: seek one’s fortune 寻找出路；寻找致富之路
The book inspires confidence in students who wish to seek their own answers.对于那些想亲自寻求答案的学生，这本书会激发他们的自信心。
To care for wisdom and truth and improvement of the soul is far better than to seek money and honor and reputation. 注重智慧、真理和灵魂进步远比追求金钱、荣誉和名声要好得多。

phrase.main: vt征求 (建议、意见等)；请求 (帮助、援助等)to ask sb for sth：

example.main: seek ( sb’s ) advice征求(某人的)建议
seek ( sb’s ) help / assistance请求(某人的)帮助

phrase.main: vi试图；企图 (attempt)：

form.main: seek to do sth (try to do sth):

example.main: Scientists have been seeking to understand the mystery of the “sixth sense” of direction.科学家一直在试图解开有关方向的第六感之谜。

phrase.main: [系动词]好像；似乎(appear)：

example.main: Today ＄8 or ＄10 seems a small amount of money.如今，8美元、10美元似乎是笔小钱。
It seemed like a good idea. 这主意好像不错。
The theory without practice seems to be the cars without motors. 没有实践的理论就像没有引擎的汽车。
Although the answer seemed a little strange, nobody but I doubted it.虽然答案有点奇怪，但只有我对它产生了怀疑。

form.main: it seems + as if / though 从句：

example.main: It seems as if they didn’t care about Henry’s feelings at all. 他们似乎毫不在乎亨利的感受。
It seemed that he was lying. 他似乎在撒谎。
It seems to me that working experience is more important than a degree. 在我看来，工作经验比学历更重要。
Everyone in the picture seems to have put on some weight, don’t they? 照片中的每个人好像都胖了些，是不是？
There seems to be some disagreement between his words and actions. 他的言行似乎不一致。

phrase.main: 抓住 (grab)；逮捕：

example.main: seize sb by the arm 抓住某人的胳膊
seize a thief 抓小偷

phrase.main: 夺取：

example.main: seize power 夺权

phrase.main: 抓住；把握 (时机等)：

example.main: I will seize the golden chance to go abroad. 我会抓住这次绝好的机会出国。

phrase.main: （情绪）突然侵袭；突然控制：

example.main: I was ready to pay for my bananas at the grocery when fear seized me. My wallet was gone.在商店我正准备付钱买香蕉时，我突然害怕害怕起来。我的钱包不见了。

phrase.main: 很少；不常(rarely)：

example.main: You seldom get what you go after unless you know in advance what you want. 要得到你所追求的东西，就必须先知道自己想要什么。

phrase.main: (经过认真思考而) 挑选；精选to choose sb / sth, usually carefully, from a number of similar things：

example.main: He selected a mobile phone for personal use. 他挑了一部手机自用。
He had hopes of being selected for the national team. 他有望被选入国家队。
In 2019, Tu Youyou was selected by the BBC as one of the most influential figures of science in the 20th century.2019年，屠呦呦被英国广播公司评选为20世纪最具影响力的科学人物之一。

form.main: select sb / sth to do sth:

example.main: He’s the only student in the class that has been selected to take part in the Model United Nations conference. 他是班上唯一被选上参加模拟联合国大会的学生。

phrase.main: 可选之人或物；选集：

example.main: make a selection 作出选择
natural selection自然选择；物竞天择
Selections From Charles Dickens《狄更斯选集》

phrase.main: [C] [常用单数]自己；本身；本人：

example.main: sb's real / true self某人真实的一面

phrase.main: [U] 个性；自我；私心：

example.main: a lack of confidence in the self缺乏自信
He didn't do it for any reason of self.他这么做绝不是出于私心。

phrase.main: 自私的：

example.main: a selfish deed 自私的行为

phrase.main: vt & vi卖 (出)：

example.main: I sold my computer to my neighbour for $250. 我以250美元的价格把自己的电脑卖给了邻居。
This brand of clothes should sell well.这个牌子的衣服应该很好卖。

phrase.main: vt(个人、商店) 出售；(商品) 卖出 (某个数量)：

example.main: They sell candy, cookies and cakes at the supermarket.他们在那家超市卖糖果、饼干和蛋糕。
Her new book has sold fifty thousand in the past week.她的新书上周卖了50 000册。

phrase.main: (AmE) 学期；半学年：

example.main: the spring / fall semester 春/秋季学期

phrase.main: 半圆
(大学的) 研究班；专题讨论会
参议院
邮寄；发送：

example.main: send a letter / an email 寄信/发电子邮件

form.main: send sb sth / send sth to sb:

example.main: We sent her a letter of apology. / We sent a letter of apology to her.我们给她寄了一封道歉信。

phrase.main: 打发；派 (人)；安排…去：

example.main: A teacher was sent to Tom's home.一位老师被派到了汤姆家。

form.main: send sb / sth to do sth:

example.main: The National Park Service had to send water trucks to provide water for the visitors. 国家公园管理局不得不派水车为游客供水。

phrase.main: 传达；转告：

example.main: She sent word (that) she could not come.她捎话说她来不了。

phrase.main: 较年长的；地位较高的；(学校) 高年级的：

example.main: senior citizens老年人；长者（指60岁以上或已退休者）
I’m three years senior to you. 我比你大3岁。
senior high school students高中生

phrase.main: 年长者；年资较深者；高年级学生；大学四年级学生：

example.main: In 1989, the Chinese government decided the Double Ninth Festival as Seniors’ Day.1989年，中国政府把重阳节定为老人节。

phrase.main: [C] (五种) 感官 (之一)：

example.main: the sense of sight / hearing / taste / touch 视/听/味/触觉
The dog has a keen / strong sense of smell. 狗具有敏锐的嗅觉。

phrase.main: [C] (对重大事情的) 感受；意识a feeling about sth important：

example.main: a sense of loss / responsibility 失落感/责任感
He gets a great sense of fulfillment from his work.他从工作中获得了极大的成就感。

phrase.main: [常用单数] 理解力；判断力an ability to understand or judge sth：

example.main: dress / clothes sense着装鉴赏力
a sense of direction / rhythm / humour 方向/节奏/幽默感

phrase.main: [U] 见识；通情达理the knowledge of what’s sensible behavior; the ability to think or act in a reasonable or sensible way：

example.main: common sense 常识
a man of sense 通情达理的人
There’s a lot of sense in what she says. 她说的话很有见地。

phrase.main: [C] [复数] 理智；心智sb's ability to think clearly and behave sensibly：

example.main: come to one’s senses 恢复理性；苏醒
lose one’s senses 失去理智

phrase.main: [C] 意思；意义the meaning of a word or phrase; a way of understanding sth：

example.main: He tried to memorize the sense of every word and phrase. 他试图记住每个词语的意思。
He was a true friend, in every sense of the word. 无论从哪方面看，他都是个真正的朋友。

phrase.main: 感觉到；察觉到：

example.main: The deer sensed the danger and ran into the woods.小鹿察觉到危险，跑进了树林。
She sensed that she was being watched. 她察觉到有人在监视自己。

phrase.main: 失去知觉的；无意义的；不明智的：

example.main: fall senseless 失去知觉
a senseless argument 无意义的争论

phrase.main: 明智的；合理的(wise)；可觉察到的：

example.main: a sensible answer / option 明智的回答/选择
He did not appear to be sensible of the difficulties that lay ahead. 他看上去并没有意识到面前的困难。

phrase.main: 善解人意的；体恤的：aware of and able to understand other people’s feelings：

example.main: She is very sensitive to other people’s feelings.她很能体谅他人的情感。

phrase.main: 易生气的；易被惹恼的easily offended or upset：

example.main: a very sensitive child很敏感的小孩
She is very sensitive to criticism.她一听批评就急。

phrase.main: (对光、温度等) 敏感的；过敏的；易受影响的：

example.main: My teeth are very sensitive to cold food.我的牙齿对凉的食物很敏感。

phrase.main: 灵敏的；(话题、形势等) 敏感的：

example.main: a highly sensitive topic高度敏感的话题

phrase.main: （对艺术、音乐、文学等）感觉敏锐的
[C] 句子
[C] & [U] 判决；宣判：

example.main: a death sentence 死刑
He received a 10-year prison sentence. 他被判处10年有期徒刑。

phrase.main: 判决；宣判：

example.main: In the country in the last 100 years, 23 men have been wrongly sentenced to death.在过去100年里，这个国家有23个人被误判了死刑。

phrase.main: 单独的；分开的；不同的：

example.main: two separate buildings 两座独立的大楼
You’d better keep meat separate from other food in the fridge. 你最好把肉同冰箱里的其他食物分开放。
Use separate knives for raw and cooked meat. 切生肉和熟肉要用不同的刀。

phrase.main: vt & vi(使) 分离；(使) 分开to divide into different parts or groups：

example.main: separate the eggs 把蛋清和蛋黄分开
The students were separated into four groups. 学生被分成了4组。
As we joined the big crowd I got separated from my friends. 当我们走进一大群人中时，我跟朋友们走散了。

phrase.main: vt把...隔开to lie or stand between two countries, areas, etc., keeping them apart：

example.main: England is separated from France by the Channel.英国和法国之间隔着英吉利海峡。

phrase.main: vt区分；分清：to make sb / sth different in some way from sb / sth else：

example.main: The capacity to think separates humans from animals. 思维能力使人有别于动物。

phrase.main: vi分居；分手to stop living together as a couple：

example.main: He separated from his wife after 7 years of marriage. 他和妻子结婚7年后分居了。

phrase.main: [U] 分离；分开：

example.main: Separation from his family made him very sad.与家人分开使他非常伤心。

phrase.main: [C] 分居
九月（Sept.）
[C] & [U]顺序；次序 (order)：

example.main: Listen again and put these sentences in the right / correct sequence. 再听一遍，把这些句子按正确的顺序排列。

phrase.main: [C]一连串；连续：

example.main: The sequence of events in a story is called the plot. 故事中的一连串事件称为情节。

phrase.main: 连续；一系列：

example.main: What comes next is the endless series of steps.接下来是无尽的阶梯。

phrase.main: （书、文章等的）系列；（电视、广播等的） 系列节目：

example.main: Harry Potter series《哈利波特》系列
TV series电视连续剧

phrase.main: （两队之间的）系列比赛：

example.main: the World Series（美国）世界职业棒球锦标赛
the World Triathlon Series世界铁人三项系列赛

phrase.main: 严重的：

example.main: a serious accident / illness / injury 严重的事故/重病/重伤
Too much packaging is doing serious damage to the environment. 过度包装正在对环境造成严重的损坏。

phrase.main: 重大的；重要的important and needing to be thought about carefully：

example.main: I have recently got a serious position within my company. 我最近在公司得到一个重要的职位。
That sounds a good suggestion. I will give it some serious thought. 那听起来是个好主意，我会认真考虑。

phrase.main: 严肃的；认真的：

example.main: She looked serious as she told us the bad news. 她告诉我们这个坏消息时看上去很严肃。
— I’m going to a party at Carol’s house. 我要去参加卡罗尔家的聚会。
— You can’t be serious. We’ve got two tests at school tomorrow. 你别开玩笑了，明天我们学校里有两个测验。

phrase.main: [只用于名词前] 热衷的：

example.main: I didn’t become a serious climber until the fifth grade. 我直到五年级才热衷于攀爬。

phrase.main: 严重地；认真地：

example.main: seriously ill / injured病得/伤得严重

phrase.main: 仆人；佣人；雇员；职员
vt & vi 提供 / 端上（饭菜等）：

example.main: Breakfast is served between 7 and 10 am. 早上7点到10点供应早餐。
I wonder when our beef will be served.不知道我们的牛肉什么时候才能端上来。
All the dishes in this menu, unless otherwise stated, will serve two to three people.除非另有说明，这个菜单里的所有菜都足够两到三人食用。

phrase.main: vi & vt 服务；接待：

example.main: There was only one girl serving customers in the store.店里只有一个女孩接待顾客。

phrase.main: vt & vi (为...) 服务；(为...) 工作；(为...) 服役：

example.main: serve in the army服役
As students, there are many ways in which you can serve the community. 作为学生，你有许多服务于社区的方式。

phrase.main: vt 提供；满足...的需要：

example.main: This housing area is well served with water and gas.这个住宅区供水供气的设施齐全。

phrase.main: vt & vi 适合；(对...) 起作用：

example.main: Nothing is so big that it is impossible to get over, and hurt only serves to make us stronger. 没有什么克服不了的困难，痛苦只会让我们更强大。
In that course I learned life lessons that have served me well beyond the classroom.在那个课程里，我学到了远远超出课堂范围的人生意义。

phrase.main: vi & vt 发（球）：

example.main: When the ball is in play or if a player is serving, do not cheer or talk loudly.球赛进行中或者当球员发球时，请不要高声欢呼或喧哗。

phrase.main: [C] 公共服务系统；公共事业机构：

example.main: the Civil Service Examination 公务员考试
the National Health Service (the NHS) (英国的)国民保健制度

phrase.main: [C] & [U] 服务；效力；使用：

example.main: a service industry / charge服务业/服务费
In 1291, after 17 years of service to the Emperor, Marco returned to Italy. 1291年，在为皇帝效力了17年之后，马可·波罗回到了意大利。
Sorry, the number you dialed is out of service. 对不起，您拨打的号码已停机。

phrase.main: 会议；一届会议；(法院) 开庭：

example.main: a session of the UN General Assembly一届联合国大会
The court is now in session.法院现在正在开庭。

phrase.main: (从事某一活动的) 一段时间；学年：

example.main: a question-and-answer session问答时间

phrase.main: vt 放；摆放；使处于 (某地)：

example.main: set the table for dinner摆好桌子准备吃饭
She set the piano against the wall.她把钢琴靠墙摆放。
The house is set in (= located) fifty acres of parkland.那所房子位于50英亩的绿地之中。

phrase.main: vt 使...开始；使...处于 (某种状态)：

example.main: set a fire点火
The firm’s accounts need to be set in order.公司的账目需要清理。
Three years ago, five parrots were set free in a wild place.3年前，5只鹦鹉在野外被放飞。
Your report has set me thinking.你的报告引起了我的思考。

phrase.main: vt 设置；调整：

example.main: She set her alarm for 7 o’clock.她把闹钟设到了7点。

phrase.main: vt 确定 (价值、目标、日期等)；制定：

example.main: set a price of $50,000 on the painting给那幅画定价5万美元
set a goal / rule 确定目标/制定规则
set a wedding date确定婚期

phrase.main: vt 布置；安排：

example.main: The teacher set the students a lot of homework.老师给学生留了很多家庭作业。

phrase.main: vt 树立 (榜样)；开创 (新风尚等)；创造 (纪录)：

example.main: She has set a good example for us.她给我们树立了好榜样。
Rock stars often set fashions in clothes.摇滚歌星常开创时装的新式样。
She set a new world record for the high jump.她创造了一项新的世界跳高纪录。

phrase.main: vt [常用于被动语态] 以...为背景：

example.main: Great Expectations is set in England in the early 1800s.《远大前程》以19世纪早期的英国为背景。

phrase.main: vi (日、月等) 落：

example.main: We watched the sun setting.我们看着太阳落下。

phrase.main: vt 使（头发）成所需的发型：

example.main: She had her hair washed and set.她去洗了头，做了发型。

phrase.main: (一) 套；(一) 部：

example.main: a set of tools 一套工具

phrase.main: 装置；设备：

example.main: Do not adjust your TV set.请勿自行调整电视机。

phrase.main: 环境；（事件发生的）背景：

example.main: a rural / beautiful setting乡村 / 优美的环境
Sanya is the perfect setting for a beach holiday.三亚是海滩度假的绝佳地点。

phrase.main: （书、影片等中情节发生的）背景：

example.main: She is writing a novel that has Shanghai of the 1930s as the setting.她正在写一部以 20 世纪 30 年代的上海为背景的小说。
the setting of the film这部电影的背景
the educational / cultural setting教育/文化背景

phrase.main: （机器等调控装置的）挡位

example.main: The heating system was already on its highest setting.供暖系统已调到最高档。
The hairdryer has three settings — high, medium and low.这个吹风机有三挡——高温、中温和低温。

phrase.main: vi & vt 坐下；(使) 处于舒适的位置to get into or put sb into a comfortable position：

example.main: The dog settled on the grass to enjoy its bone.那条狗舒服地坐在草地上享受骨头的美味。
She settled herself into her chair and started to read.她舒舒服服地坐在椅子上开始看书。

phrase.main: vi & vt (移民、殖民) 定居 (于)to make a place your permanent home：

example.main: Luo Yan and his wife and son have settled in the big city,罗言一家三口已经在大城市定居，远离家乡。
This region was settled by the Dutch in the 19th century.这个地区在19世纪开始有荷兰人定居。

phrase.main: vi & vt 对某事达成一致意见；解决to end an argument or solve a disagreement：

example.main: settle an argument解决争论
Most of the problems have been settled satisfactorily.大多数问题已得到满意的解决。

phrase.main: vt [常用于被动语态] 确定；决定to decide or arrange sth finally：

example.main: — When do you go to America?你什么时候去美国？
— Nothing’s settled yet.一切待定。
It was settled that they would get married in June.他们决定于6月结婚。

phrase.main: vi & vt (使) 平静；(使) 安定to become or make sb / sth become calm or quiet：

example.main: She breathed deeply to settle her nerves.她深呼吸来平复自己的紧张情绪。

phrase.main: vi 降落；停留：

example.main: A butterfly settled on a red flower.一只蝴蝶落在一朵红色的花上面。

phrase.main: vi 围绕；充满：

example.main: Depression settled over her like a heavy black cloud.忧郁的情绪像一片浓重的乌云笼罩在她的心头。

phrase.main: [U] 移民；殖民；开拓：

example.main: the settlement of the American West美国西部的开拓过程

phrase.main: [C] 定居点
[U] 解决；处理：

example.main: the settlement of an issue问题的解决

phrase.main: [C] 协议：

example.main: come to / reach a peace settlement with与…达成和平协议

phrase.main: 移居者；殖民者
几个的；数个的 (至少三个)：

example.main: I have been to Beijing several times.我去过几次北京。

phrase.main: 几个；数个：

example.main: Several of us failed in the exam.我们中有几个人考试不及格。

phrase.main: 严重的extremely bad or serious：

example.main: severe damage / a severe crisis 严重的损害/危机

phrase.main: 严厉的；苛刻的：

example.main: be severe with oneself严于律己

phrase.main: 严峻的；激烈的：

example.main: the severe winter严冬
severe competition激烈的竞争

phrase.main: vt & vi 缝；缝合；缝补：

example.main: My mother sewed my name tag into my shirts, trousers and woollen sweaters.妈妈把我的名字标签缝到我的衬衣、裤子和羊毛衫上。

phrase.main: 性别；性
性的；性别的
破旧的；寒酸的：

example.main: a shabby dress / room破旧的连衣裙/房间

phrase.main: [C] & [U]荫；阴凉处：

example.main: sit in the shade坐在背阴处
In hot, sunny climates, wide-edged hats provide shade from the sun.在炎热的天气里，宽檐帽可以遮阳。

phrase.main: [C]（色彩的）浓淡；深浅；色度：

example.main: He passed milky white waterfalls and mountains in many shades of blue.他走过 / 穿过乳白色的瀑布和深浅不一的蓝色山脉。

phrase.main: [U]（绘画的）暗部；阴影部分
[C] 影子；阴影；坏影响：

example.main: shadow play皮影戏
There is no shadow without light.没有光就没有影子。
Her father's illness cast a shadow over / on the wedding celebrations.她父亲的病给婚礼蒙上一层阴影。
shadows under sb’s eyes某人的黑眼圈
the shadow of death死亡的阴影

phrase.main: [U] [也可用复数] 背光处；阴暗处：

example.main: Sometimes she sits alone in the shadow(s).有时候她独自一人坐在暗处。

phrase.main: vt & vi (使) 摇动；(使) 抖动；颤抖：

example.main: shake one’s head摇头
Shake the bottle before drinking.喝前摇一摇瓶子。
He was shaking with anger.他气得发抖。

phrase.main: vt 握 (手)；同...握手：

example.main: shake sb's hand / shake hands (with sb) / shake sb by the hand与某人握手

phrase.main: vt 动摇；减弱；削弱：

example.main: shake sb’s confidence / belief动摇某人的信心 / 信仰

phrase.main: vt [不用于进行时] 使震惊
摇动；摇晃：奶昔：

example.main: Give the bottle a good shake before use.使用前要用力摇晃瓶子。
a strawberry shake草莓奶昔

phrase.main: 莎士比亚 (英国剧作家，诗人)
[用于第一人称] 将要；将会：

example.main: I shall be eighteen next month.下个月我就18岁了。

phrase.main: [表示说话者的允诺、命令、决心等，用于陈述句的第二、三人称] 必须；应；可：

example.main: You shall get the answer right this afternoon.今天下午你一定会得到答复的。

phrase.main: [在问句中表示征求对方意见，主要用于第一、三人称] ...好吗：

example.main: Shall I fetch some chalk?我去拿些粉笔来好吗？
Shall he come to see you?要他来见你吗？

phrase.main: [用在表示意图、要求等的从句中] 应该；要：

example.main: I wish that you shall stay at home tonight.我希望你今晚留在家里。
Ordinary people merely think how they shall spend their time; a man of talent tries to use it.普通人只想到要如何度过时间，而有才能的人却设法利用时间。

phrase.main: [用于法律、条约、协定等文件中] 义务；规定：

example.main: Each citizen shall carry his identification card when travelling.旅行时每个公民都必须带上身份证。

phrase.main: 浅的 【反：deep】；肤浅的：

example.main: shallow water浅水
a shallow writer / opinion肤浅的作者/观点

phrase.main: [U] 羞耻 (心)；羞愧 (感)：

example.main: The boy hung his head in shame.那个男孩子羞愧地低下了头。

phrase.main: [常用单数] 可耻的事 / 人；遗憾的事 (pity)：

example.main: It is a shame to be so wasteful.这样浪费太可耻了。
It’s a shame that you have to leave so soon.你这么快就要走，真令人遗憾。

phrase.main: 使成形：

example.main: an L-shaped sofa L形的沙发
Italy shaped like a boot lies in the south of Europe. 意大利位于欧洲的南部，它的形状像一只靴子。

phrase.main: 影响 / 决定 (事物的发展)：

example.main: It’s not what we do once in a while that shapes our lives, but what we do consistently. 不是我们偶尔所做的而是我们一贯所做的事影响自己的一生。

phrase.main: 形状；外形：

example.main: Although all kites have a similar structure, they are widely different in size and shape. 尽管所有的风筝都有着相似的结构，但他们的大小和形状极为不同。
For my fifth birthday, my mother baked me a cake in the shape of a monkey.我五岁生日的时候，妈妈给我烤了一个猴子形状的蛋糕。

phrase.main: 一份；份额；股份：

example.main: I’ll bear / take / have my share of the expense.我愿承担我的那份费用。
Share prices are down in London.伦敦的股票价格在下跌。

phrase.main: vt & vi 分享；合用；共用to have or use sth with others：

example.main: bike-sharing services共享单车服务
I have to share all my toys with my younger sisters.我不得不与妹妹们分享我所有的玩具。
She shared a house with three other students.她和其他三个学生合住一所房子。
There isn’t an empty table. Would you mind sharing?没有空桌了，你介意拼桌吗？

phrase.main: vt 分配；分摊；分担to divide sth between two or more people：

example.main: After his death, his property was shared out between his children.他去世后，财产被分给了子女。
I took a taxi together with another passenger and we shared the bill.我和另外一名乘客同坐一辆出租车，我们分摊了费用。
I can do my bit to help with the housework, so as to share mother’s daily burden.我尽自己的一点力来帮忙做家务，以分担妈妈的日常负担。

phrase.main: vt & vi 共同具有to have the same feelings, ideas, etc. as sb else：

example.main: a shared interest / value / future共同的兴趣 / 价值观 / 未来
On her day of discharge, we shared in her delight at her recovery.在她恢复健康出院的那天，我们和她一样高兴。
Race walking shares many fitness benefits with running.竞走和跑步都有许多健身的好处。
We shared the belief that if you're fortunate enough to have success, you should put something back.我们的想法一致，即若有幸成功，就应做出回馈。

phrase.main: vt & vi 向某人诉说 (想法 / 秘密 / 问题等)to tell others about your ideas, experiences and feelings：

example.main: The two friends shared everything and they had no secrets.这对朋友无话不谈，他们之间毫无秘密。
It's an honour to be here and to share with you the story of how music has had an impact on my life.非常荣幸来到这里与大家分享音乐是如何影响了我的人生的。

phrase.main: [C] 鲨鱼
正 (指时刻)；整：

example.main: 2 o’clock sharp两点整

phrase.main: 锋利的；尖的：

example.main: sharp teeth锋利的牙齿

phrase.main: (感观) 敏锐的；(人) 机灵的：

example.main: She has sharp eyes.她目光敏锐。
a sharp child机灵的孩子

phrase.main: (言辞等) 尖刻的；严厉的(of a person or what they say) critical or severe：

example.main: be sharp with sb对某人严厉
She has a sharp tongue.她说话很刻薄。

phrase.main: (角度、变化等) 急剧的sudden and rapid, especially of a change：

example.main: a sharp bend急转弯
a sharp drop / increase in prices 价格急剧下跌/上涨

phrase.main: 剧烈的；猛烈的：

example.main: I felt a sharp pain in my back.我感到背上一阵剧痛。

phrase.main: 尖厉的；刺耳的：

example.main: Through all the noise came a sharp warning cry.嘈杂中传来一声尖锐的警告声。

phrase.main: 削尖；磨快：

example.main: sharpen a pencil削铅笔

phrase.main: 使提高；使改进：

example.main: Debates sharpen one’s wits.辩论增长才智。

phrase.main: [C] 磨具；削具；铅笔刀
vt & vi剃 / 刮 (胡须等)；修剪：

example.main: shave one’s head / the lawn 剃头/修剪草坪

phrase.main: 刮脸；修面：

example.main: have a good shave好好刮一下胡子
The barber gave him a shave and a haircut.理发师给他修了修面、理了理发。

phrase.main: 电动剃刀
[主格] 她
[作为国家、地球、月球、车船等的代词] 她；它：

example.main: — What’s wrong with the car?车出什么毛病了？
— She won’t start.发动不起来了。

phrase.main: [C](pl sheep) 羊；绵羊
被单；床单：

example.main: change bed sheets换床单

phrase.main: 一张 (纸)；(一) 片；(一) 块：

example.main: a sheet of paper一张纸
answer sheets答题纸
In winter, the mountains are covered in sheets of white frost.冬天，山上覆盖着一层白霜。

phrase.main: (pl shelves)架子；(壁橱、书橱等的) 搁板：

example.main: shelf life保存期；货架期
Replace the books on the shelf after reading.阅读后把书放回书架。

phrase.main: 剥 (...壳)：

example.main: as easy as shelling peas 像剥豆子一样容易；非常容易

phrase.main: (蛋 / 果 / 贝) 壳；炮弹
水生有壳动物
[C] 遮盖物；躲避处；避难所：

example.main: We should find a shelter from the wind.我们应该找个避风的地方。
Rescue workers built shelters for survivors whose homes had been destroyed.救援人员为那些家园被毁的幸存者盖起了避难所。

phrase.main: [U] 居所；住处：

example.main: Food, clothing, fuel and shelter are the four most basic human needs.食品、衣物、燃料和住所是人类最基本的四种需求。

phrase.main: [U] 保护；掩蔽；庇护：

example.main: find / take shelter from the rain避雨
They were standing under the shelter of a huge tree.他们站在一棵大树下躲着。

phrase.main: vt 掩蔽；保护；为...提供避难所：

example.main: Graduation represents moving from the sheltered life of high school into the real world.毕业意味着从备受保护的中学生活中走出来进入到现实世界之中。
Trees were planted to shelter this area from strong sand storms.人们种树使这个地区免受强沙尘暴的侵袭。

phrase.main: vi 躲避；避难：

example.main: We sat in the shade, sheltering from the sun.我们坐在背阴处躲避日晒。

phrase.main: [C] 转移；转换：

example.main: the shift from the cottage industry to the factory system从家庭手工业到工厂制度的转变
a shift in attitude态度的转变

phrase.main: [C] 班；轮班：

example.main: be on the day / night shift值白/夜班

phrase.main: [U] (计算机) 转换 (键) (shift key)
vi & vt (使) 转移；(使) 移动：

example.main: shift the furniture搬家具
Joe listened, shifting uncomfortably from one foot to another.乔听着，不安地把重心从一只脚移到另一只脚上。
The White House hopes to shift the media’s attention away from foreign policy issues.白宫希望把媒体的注意力从外交政策问题上转移开。
Nowadays the priority for travelling is shifted from shopping to food and scenery.如今，人们旅游时优先考虑的事情从购物转移到美食和风景。

phrase.main: vi & vt （使）改变to change your opinion of or attitude towards sb / sth：

example.main: He refused to shift his ground.他拒绝改变立场。

phrase.main: 先令 (1971年以前的英国货币单位，旧币的12便士)
vi 发光； 发亮；照耀；vt 把…照向：

example.main: The moon shone brightly in the sky.皓月当空。
Please shine your flashlight over there.请把手电筒往那儿照。

phrase.main: 船；舰
把...装上船；用船运送：

example.main: They shipped the machine from Shanghai to Tianjin last week.上周他们用船把机器从上海运往天津。

phrase.main: 衬衫
[C] & [U] (爆炸、地震等引起的) 剧烈震动；冲击：

example.main: the shock wave冲击波
The shock of the earthquake was felt miles away.地震引起的震动在数英里之外都能感觉得到。

phrase.main: [C] 电击；触电 (electric shock)：

example.main: Don’t touch that wire or you’ll get a shock.别碰那根线，否则你会触电的。

phrase.main: [U] & [C] [常用单数] (精神上的) 震惊；打击；令人震惊的事：

example.main: Mom hasn’t gotten over the shock of Dad’s death.妈妈还没有从爸爸去世的打击中恢复过来。
It came as a shock to hear that the factory would have to close.听说工厂要关闭，人们感到很震惊。

phrase.main: [U] 休克：

example.main: She was taken to hospital suffering from shock.她因休克被送往医院。

phrase.main: 使震惊；使气愤：

example.main: The news of the school shooting shocked the world.校园枪击事件的消息让整个世界为之震惊。
He seems to enjoy shocking people.他好像以冒犯他人为乐。

phrase.main: 鞋：

example.main: Every shoe fits not every foot.不可用一种尺度衡量一切。

phrase.main: 嫩枝；新芽：

example.main: bamboo shoots竹笋
The rose is putting out new shoots.玫瑰正抽出新芽。

phrase.main: vi & vt 开（枪等武器）；射出；射击：

example.main: He shot the arrow from the bow.他拉弓把箭射了出去。
He hit the target after he shot at it several times.他几次射击后终于射中了靶子。

phrase.main: vt 射中；射死：

example.main: The police shot one suspect when he pulled a gun on them. 警方击毙一名对他们拔枪的嫌疑人。

phrase.main: vt & vi拍摄：

example.main: The movie was shot in New Zealand.这部电影是在新西兰拍摄的。

phrase.main: vt & vi射门；投篮：

example.main: shoot baskets投篮
The basketball player shot the last goal.那位篮球运动员投进了最后一球。

phrase.main: vi & vt(使)快速移动：

example.main: She shot past me several metres before the finishing line.她在离终点线几米远的地方飞快地超过了我。
The pickpocket shot his hand into her bag.扒手迅速地将手伸进了她的包。
One more look and he noticed flames shooting out from under the vehicle.他再一看，注意到火苗从抛锚的汽车底部喷射出来。

phrase.main: 商店；车间；工厂：

example.main: a beauty shop美容院
run / open / close a shop经营/开/关店铺

phrase.main: 到商店去购物：

example.main: We were excited about shopping for our first home. 要买我们的第一所房子我们感到很兴奋。

phrase.main: 店主
购物：

example.main: go shopping去购物
online shopping网上购物

phrase.main: 岸；滨：

example.main: The trees on the shores of the lake were reflected in the clear water.湖沿岸的树木倒映在清澈的湖水里。

phrase.main: 短小的东西；扼要
(长度、时间) 短的【反：long】；近的；矮的【反：tall】：

example.main: cut / make a long story short长话短说
The bus stop is a short way off.公交车站离这儿不远。
He is too short to become a basketball player.他个子太矮，当不了篮球运动员。

phrase.main: 不足的；缺乏的：

example.main: When she went to pay for her groceries, she was short about three dollars.当她去付食品款时，发现还缺大约三美元。
These goods are short in supply.这些货物供应短缺。

phrase.main: 简短的；简洁的；缩写的：

example.main: His answer was short and to the point.他的回答简明切题。

phrase.main: 短缺；缺乏；不足 (lack)：

example.main: severe food / water / housing / electricity shortages严重的食物 / 用水 / 住房 / 电力短缺
a shortage of skilled labour熟练劳动力的短缺
There is no shortage of (= There are plenty of) restaurants in the city.城市里不愁找不到餐馆。

phrase.main: 缺点；短处a fault or weakness：

example.main: overcome shortcomings克服缺点

phrase.main: vt & vi (使) 变短；缩短：

example.main: a shortened version of classics经典著作的缩略版
Smoking shortens your life.吸烟会减寿。
Days shorten in winter.冬季白天变短。

phrase.main: 立刻；不久：

example.main: A housewarming party happens shortly after a person moves into their new home.乔迁聚会是在一个人搬进新家后不久举行的。

phrase.main: 短裤
发射；射击；枪 (炮) 声：

example.main: All the soldiers had been ordered to issue clear warnings before firing any shots.命令所有士兵在开枪前必须明确示警。
Someone took a shot at the car.有人朝轿车开枪。
We heard some shots in the distance.我们听见远处有几声枪响。

phrase.main: 枪手；炮手
投篮；射门；击球：

example.main: In the football match Shaw took a shot at the goal from the halfway line, but missed.在足球比赛中，肖从中场线射门，但没射中。

phrase.main: [非正式用语]尝试；努力：

example.main: I decided to have a shot at decorating the house myself.我决定试着自己动手装修房子。
He didn’t think he had much chance of winning, but he’d give it a shot.他觉得自己获胜的机会不大，但还是要尝试一下。

phrase.main: 注射：

example.main: The baby burst out crying when the doctor gave him a shot.医生给婴儿打针时，那婴儿突然大哭起来。

phrase.main: 拍摄；照相；(电影中的) 镜头：

example.main: I managed to get some good shots of the festival.我设法拍到了几张精彩的节日照片。
a shot of a car chase汽车追逐的镜头

phrase.main: [非正式用语]少量饮料；少量烈酒
[表示责任、义务] 应该：

example.main: We should respect our teachers and parents.我们应该尊敬老师和父母。

phrase.main: [表示可能性、推测或推论] 可能；应该：

example.main: The report is written after much research, so it should be reliable.这份报告是经过充分调研后才写的，所以应该是可靠的。

phrase.main: [表示语气较强的假设，常用于虚拟条件句]万一；竟然：

example.main: If you should change your mind, do let me know.万一你改变主意，请务必告诉我。
Should you / If you should come across waste paper thrown out of a passing car, pick it up.如果你遇到从经过的车里扔出来的废纸，就把它捡起来。

phrase.main: [用于表示建议、命令、决定等的句中] 应该；必须：

example.main: Dr Bethune insisted that the patient (should) be operated on at once.白求恩大夫坚持应立刻给病人动手术。

phrase.main: [表示与预期相反] 本应；本当：

example.main: It should be snowing now, according to the weather broadcast.按照天气预报，现在应该在下雪。

form.main: [表示本该做某事，而实际没做] should have done sth:

example.main: We should have studied last night, but we went to the concert instead.昨晚我们本应该学习，但却去听音乐会了。

form.main: [表示本不该做某事，实际却做了] shouldn’t have done sth:

example.main: I was really anxious about you. You shouldn’t have left home without a word.我真为你担心，你不该不说一声就离开家。

phrase.main: [用于过去将来时，常用于间接引语] 将会；将要：

example.main: The monitor said that we should have a class meeting the next week.班长说我们下周要开班会。

phrase.main: [用于许多表示感情的形容词后的that从句中]：

example.main: It's strange that he should have taken the books without the owner's permission.真奇怪，他居然没有得到主人的允许就把书拿走。

phrase.main: 承担；担负：

example.main: You don’t need to shoulder the blame for this failure.你无须对这次失败承担责任。

phrase.main: 肩膀：

example.main: shoulder to shoulder肩并肩地

phrase.main: 喊叫声：

example.main: Seeing the sun rising above the surface of the sea, we let out a shout of joy.看到太阳从海面升起来，我们高兴得叫了起来。

phrase.main: vi & vt 呼喊；大声说；斥责：

example.main: shout orders高喊口令
She shouted out for help.她大声呼救。
I was very angry. I opened my window and shouted at / to the other driver.我很生气，打开车窗朝对方司机大喊。

phrase.main: 演出；表演；(广播 / 电视) 节目：

example.main: The theatre gives two shows in one day.这家剧场一天演出两场。
show business娱乐行业；演艺界
a quiz / talk show智力竞赛节目

phrase.main: 展览 (会)：

example.main: All the collections will be on show from June 16 to 18 in the gym.所有的收藏品都将于6月16日至18日在体育馆展出。

phrase.main: vt 给...看；出示：

example.main: Show your passport, please.请出示护照。

form.main: show sth to sb / show sb sth:

example.main: Show your photos to your classmates. / Show your classmates your photos.把你的照片给同学们看。

phrase.main: vt 展览；陈列；上映；上演：

example.main: She plans to show her paintings next year.她计划明年展出自己的绘画作品。
Next week we will show the Chinese film My Happy Life. 下周我们将放映中国电影《我的幸福生活》。

phrase.main: vt 指给...看；指出；带领：

example.main: We were showed into the waiting room.我们被领进了等候室。
Could you please show me the way to Beihai Park?你能指给我去北海公园的路吗？

phrase.main: vt 表明；说明；证明：

example.main: Gary has shown his faith in the club’s future by agreeing to stay on.加里同意留下，这表明了他对这家俱乐部的未来有信心。
Lots of studies have shown that global warming has already become a very serious problem.许多研究已表明，全球变暖已经成为一个非常严重的问题。
The paintings on the walls showed how life was 1,700 years ago.这些壁画说明了1 700年前的生活是什么样子的。

form.main: show oneself to be / have sth:

example.main: Charles shows himself to be a fine leader.查尔斯证明自己是个出色的领导。

phrase.main: vt (通过示范) 教；解说：

form.main: show sth to sb / show sb sth:

example.main: She showed the technique to her students. / She showed her students the technique.她教给学生那个技巧。

form.main: show sb + wh- 从句 / wh- to do sth:

example.main: Let me show you how the new machine works / how to use the new machine.我来给你演示一下这台新机器如何运转 / 怎么用。

phrase.main: vt & vi 表现 (出)；体现 (出)；流露 (出)：

example.main: Edmonds showed a gift for writing at his high school.高中时，埃德蒙就表现出写作的天分。
She tried not to let her disappointment show.她极力掩饰自己的失望。

phrase.main: 阵雨；淋浴 (器)：

example.main: Tom was caught in a shower yesterday.汤姆昨天淋了雨。
take / have a hot shower淋热水浴

phrase.main: 虾
vi & vt (使) 缩水；(使) 收缩：

example.main: Will this shirt shrink in the wash?这件衬衫洗后会缩水吗？

phrase.main: vi & vt (使) 缩小；减少；贬值：

example.main: In the US, the jazz audience continues to shrink and grow older.在美国，爵士乐的听众人数持续减少、年龄逐渐变大。
The Internet in a sense has shrunk the world.从某种意义上来说，互联网把世界缩小了。

phrase.main: vi 退缩；畏缩
vt & vi (为表示冷漠、无奈、蔑视、不满等) 耸 (肩)：

example.main: I just shrugged my shoulders and ignored him.我只是耸耸肩，不去理睬他。

phrase.main: vt & vi 关上；闭上；合上：

example.main: shut one’s eyes / a book闭上眼睛/合上书
The window won’t shut.这扇窗户关不上。

phrase.main: vt & vi (使) 停止营业(close)：

example.main: It’s time to shut the shop.商店该关门了。
The stores shut at 9:30 pm.这些商店晚上9:30关门。

phrase.main: (织布机的) 梭；短程穿梭运行的车辆、飞机等；航天飞机：

example.main: the space shuttle航天飞机

phrase.main: 害羞的；羞怯的：

example.main: a shy smile羞怯的微笑
Many students are quite shy and don't speak all that much.许多学生生性腼腆，沉默寡言。

phrase.main: 西西里岛 (意大利南部)
有病的；患病的：

example.main: get / become / fall sick生病
He has been on sick leave for three days.他休病假已经三天了。

phrase.main: 恶心的；要呕吐的：

example.main: I am always sick in the car.我经常晕车。

phrase.main: [口语] 厌倦的；厌恶的：

example.main: I was growing sick of my life in San Francisco.我愈发厌倦在旧金山的生活。

phrase.main: [U] & [C] 患病；疾病 (illness)：

example.main: a sickness of fear恐惧症

phrase.main: [U] 呕吐；恶心
（一方的）观点；态度 (point of view)

example.main: Try and see my side of things, please!试着考虑下我的意见吧！

phrase.main: 边；面；侧面：

example.main: a shape with four sides四边形
the right / wrong side of the paper纸的正面/背面
There is a bank on the other / opposite side of the street.街对面有一家银行。

phrase.main: (身体的) 侧边：

example.main: lie on one’s side侧身而卧

phrase.main: 方面：

example.main: Always look on the bright / positive side and never lose hope, even in difficult situations.要一直看到事情好的一面，即便身处困境，也永远不要失去希望。

phrase.main: 一方；一派：

example.main: both sides in a battle作战双方
be on the same side of the fence站在同一立场上

phrase.main: 旁路；旁侧路
[美] 人行道 (BrEpavement)
小路；小巷；人行道
斜向旁边；侧着身子：

example.main: If you would move sideways to the left, I can get everyone in the picture.如果你向左边侧一下身子，我就能把所有人都拍进去。

phrase.main: 往旁边的；侧的：

example.main: The boy gave the girl a sideways look.男孩斜着眼睛看了看女孩。

phrase.main: 叹息；叹气：

example.main: breathe / let out a deep sigh发出深深的叹息

phrase.main: 叹息；叹气；悲叹：

example.main: She sighed with relief when she heard the good news.听到这个好消息，她如释重负地叹了口气。

phrase.main: [U] 视力；视觉：

example.main: have good / poor sight视力好/差
When Shaw lost his sight, his wife suggested he apply for a guide dog.肖失明后，他的妻子建议他申请一只导盲犬。

phrase.main: [U] 看见；瞥见the act of seeing sb / sth：

example.main: Just the sight of the monster made her go all weak.她一看到那个怪物就两腿发软。

phrase.main: [U] 视域；眼界：the area or distance within which sb can see or sth can be seen：

example.main: I glanced around me quickly. There was no one in sight.我迅速向四周扫了一眼，一个人也没看见。
She never lets her daughter out of her sight.她从不让女儿离开她的视线。

phrase.main: [C] 看见的事物；景象；情景：the thing that you can see：

example.main: The practice of hanging flags is a common sight in many parts of the country on National Day.国庆节期间全国各地都悬挂国旗是常见的景象。
These mountains are a splendid sight when viewed from the valley floor.从谷底看，这些山非常壮观。

phrase.main: [复数] 名胜；景点：

example.main: Overseas visitors are impressed by the beautiful sights of Beijing.北京美丽的景点给海外游客留下深刻的印象。

phrase.main: 观光；游览：

example.main: go sightseeing去观光
a sightseeing tour观光旅行

phrase.main: [C]（头、手、眼等的）示意动作；手势：

example.main: He gave / made a thumbs-up sign.他竖起大拇指。
sign language手语

phrase.main: [C] & [U] 迹象；征兆 (indication)：

example.main: The rainy weather showed no sign of improving.雨还在下，没有转晴的迹象。
sign of life / vital signs生命迹象 / 生命体征

phrase.main: [C]［非正式用语］星座 (star sign)

example.main: What sign are you?你是什么星座？

phrase.main: [C] 指示牌；标牌；标记：

example.main: a road / traffic / store sign道路标识 / 交通标识 / 商店标牌
The sign says “No smoking”.告示牌上写着“禁止吸烟”。

phrase.main: [C] 符号 (symbol)：

example.main: a plus / dollar sign加号 / 美元符号

phrase.main: 示意；打手势 (signal)；打手语：

example.main: The teacher signed me to enter.老师打手势示意我进来。
She learnt to sign to help her deaf child.为了帮助自己失聪的孩子，她学会了手语。

phrase.main: 签（名）；签字（于信、文件等）：

example.main: sign an agreement / a contract签协议/合同
Sign (your name) here, please.请在这里签字。

phrase.main: （和……）签约：

example.main: The football club has just signed a new player.这家足球俱乐部刚刚与一名新球员签约。

phrase.main: 信号；暗号(sign)；信号灯：

example.main: This was a signal for him to continue.这是一个让他继续的信号。
digital TV signals数字电视信号

phrase.main: vi & vt 发信号；示意；vt 表明；标志着：

example.main: He signalled widely for help, but nobody noticed.他拼命地发信号求助，但是没人注意到。
The bell signalled that school was over.铃声响起，放学了。
She signalled to her students to exit the classroom in an orderly line.她示意学生排好队，有序离开教室。

phrase.main: 署名；签名：

example.main: add / write one’s signature签字

phrase.main: 重要性；(意义) 重大the importance or meaning of sth：

example.main: Both her parents attach much significance to education.她父母都非常重视教育。
All the members should realize the value and significance of what they are going to do.所有成员都应该认识到他们将要做的事情的价值和重要性。
The discovery of the new drug is of great significance for / to people suffering from heart problems.这种新药的发现对心脏病患者来说意义重大。

phrase.main: 有某种意义的；意味深长的have a special meaning：

example.main: a significant look / smile意味深长的眼神 / 微笑
Are the markings on the stone significant?石头上的标记有特别意义吗？

phrase.main: 重要的；（意义）重大的having an important effect or infl uence, especially on what will happen in the future：

example.main: The Spring Festival is regarded as the most significant festival of the year among the Chinese.春节被认为是中国人一年中最重要的节日。
a highly significant discovery具有极其重大意义的发现
As a child, Adeline couldn't understand why the medal was so significant.小时候，艾德琳不明白为何那个勋章如此重要。

phrase.main: (数量) 大的；显著的large enough to be noticeable or have noticeable effects：

example.main: They are spending a significant amount of time in fruitless efforts as they multitask. 他们同时做几件事时，耗费了大量时间却徒劳无益。
a significant improvement / increase明显的进步 / 显著的增长
It is significant that girls generally do better in examinations than boys.很明显，女生在考试中的表现通常好于男生。

phrase.main: 使沉默；使哑口无言：

example.main: The teacher tried to silence the pupils.老师设法让学生们安静下来。

phrase.main: [C] & [U]沉默；默不作声：

example.main: a two-minute silence in honour of those who had died为死去的人默哀两分钟
I got used to his silence on the money.我习惯了他在钱的问题上保持沉默。

phrase.main: [U]无声；寂静：(quiet)

example.main: A scream broke the silence of the night.一声尖叫打破了深夜的寂静。
I can’t study with any kind of music — I have to work in silence or I can’t think!我必须在安静的环境中学习，不能伴着音乐，否则我无法思考！

phrase.main: 不说话的；沉默的：

example.main: keep / remain silent保持沉默

phrase.main: 寂静无声的；不发音的：

example.main: a silent, moonless night寂静的没有月亮的夜晚
a silent film / movie无声电影
silent reading默读
The "b" in "lamb" is silent.lamb中的b不发音。

phrase.main: [U]丝；丝绸；丝线：

example.main: the Silk Road Economic Belt丝绸之路经济带

phrase.main: [常用复数] 丝绸衣服
傻的；愚蠢的 (foolish)

example.main: It’s silly of you to believe him. / You are silly to believe him.你真傻，居然相信他。

phrase.main: 无聊的
银；银器；银币；银牌；银白色：

example.main: fine / pure silver纯银
He has hair of silver.他一头银发。

phrase.main: 银制的；银白色的：

example.main: a silver medal / silver hair银牌 / 银发

phrase.main: 相似的；类似的：

example.main: Some body language is similar everywhere.有些肢体语言在各个地方都相似。
Mencius was a thinker whose teachings were very similar to those of Confucius. 孟子是位思想家，他的学说与孔子的非常相似。

phrase.main: 相似性；相像处
简单的 (easy)：

example.main: Only those who have the patience to do simple things perfectly ever acquire the skill to do difficult things easily. 只有有耐心圆满完成简单工作的人，才能够轻松地完成困难的事。

phrase.main: 朴素的；纯朴的：

example.main: He lives a simple life.他过着简朴的生活。
a simple fisherman纯朴的渔民

phrase.main: 头脑简单的；迟钝的：

example.main: They’re not so simple as to believe all that.他们不至于糊涂到相信那一套。

phrase.main: [常用于名词前]纯粹的：

example.main: You must accept it because that’s a simple fact.你必须接受，因为那完全是事实。

phrase.main: 简化：

example.main: Rather than making something complicated, simplify it.不要把事情搞复杂，要简化。

phrase.main: 简单地；简明地：

example.main: To put it simply, computer skills are vital to today’s learners and tomorrow’s bread-winners. 简而言之，计算机技能对今天的学习者以及将来要养家糊口的人而言都是至关重要的。
The book explains grammar simply and clearly.这本书简洁明了地解释语法。

phrase.main: 朴素地；简朴地

example.main: live simply简朴地生活

phrase.main: 仅仅；只不过 (just)：

example.main: I can buy and eat whatever I want simply with a tap of my mobile phone.只要轻点一下手机，我就能买到、吃到我想要的任何东西。

phrase.main: 完全；简直；确实：

example.main: I simply don’t know.我真的不知道。

phrase.main: 罪；罪恶；罪过
从那时以后；后来：

example.main: I have not seen him since.从那以后，我就没见过他。

phrase.main: 自...以来；从...以后：

example.main: I have been a panda lover since my childhood.从小我就很喜欢熊猫。

phrase.main: [常与现在或过去完成时连用] 自...以来；从...以后：

example.main: I haven’t visited my teacher since I graduated.自从毕业后我就没拜访过我的老师。
It had been a year since Susan became blind.苏珊失明已经一年了。

phrase.main: 因为；既然：

example.main: You will find it easy to join us since we all want to make friends with you.你会发现和我们在一起很容易，因为我们都想和你交朋友。

phrase.main: 真诚的；诚挚的；诚恳的
真诚地；诚恳地：

example.main: I sincerely hope you could join us.我真诚地希望你能加入我们。

phrase.main: vt & vi唱；演唱；歌唱；歌颂：

example.main: sing a song for sb / sing sb a song为某人唱一首歌
sing to the guitar和着吉他伴奏唱歌
sing high praise for高度赞扬

phrase.main: 新加坡 (东南亚国家)
新加坡的；新加坡人的
新加坡人

phrase.main: 宠坏；溺爱：

example.main: She’s an only child, but her parents didn’t really spoil her.她是个独生女，不过她的父母没有娇惯她。

Mei Lanfang had been performing and encouraging the spread of Peking Opera for almost 60 years.梅兰芳在近60年的时间里一直致力于京剧的表演和传播。

phrase.main: vt伸开；打开；铺开：

example.main: From homegrown traditions to international celebrations, the Spring Festival is helping spread Chinese culture worldwide.从本土的传统活动发展到国际范围内的庆祝活动，春节将中国文化传播到了世界各地。

She is the sort of woman to spread sunshine to people through her smile.她是那种用微笑给别人带来阳光的女人。

phrase.main: vi & vt覆盖；(使) 分布：

All the advantage isn’t in running fast, but rather in getting an early start.优势不在于跑得快，而在于起身早。

Although the company showed no sign of declining, it was generally in an unhealthy state.尽管这家公司没有显现出衰退的迹象，但总体来说处于一种不良状态。

After all, each step we take is one more step forward to becoming a stronger and better person.毕竟，我们迈出的每一步都是成为更强大、更好的人的又一步。

Many of the families were struggling to make ends meet.许多家庭都在努力维持生计。

phrase.main: 搏斗；争斗：

example.main: He died in a struggle with the attackers.他在一次与袭击者的搏斗中死亡。

phrase.main: [单数] 难事：

example.main: It was a struggle for her to make him understand.让他理解对她来说真是件难事。

example.main: Never give up without a struggle.未经努力不要放弃。

phrase.main: 愚蠢的(foolish / silly)；笨的：

phrase.main: [C] & [U]（设计的）款式；流行式样：

phrase.main: [U]（人或事物的）格调；气派a quality that people admire or think is attractive：

example.main: You may not like her, but she certainly has style.你可能不喜欢她，但是她确实有气度。

The professional basketball team played with style.那支职业篮球队打得很有气势。

主观 (上) 的；个人的:

Time can not be lengthened by man’s subjective will, but it can be shortened by his wasting it.时间不因人的主观意志而延长，却可以因其浪费而缩短。

phrase.main: 潜 (水) 艇

example.main: subscribe to a charity 向慈善机构定期捐款

phrase.main: 认购（股份）
[C] 物质：

example.main: a harmful / poisonous / radioactive / cancercausing substance有害 / 有毒 / 放射性 / 致癌物质
illegal / banned / controlled substances非法 / 违禁 / 管制品（尤指毒品）
Diamond is the hardest substance known.钻石是已知的最坚硬的物质。
Ice and snow are different forms of the same substance, water.冰和雪是同一种物质—水的不同形式。

phrase.main: [U]［正式用语］事实基础；根据：

example.main: There is some substance in what he says.他说的话是有一定根据的。
There is no substance in / to what he says.他说的话毫无根据。

phrase.main: [U]主旨；要点；主要内容 (essence)：

example.main: I agree with the substance of what you say, but differ on points of detail.我赞同你说的主要内容，但在细节上有一些不同意见。

phrase.main: [U] [正式用语] 重要性 (significance)：

example.main: matters / issues of substance重要的事情 / 议题

phrase.main: 大量的；价值巨大的；重大的large in amount, value or importance (considerable):

example.main: a substantial change重大变化
a substantial salary / breakfast丰厚的薪水 / 丰盛的早餐
a substantial number / amount / sum of许多；大量的

phrase.main: [正式用语] [常用于名词前]坚实的；结实的；牢固的large and solid; strongly built：

example.main: a substantial house结实的房子

phrase.main: [C] 代替品；代替者：

example.main: There’s no substitute for our Earth.没有什么能替代我们的地球。

phrase.main: (用...) 代替：

example.main: You can substitute vegetable oil for butter in this recipe.在这份食谱中，你可用植物油代替黄油。

phrase.main: [常用单数] 副标题；小标题；[用复数] (外国电影的) 字幕
难以察觉的；微妙的【反：obvious】；精巧的：

example.main: subtle differences / changes 细微的差异/变化
subtle flavours / smells淡淡的味道/气味

phrase.main: [C] [常用复数] 市郊；郊区：

example.main: a London suburb / a suburb of London 伦敦郊区
live in the suburbs 住在郊区

phrase.main: 地道
地铁 (BrE underground)：

example.main: by subway乘地铁
ride / take the subway 乘地铁
a subway train / station 地铁列车/站

phrase.main: vt 接替；替换：

example.main: He will succeed his father as manager of the shop.他将接替父亲担任商店的经理。
This car is intended to succeed the popular Fiesta.这款汽车是为了取代广受欢迎的福特嘉年华而推出的。

phrase.main: vi 继承 (财产、地位等)：

example.main: When the king died, his elder son succeeded to the throne.国王死后，他的长子继承了王位。

phrase.main: vi取得成功；达到目的to manage to achieve what you want：

example.main: If at first you don’t succeed, try again.若一开始不成功，再试一次。
Owing to her assistance, we succeeded in starting the engine.多亏她帮忙，我们才把车发动起来。

phrase.main: vi (在事业上) 取得成功；功成名就to do well in your job, especially because you have worked hard at it for a long time：

example.main: a woman who succeeded in politics在政界很有成就的一位女性
Everyone wants to succeed at work.每个人都希望在工作中有所成就。

phrase.main: [U] 成功；成就：

example.main: achieve / earn / win great success in life在人生中取得巨大的成就
I had suggested his doing it another way, but without success. 我建议他用别的方式做，但他没听。
Always bear in mind that your own resolution to success is more important than any one thing.永远记住：你自己想要成功的决心比任何事都重要。

phrase.main: [C] 成功的人 / 事：

example.main: He is a great success as a writer.他是一个成功的作家。
A true friend is one who overlooks your failures and tolerates your successes.真正的朋友从不追究你的过错，也从不妒忌你的成功。

phrase.main: 成功的；有成就的:

example.main: a successful career / plan / businessman成功的事业 / 计划 / 商人
He is successful in his career. 他事业有成。
They were very successful in achieving both aims.他们成功地实现了两个目标。

phrase.main: 这样的人 / 事物：

example.main: Such were her words. 这些就是她所说的话。
Such was Einstein, a simple man of great achievements.这就是爱因斯坦，一个简朴而又取得伟大成就的人。

phrase.main: [无最高级和比较级] 这样的；那样的；此类的：

example.main: Such behaviour is just not acceptable in our school.这样的行为在我们学校是绝对不能接受的。

phrase.main: [用于强调] 那么的；如此的：

example.main: Why are you in such a hurry? 你为什么这么着急？

phrase.main: vt & vi吸；吸食；吸取；（使）卷入：

example.main: suck the juice / thumb吮吸果汁 / 拇指
The egg will be sucked into the bottle.鸡蛋会被吸进瓶子里。

phrase.main: 吸；吸食；吸取
苏丹 (非洲国家)
突然的；意外的：

example.main: a sudden decision / increase 突然的决定/增长
a sudden turn in the road 路上的急转弯

phrase.main: 突然地；意外地：

example.main: We were about to leave there when it began to rain heavily and suddenly. 就在我们要离开时，突然下起了大雨。

phrase.main: vi & vt患（病）；（因疾病）受苦to experience physical or mental pain：

example.main: suffer (from) a heart attack患心脏病
She is suffering a lot of pain.她在遭受着巨大的痛苦。
I'm suffering from a bad back.我背疼得厉害。

phrase.main: vi & vt遭受（困难等）to experience and be badly affected by sth：

example.main: suffer (from) defeat / loss遭受失败 / 损失
The factory suffered severe damage in the fire. 那个工厂在火灾中损失惨重。
You will suffer one day for your carelessness.你早晚会因为你的粗心而吃苦头。
He greatly suffered from homesickness during his first few months abroad.出国后的前几个月他特别想家。

phrase.main: vi变差；变糟to become worse：

example.main: His school work is suffering because of family problems. 因为家庭问题他的学业受到了影响。

phrase.main: [U](身体或精神上) 疼痛；痛苦：

example.main: He died without much suffering. 他死的时候没有多少痛苦。
This experience caused him much mental suffering.这一次经历给他的精神造成极大的痛苦。

phrase.main: [常用复数] 苦难；折磨：

example.main: He slept on firewood and straw to remind him of his sufferings. 他睡在柴火和稻草上，提醒自己不要忘记所遭受的苦难。

phrase.main: 足够的；充足的 (enough)：

example.main: sufficient reasons / evidence / time / food充足的理由 / 证据 / 时间 / 食物
Her income is not sufficient to support her family.她的收入不够养家糊口。
The food on the table is sufficient for three people.桌子上的食物足够三个人吃。
a self-sufficient ecosystem自给自足的生态系统

phrase.main: 糖
含糖的；甜的
建议；提议；提出：

example.main: John suggested a swim and we all agreed. 约翰提议去游泳，我们都同意了。
He suggested playing football after school. 他提议放学后去踢足球。
The doctor suggested he go for a holiday. 医生建议他去休个假。
We all suggested that a lab be built. 我们都建议建个实验室。
Traditional Chinese medicine suggests people take “less spicy and more sour food” as diet after Minor Snow.中医建议人们，小雪后的饮食要“少辣多酸”。

form.main: it is suggested that sb (should) do sth:

example.main: It is suggested that we smile as much as possible.有人建议我们尽可能多地微笑。

phrase.main: 推荐(recommend)：

example.main: Can you suggest a good dictionary? 你能推荐本好字典吗？

phrase.main: 表明；暗示(indicate)：

example.main: Her expression suggested (that) she was angry. 她的表情说明她生气了。
Are you suggesting that I’m not working hard? 你是在暗示说我工作不努力吗？

phrase.main: [C] 建议：

example.main: accept / adopt a suggestion接受 / 采纳建议
give sb a suggestion (for / about / on)给某人一个（关于…）的建议
I’d like to make some suggestions on English teaching and learning in our school.我想就我校的英语教学提出一些建议。
The manager put forward a suggestion that we (should) have an assistant.经理提出建议，我们应该请一个助理。

phrase.main: [C] & [U] 暗示；迹象：

example.main: There was a suggestion of anger in her face. 她面带怒色。

phrase.main: 自杀
(一套) 衣服：

example.main: a business / diving suit 西服/潜水服

phrase.main: (服装、颜色等) 适合；对 (某人) 方便；中...的意：

example.main: I found an evening dress that suited me perfectly. 我找到一件非常适合我的晚礼服。
If we meet at 9 a.m., would that suit you? 我们早上9点见面，你方便吗？
There is Chinese food to suit everyone's taste, with traditional dishes from all over China.有适合每个人口味、来自中国各地的传统菜肴。

derivative.main: adj[不用于名词前，与for / to连用]suited

phrase.main: 适合的；适宜的：

example.main: I don’t have anything suitable to wear for the party.我没有适合在晚会上穿的衣服。
This programme is not suitable for children.这个节目儿童不宜。
Not all men are suitable for that kind of work. 不是所有的人都适合从事那类工作。

phrase.main: 手提箱
(一套) 家具；套房；一套物件：

example.main: book a suite 订套房
a suite of programs for a computer 计算机的一组程序

phrase.main: ［常用单数］总数；总和：

example.main: The sum of two and two is four. 2加2的总和是4。

phrase.main: 金额：

example.main: a large / small sum of money一大笔钱 / 少量的钱

phrase.main: ［常用单数］全部；一切：

example.main: In many ways, our lifestyle is the sum of choices we have made.从很多方面看，我们的生活方式是我们所做选择的总和。
That is the sum of our experience.那就是我们全部的经验。

phrase.main: 算术：

example.main: do a sum in one’s head 心算

phrase.main: 概括的；扼要的：

example.main: a summary account / explanation 概括性的描述/扼要的解释

phrase.main: 总结；摘要；概要：

example.main: in summary 总的来说
Can you give me a quick summary of your research?你能给我简要概括一下你的研究工作吗？

phrase.main: 夏天；夏季：

example.main: Summer Solstice is the time is when everything reaches its prime.夏至是万物达到鼎盛的时期。

phrase.main: [常与the连用] 太阳：

example.main: The sun rises / sets. 太阳升起/落下。
We talked about everything under the sun. 天南地北我们无所不谈。

phrase.main: [U] 阳光：

example.main: in the sun 在阳光下

phrase.main: 晒黑的；晒伤的(sunburned)：

example.main: sunburnt shoulders 晒伤的肩膀

phrase.main: 星期日（Sun.）
太阳镜；墨镜：

example.main: wear a pair of sunglasses 戴着墨镜

phrase.main: 阳光；日光：

example.main: in the sunlight 在阳光下
Outdoor sunlight is good for health. 户外的阳光对健康有益。

phrase.main: 阳光充足的；欢乐的
日出；黎明：

example.main: The daisy opens at sunrise and closes at sunset. 雏菊日出时开放，日落时闭合。

phrase.main: 日落时分；傍晚
阳光；晴天；欢乐：

example.main: After rain comes sunshine. 雨过天晴。/苦尽甘来。
Her smile brought a ray of sunshine into the room.她的微笑给这个房间带来了一丝欢乐。

phrase.main: 极好的；超级的：

example.main: a super day / book 极好的一天/一本书

phrase.main: 极好的；杰出的 (exellent)：

example.main: He commented that her acting was superb. 他评论说她的演技精湛。

phrase.main: 更好的；更胜一筹的：

example.main: Your computer is far superior to mine. 你的电脑比我的强多了。

phrase.main: (职位、地位等) 较高的：

example.main: my superior officer我的上级军官

phrase.main: 有优越感的；高傲的：

example.main: He always looks so superior.他看上去总是那么有优越感。

phrase.main: [C]级别（或地位、职位）更高的人；上级；上司
超级市场；超市
晚餐：

example.main: After dinner sit a while; after supper walk a mile. 午饭后坐片刻，晚饭后走一里。

phrase.main: 增补（物）；补充（物）：

example.main: vitamin / dietary supplements维生素 / 膳食补充剂

phrase.main: [C] 供应量；补给量：

example.main: There was a plentiful supply of cheap labour. 有大量的廉价劳动力。
Water is in short supply.水资源短缺。

phrase.main: [复数] 生活必需品；补给品：

example.main: school / medical / relief supplies 学校用品/医疗用品/救援物资

phrase.main: [U] 供应；供给：

example.main: supply and demand 供应与需求
cut off the electricity supply 切断电力供应

phrase.main: 供给；供应；提供：

form.main: supply sth to sb / supply sb with sth:

example.main: The media supplies lots of information to us every day. 媒体每天给我们提供很多信息。

phrase.main: 支撑；承受：

example.main: Is this bridge strong enough to support heavy lorries? 这座桥禁得住重型卡车吗?

phrase.main: 支持：

example.main: These measures are strongly supported by environmental groups. 这些措施得到环保组织的大力支持。
They supported us in the struggle for an increase in pay. 他们支持我们争取加薪。

phrase.main: 为...提供资金；供养：

example.main: The research was financially supported by the government. 这项研究得到了政府的资助。
I had to work to support my family. 我必须工作来养家。

phrase.main: 为...提供证据；证实：

example.main: Research supports the view that adolescents spend a great deal of time with their peers. 研究证实了这一观点，青少年大量的时间是与同龄人待在一起的。

phrase.main: 支撑物；支持：

example.main: These wooden supports help to hold up the building.这些木支架有助于稳固建筑。
I depend on my friends for emotional support. 我依赖朋友给我情感支持。

phrase.main: 资助；赡养：

example.main: Her job is the family’s only means of support. 她家全靠她的工作来维持生计。

phrase.main: 支持的；支撑的
认为；猜想to think that sth is probable：

example.main: I suppose (that) price will go up. 我认为价格会上涨。
— Will it rain tomorrow? 明天会下雨吗？
— I suppose so. / I suppose not. 我想会/我想不会。
I don’t suppose anyone will volunteer to answer the question, will they?我觉得没有人会自告奋勇回答问题，是不是？

form.main: When / Why / What / … do you suppose …?

example.main: When do you suppose we should leave? 你认为我们应该什么时候动身？

form.main: suppose ... to be / to do sth:

example.main: I shall suppose him to be about fifty. 我想他应该在50岁左右。
We suppose them to have finished their homework.我们想他们已经完成作业了。
She had supposed him (to be) very tall.她原以为他很高。
I had supposed his wife a younger woman. 我原以为他的妻子更年轻。

phrase.main: 假定；假设to pretend that sth will happen or is true：

example.main: Suppose (that) you have one million dollars — what would you do? 假如你有一百万美金，你会做什么？

form.main: suppose ... to be / to do sth:

example.main: Let’s suppose the old woman to be your mother. 我们假定那位老妇人是你的母亲。
Suppose the hero dead — what then？假设男主角死了，那怎么办？

phrase.main: [表示婉转提建议或勉强同意]：

example.main: Suppose we go for a swim. 咱们去游泳吧。
— You should apologize to her, Barry.你应该向她道歉，巴里。
— I suppose so, but it’s not going to be easy.我想是的，但这并不容易。

phrase.main: 假如；如果：

example.main: Supposing (that) it rains, can we play the match indoors?要是下雨的话，我们可以在室内比赛吗?

phrase.main: (地位、权力等) 最高的：

example.main: the Supreme Court 最高法院

phrase.main: [只用于名词前](程度等) 最大的；至上的：

example.main: Winning an Olympic gold medal was, I suppose, the supreme moment of my life. 我认为赢得奥运金牌是我一生中最重要的时刻。

phrase.main: [不用于名词前；无比较级变化] 肯定的；有把握的 (certain)：

example.main: I think he is coming, but I’m not quite sure. 我认为他会来，但我不太肯定。
He is very sure of success.他很有把握成功。
We're sure that your English will improve a lot!我们相信你的英语水平会大大提高。
I haven’t been sure whether I should write to him or not. 我还不确定要不要给他写信。

phrase.main: 一定会；准会：

example.main: Whenever you come, wherever you go, you’re sure to see some unforgettable events. 无论你什么时候来，无论你去哪里，你一定会见到一些难忘的事。

form.main: [用于祈使句] (be) sure (not) to do sth：

example.main: Be sure not to touch anything in the lab. 千万别碰实验室里的任何东西。

phrase.main: [主要用于口语] 肯定地；当然：

example.main: — Would you like to join us?你愿意和我们一起吗？
— Sure! 当然愿意！

phrase.main: 冲浪：

example.main: surf the Internet / Net 网上冲浪；上网

phrase.main: 表面；(物件的任何一) 面：

example.main: Two-thirds of the earth’s surface is water. 地球表面的三分之二都是水。
The box has six surfaces. 箱子有六个面。
It seems like a good idea on the surface but actually there are problems.表面上看这个主意不错，但实际上存在问题。

phrase.main: 表面的；肤浅的
外科医生
[U] 外科手术；外科学：

example.main: major heart surgery 心脏大手术
plastic surgery整形手术；整形外科
major / minor surgery大 / 小手术
perform / do / carry out the heart surgery做心脏手术
A doctor has volunteered to perform / do / carry out the heart surgery at no cost.一位医生主动提出免费做心脏手术。
The patient had / underwent surgery on his right arm last month.这个病人上个月右臂做了手术。

phrase.main: (BrE) 诊所；诊室 (AmE office)：

example.main: a dentist’s surgery牙医的诊室

phrase.main: [U](BrE) 应诊时间 (AmE office hours)：

example.main: morning / afternoon / evening surgery上午 / 下午 / 晚间应诊时间

phrase.main: 姓 (last name, family name)
过剩；剩余 (物)
过剩的；剩余的：

example.main: surplus labour / value 剩余劳动力/价值

phrase.main: 使惊奇；使震惊：

example.main: It surprised me that such a little boy of seven could play the piano so well. 一个七岁的小男孩钢琴能弹得这么好，这让我感到很惊讶。
What surprised me most was that he spoke English so well. 令我最惊奇的是，他英语说得这么好。

phrase.main: [U] & [C] 惊奇；诧异：

example.main: He expressed surprise that no one had offered to help. 谁都不肯帮忙，他感到诧异。

phrase.main: [C] 使人吃惊的事：

example.main: We have a Christmas surprise for you. 我们要给你一份意想不到的圣诞礼物。

phrase.main: 吃惊的；感到惊讶的：

example.main: a surprised look诧异的表情
The staff were surprised at the fact. 工作人员对事实感到惊讶。
A week later, I was surprised to find I got an A.一周后，我惊奇地发现自己得了个A。
He’s surprised that he got the scholarship. 他很惊讶自己获得了奖学金。

phrase.main: 令人吃惊的；惊人的；出人意料的：

example.main: We had a surprising amount in common. 我们的共同之处出奇得多。
It’s not surprising that the cheap machine broke down only a week later. 这部廉价的机器一周后就坏了，一点也不奇怪。

phrase.main: 包围；环绕；围困：

example.main: Armed police surrounded a house in the street. 武装警察包围了街上的一栋房子。
To some, happiness is being surrounded by family and friends. 对有些人来说，幸福就是一直有家人和朋友陪伴在身边。
Surround yourself with uplifting individuals who challenge you to be better.要和积极向上的人在一起，他们会激励你做得更好。

phrase.main: 与...紧密相关：

example.main: some issues surrounding alcohol abuse 有关酗酒的一些问题

phrase.main: 周围的 (nearby)：

example.main: the surrounding scenery 四周的风景

phrase.main: 周围的事物；环境everything that is near or around you (environment)：

example.main: At first my new surroundings were difficult to tolerate.一开始，新环境让我难以忍受。

phrase.main: 概述；全面评述：

example.main: a survey of modern Chinese literature现代汉语文学概论

phrase.main: 测量；勘测：

example.main: make a survey of the road 测量道路

phrase.main: 调查：

example.main: conduct / carry out / do a survey进行调查
They survey shows that more than half of the students like to read novels most.调查显示一半以上的学生最喜欢阅读小说。

phrase.main: 审视；仔细考虑to look at or examine sb / sth carefully：

example.main: Before going out, she surveyed herself in the mirror.出门前，她对着镜子打量了一下自己。

phrase.main: 测量；勘测：

example.main: survey a railway 测量铁路

phrase.main: 调查：

example.main: We surveyed the damage caused by the fire.我们调查了火灾造成的损失。
Almost half of the surveyed kids said they watched TV before bedtime.几乎一半的受访儿童说，他们在睡觉前看电视。

phrase.main: [U] 幸存；继续生存：

example.main: the survival of the fittest 适者生存
the struggle for survival 求生

phrase.main: [C] 幸存物；残存物：

example.main: The ceremony is a survival from ancient times.这种仪式是从古代遗留下来的。

phrase.main: vt比...活得长：

example.main: She survived her husband by ten years. 她丈夫去世后，她又活了10年。

phrase.main: vt & vi幸存 (于)：

example.main: Her parents died in the accident, but she survived. 她的父母在那次事故中丧生了，但是她活了下来。
He survived the earthquake. 他在地震中幸免于难。

phrase.main: vi & vt挺过；熬过：

example.main: Rowling had spent years surviving on little money, spending all her time writing.罗琳前些年靠微薄的收入生活，把所有的时间都花在了写作上。

phrase.main: vi保存下来：

example.main: Some old customs have survived into the present. 有些古老的风俗一直保留到现在。
Several buildings in the town survived from medieval times. 镇上有几座建筑物从中世纪留存至今。

phrase.main: 幸存者；生还者；残存物
vt & vi猜想；怀疑to believe that sth may happen or be true：

example.main: The doctors suspected cancer.医生怀疑是癌症。
She strongly suspected he was lying to her. 她非常怀疑他在对她撒谎。
She’s not going to be very happy about this, I suspect. 我想她对此事是不会太高兴的。

phrase.main: vt怀疑 (某人有罪)to think that sb is probably guilty of a crime：

example.main: They suspect him of a theft. 他们觉得他有偷窃嫌疑。
The policeman suspected him of killing the girl. 警察怀疑他杀了那个女孩。

phrase.main: 嫌疑犯；可疑分子：

example.main: question a suspect 审问嫌疑人

phrase.main: 不可信的；可疑的：

example.main: a suspect package 可疑包裹

phrase.main: 悬挂；暂停；中止：

example.main: The referee interrupted the match, and there was a suspension of play. 裁判中止了比赛，比赛暂停。
a suspension bridge悬索桥；斜拉桥；吊桥

phrase.main: 怀疑的；可疑的
[正式用语]支撑；承受住 (bear)：

example.main: The ice will not sustain your weight.这冰承受不了你的体重。

phrase.main: 维持（生命、生存）：

example.main: The love and support of my family sustained me through the hard times.家人的关爱和支持帮助我度过了那段困难时期。

phrase.main: 使保持；使持续to make sth continue for a long period of time (maintain)：

example.main: sustain economic growth / development / interest维持经济增长 / 持续发展 / 保持兴趣
Group exercise is one of the most effective ways to improve physical fitness and sustain a healthy lifestyle.团体运动是提高身体素质和保持健康生活方式的最有效方法之一。

phrase.main: [正式用语]遭受；经受 (suffer)：

example.main: sustain damage / an injury / a defeat / a loss遭受损坏 / 受伤 / 遭受失败 / 遭受损失

phrase.main: 可持续的；不破坏环境的：

example.main: Today, sustainable development is a popular trend in many countries. 如今，可持续发展在很多国家是一种流行趋势。

phrase.main: vt & vi吞下；咽下：

example.main: He put a grape into his mouth and swallowed it whole. 他把一粒葡萄放进嘴里，整个吞了下去。

phrase.main: vt 抑制：

example.main: I swallowed my pride and asked someone at the stop for help.我放下自尊，向在车站的一个人求助。

phrase.main: 燕子：

example.main: One swallow doesn’t make a summer.一燕不成夏。

phrase.main: vt & vi(进行) 交换；交流：

example.main: Online they swap information about their super heroes with each other. 他们在网上相互交流各自心中超级英雄的信息。

phrase.main: vi诅咒；咒骂：

example.main: swear at sb 咒骂某人

phrase.main: vi & vt宣誓；发誓：

example.main: She swore (that) she’d never seen him before.她发誓说以前从未见过他。

phrase.main: 汗；辛苦的工作
出汗：

example.main: He is sweating all over. 他浑身冒汗。

phrase.main: 厚运动衫；毛衣
瑞典
瑞典的；瑞典人的；瑞典语的
瑞典人；瑞典语
扫；打扫；扫除：

example.main: sweep the floor / the dust清地 / 扫去灰尘
Tomb Sweeping Day清明节

phrase.main: 横扫；掠过；(暴风雨等) 袭击；席卷：

example.main: A rare snowstorm swept across the region yesterday.昨天一场罕见的暴风雪袭击了该地区。
The cooling wind swept through our bedroom windows.凉爽的风从我们卧室的窗户吹进来。
"Red envelope" fever has swept the country.“抢红包”热已席卷全国。

phrase.main: （香）甜的；甜美的；新鲜的；好心的：

example.main: sweet bread / coffee 甜面包/加糖的咖啡
a sweet smile 甜美的笑容
sweet air / colours 新鲜空气/悦目的颜色
He was so sweet and kind to do this.他这么做真是善良、好心。

phrase.main: 糖果；甜食
vi膨胀；肿胀：

example.main: Wood often swells when wet. 木材潮湿后往往膨胀。
After the fall, her ankle began to swell (up).摔倒之后，她的脚踝开始肿起来。

phrase.main: vt & vi(使) 逐渐增加；(使) 上涨：

example.main: Small extra costs all swell the total. 零星的额外费用积少成多，使总数增大了。

phrase.main: 快的；迅速的；敏捷的：

example.main: be swift to take measures 立刻采取措施
Success was not swift and Rowling might have given up. 成功并非一蹴而就，罗琳可能也曾放弃过。

phrase.main: 游泳：

example.main: Don’t teach fish to swim. 不要班门弄斧。

phrase.main: 晃动；旋转：

example.main: I had been working on math for the whole afternoon and the numbers swam before my eyes. 整个下午我都在学习数学，眼前全是数字在晃动。

phrase.main: 浸；泡；充满：

example.main: A tear swam in the eye of Qusaimodo, but did not fall.一颗泪珠在卡西莫多的眼里打转，但没掉下来。

phrase.main: 游泳：

example.main: go for a swim 游泳

phrase.main: 游泳：

example.main: go swimming 去游泳
a swimming pool 游泳池

phrase.main: （使）摆动；（使）摇摆：

example.main: It’s bad manners to swing your legs while eating.吃饭时晃腿是不礼貌的。

phrase.main: （使）转动；（使）突然转向：

example.main: At that moment, the door swung open, and Roy walked in.正在这时，门开了，罗伊走了进来。
He swung around to her, spilling his tea without noticing it.他突然转过身来对着他，茶水洒了出来他都没有注意到。

phrase.main: （挥动某物）朝…打去：

example.main: Shay swung at the ball but missed.谢伊挥拍击球，但没打中。

phrase.main: 摇摆；晃动；秋千
瑞士的
瑞士人
开关；电闸；(AmE) （铁路的）道岔；转辙器：

example.main: turn on / off the light switch 打开/关掉灯的开关

phrase.main: 骤变；突变
改变；转变to change from one thing to another：

example.main: He switched the conversation from one subject to another.他转变了话题。
We’d take the train into the city center, then switch to the tram.我们乘火车到市中心，接着改乘电车。

phrase.main: 交换；调换to exchange one thing with another：

example.main: We asked them if they would switch places with us.我们问他们是否愿意和我们调换一下位置。

phrase.main: 瑞士 (欧洲中部国家)
肿胀的
刀；剑；(the sword) 武力：

example.main: draw a sword 拔剑；开战

phrase.main: 音节
象征；标志：

example.main: Red is a symbol of good luck in many cultures.在许多文化中，红色是好运的象征。
Mother Teresa came to be a living symbol of selfless devotion to the sick and poor.特蕾莎修女成为了对病人和穷人无私奉献的活生生的象征。

phrase.main: 符号：

example.main: a chemical symbol 化学符号
Emojis are small symbols representing ideas, emotions or feelings.表情符号是表示想法、情感或感受的小图标。

phrase.main: 同情的；表示同情的：

example.main: a sympathetic look / smile 同情的表情/笑容
feel sympathetic towards sb 对某人感到同情

phrase.main: [不用于名词前]赞同的；支持的
同情 (心)：

example.main: They felt great sympathy for the victims. 他们十分同情遇难者。
It is in bad times that we value most highly the support and sympathy of our friends. 艰难时刻我们最看重朋友们的支持与同情。

phrase.main: 赞同；支持
交响乐；交响曲：

example.main: a symphony orchestra 交响乐团/队
Like a musical symphony, life has high and low moments.人生就像一首交响乐，有高潮也有低谷。

phrase.main: 症状；征兆：

example.main: Tell me your symptoms and I will try to tell you what disease you have. 告诉我你的症状，我会设法判断你得了什么病。

phrase.main: 综合病征；综合症状
[C] 系统：

example.main: the solar system太阳系
the computer / operating system计算机 / 操作系统
the nervous system神经系统

phrase.main: [C] 体系；体制；制度a set of ideas or rules for organizing sth：

example.main: the political / legal / education system政治法律教育制度
What similarities or differences do you know about American and Chinese school systems? 你知道美国和中国的学校制度有什么异同吗？

phrase.main: 有系统的；有计划有步骤的：

example.main: His success was almost entirely due to his systematic hard work.他的成功几乎完全归功于有条不紊的努力工作。

phrase.main: (= Tyrannosaurus Rex) 霸王龙
T恤衫；短袖汗衫
桌子；餐桌：

example.main: lay / set the table 摆放餐具

phrase.main: 表格：

example.main: the multiplication tables 乘法口诀表
a table of contents 目录表

phrase.main: 药片 (pill)
平板电脑;便签本 (pad)
vt处理 / 解决（难题或局面）to try to deal with a difficult problem or situation：

example.main: tackle the problem / matter / pollution解决问题 / 处理事情 / 治理污染
To tackle the crisis of food shortage, Yuan Longping chose to study agriculture.为了应对粮食短缺危机，袁隆平选择学习农业。

phrase.main: vt与…商谈 / 交涉to speak to sb about a difficult problem or situation：

example.main: My teacher tackled me about my carelessness in the exam.老师就我考试粗心一事与我进行了谈话。

phrase.main: vt & vi（足球等）抢球；抢断；（橄榄球）擒抱摔倒
蝌蚪
尾巴；末尾部分：

example.main: the tail of Halley’s Comet 哈雷彗星的彗尾

phrase.main: (尤指男装的) 裁缝：

example.main: at the tailor’s 在裁缝店

phrase.main: 专门制作；定做：

example.main: courses tailored to the learners' needs.根据学习者需求设计的课程

phrase.main: 拿；取；接：

example.main: take a coke from the fridge从冰箱里拿一瓶可乐
I passed him the book, and he took it. 我把书递给他，他接了过去。

phrase.main: 拿走；取走：

example.main: Did the thief take anything of value? 小偷偷走什么值钱的东西了吗？

phrase.main: 携带；引领；使达到：

example.main: It’s too far to walk — I will take you there by car. 步行去那儿太远了，我会开车送你去。
Her energy and talent took her to the top of her profession. 她的活力和才华使她达到了事业的顶峰。
If your riches are yours, why don’t you take them with you to the other world? 如果财富是你的，那么你为什么不把它们带到另一个世界呢？

form.main: take sb sth / take sth to sb:

example.main: Shall I take my host family a gift? / Shall I take a gift to my host family?我要不要给我寄宿的家庭带件礼物呢？

phrase.main: 夺取；攻占；控制：

example.main: Enemy forces have taken the airport. 敌军已经占领了机场。

phrase.main: 选择；购买；租用：

example.main: — How about the pink T-shirt? 那件粉色的T恤衫怎么样？
— Yes, that’s nice. I’ll take it. 啊，不错，我要把它买下来。
He took the house for a year. 这房子他租了一年。

phrase.main: 采取：

example.main: take measures / action采取措施/行动

phrase.main: 接收；接受；容纳：

example.main: take sb’s advice 接受某人的建议
This school doesn’t take boys. 这所学校不收男生。
This new bus takes sixty passengers. 这辆新公共汽车可容纳60名乘客。

phrase.main: 遭受；承受；忍受：

example.main: Small businesses took a beating in the financial crisis. 小企业在这场金融危机中遭受了打击。
I found his attitude a little hard to take. 我发觉他的态度有点让人难以忍受。

phrase.main: 吃；喝；服 (药)：

example.main: take coffee / medicine 喝咖啡/吃药

phrase.main: 搭乘 (交通工具)：

example.main: take a train 坐火车

phrase.main: 记录；量 (体温等)；拍摄：

example.main: take notes / a photo 记笔记/照相
take one’s temperature 量体温

phrase.main: [后接名词形成动宾短语，表示做一次动作，其意义相当于相应的动词]：

example.main: take a bath / shower / walk / rest 洗澡/淋浴/散步/休息
take an interest in collecting stamps 对集邮感兴趣
He took a look at himself in the glass. 他看了看镜子里的自己。

phrase.main: 花费；占用：

example.main: Organizing a successful birthday party takes a lot of energy. 举办一次成功的生日聚会要花费很多精力。
The desk doesn’t take much room.这书桌不太占地方。

form.main: it takes (sb) sth to do sth:

example.main: It took me over 21 years to get my college degree! 我花了21年多才拿到大学文凭。
It takes hard work to make dreams into reality. 实现梦想需要付出艰苦的努力。

phrase.main: 参加；学习：

example.main: He is going to take an oral test. 他要参加一场口语考试。
Are you taking French next year? 你明年学习法语吗？

phrase.main: 理解；认为；把...看作；

example.main: I was joking, but he took me seriously. 我在开玩笑，他却当真了。
take sb’s patience as a sign of weakness把某人的耐心当作软弱的表现
Even the experts took the painting for a genuine Picasso. 连行家都认为这幅画是毕加索的真迹。
I take him to be sincere. 我认为他是真诚的。

phrase.main: 故事；传说；（未必真实的）叙述：

example.main: folk / romantic / ancient tales民间故事/爱情故事/古老的传说
tell the tales of one’s experience 讲述自己的经历
Tales of the supernatural are common in all parts of Britain.英国各地都有超自然现象的传说。

phrase.main: 天资；才能a natural ability to do sth well(gift)：

example.main: a talent show / competition 才艺大赛
He has a natural talent for music. 他天生就有音乐天赋。
Benjamin West showed his talent for art when he was only six years of age.本杰明•韦斯特在年仅六岁时就表现出了艺术天赋。

phrase.main: 人才；有才能的人：

example.main: There’s a wealth of talent in English football.英格兰足球界人才济济。

phrase.main: vi谈话；讲话；说话：

form.main: talk (to / with sb) (of / about sb / sth):

example.main: Follow your own course, and let people talk.走自己的路，让别人去说吧。
At the meeting he talked of the importance of learning computer skills. 他在会上谈到了学习计算机技能的重要性。
First, talk to someone you trust about how you feel.首先，和你信任的某个人谈你的感受。

phrase.main: vt谈论；讨论：

example.main: We talked music all night.我们整夜谈论音乐。

phrase.main: 谈话；商谈；演讲：

example.main: I had a long talk with my teacher about my study.我和老师就我的学习进行了一次长谈。
big talk 大话；牛皮
small talk闲聊；闲谈
give a talk about / on forest 作关于森林的报告

phrase.main: [复数] (正式) 会谈；会议：

example.main: summit talks 峰会

phrase.main: 讲话；谈话：

example.main: Talking mends no holes. 空谈无益。

phrase.main: 身材高的；(建筑物、树等) 高的：

example.main: He is six feet tall and weighs 200 pounds. 他身高6英尺，体重200磅。

phrase.main: (盛液体或气体的) 大容器；箱；槽：

example.main: a water tank 水箱

phrase.main: 坦克
坦桑尼亚 (东非国家)
塞子；龙头：

example.main: turn on / off the tap 开/关龙头

phrase.main: 轻打；轻拍：

example.main: She felt a tap on her shoulder. 她感到有人在她肩上拍了一下。

phrase.main: vt & vi 轻拍；轻打：

example.main: tap sb on the shoulder 轻拍某人的肩膀
Someone is tapping at the door. 有人在轻轻叩门。
I tap my feet and sing along with him. 我用脚踩着节拍跟他唱起来。

phrase.main: vt & vi 开发；发掘；vt 委任
线带；胶带；录音带；录像带：

example.main: play a tape 放录音/录像带
a tape recorder 磁带录音机
The papers were in a pile, tied together with a tape.文件叠成一摞，用带子捆着。

phrase.main: 终点线；卷尺
vt粘贴：

example.main: A car key dropped from an envelope taped behind the book.车钥匙从贴在书后的信封里掉了出来。

phrase.main: vi & vt录音；录像(video)：

example.main: Would you mind if I taped this conversation? 你介意我把这次谈话录下来吗？

phrase.main: 靶子；目标 (goal)；对象：

example.main: His shot hit / missed the target.他的子弹射中了靶子/脱靶了。
set a target 设定目标
The target audience for the TV series are young people aged 13 to 18. 这部电视连续剧的目标受众是13岁至18岁的年轻人。
Many extremely lonely people in the community are easy targets of cheating.社区中许多极度孤独的人很容易成为欺骗的目标。

phrase.main: 工作；任务a piece of work that has to be done, especially an unpleasant or difficult one：

example.main: a simple / hard / challenging task 简单的/艰巨的/具有挑战性的任务
set / undertake a task布置 / 承担任务

phrase.main: [C] & [U] 味道；味觉；品尝：

example.main: The water from the well has a pleasant taste.这口井的水味道甘甜。
His taste is sensitive.他的味觉很敏锐。
My mother is preparing my favorite dishes. Go with me and have a taste, okay?我妈妈正在准备我最喜爱的饭菜，跟我一起去尝尝，好吗？

phrase.main: [C] & [U] 爱好；品位：

example.main: Popular music is not to everyone’s taste.并非每个人都喜欢流行音乐。
While she was in Paris, she developed / acquired a taste for art.她在巴黎的时候喜欢上了美术。
She has good taste in dressing, I would say.我想说，她在穿着方面很有品位。

phrase.main: [C] [常用单数] 感受；体验：

example.main: It gave my kids the sweet taste of helping others.这让我的孩子体验到帮助别人的美好感受。
You will get a taste of success one day.总有一天你会尝到成功的滋味。

phrase.main: vt尝；品尝；[不用于进行时] 尝出...的味道：

example.main: He tasted the soup to see if he had put enough salt in it.他尝了尝汤，看是否加够了盐。
I can taste chocolate in this bread.我能吃出这面包有巧克力味。

phrase.main: [用作系动词] 尝起来；有...的味道：

example.main: The food tasted better than it looked.这种食物的味道比看上去要好。
What does pumpkin taste like?南瓜是什么味道？

phrase.main: vt 尝到；体验：

example.main: He deserves not the sweet that will not taste the sour.不愿吃苦，不配享福。
There was a lot of hard work before we tasted success / victory.经历了千辛万苦，我们终于尝到了成功 / 胜利的滋味。

phrase.main: 无味道的：

example.main: tasteless food淡而无味的食物

phrase.main: 不雅的；俗气的：

example.main: a set of tasteless furniture一套俗气的家具
