since then自那时以来

phrase.main: 理论上的；假设的
[C] & [U] 学说：

example.main: Einstein's theory of relativity爱因斯坦的相对论
Scientists have many theories about how the universe came into being.科学家们有很多关于宇宙是如何形成的理论。

phrase.main: [U] 理论；原理：

example.main: combine theory with practice把理论和实践相结合

phrase.main: [C] 推测：

example.main: I have this theory that most people prefer being at work to being at home.依我看，大多数人喜欢工作而不愿意呆在家里。

phrase.main: [表示安慰等] 瞧；你看；好啦：

example.main: There, there, don’t cry.好啦，好啦，别哭了。

phrase.main: 在那里；到那里；往那里：

example.main: We went on to Paris and stayed there eleven days.我们接着去了巴黎，在那里待了11天。

phrase.main: [与动词be连用表示存在]：

example.main: There was nothing I could do to make her happy, it seemed.我似乎没有办法让她开心。
There are two reasons for choosing this park.选择这个公园有两个理由。
In some areas, there may be as much as 430 inches of rain annually.一些地区的年降雨量可多达430英寸。

phrase.main: [与appear, live, remain, seem等表示存在、状态等意义的词连用，there本身没有地点概念]：

example.main: At the bottom of the ice shelf there lives a small fish.在冰架底部生活着一种小鱼。
There remains a chance that Fred might still turn up alive.弗雷德仍有可能活着回来。
In a thick forest on Mount Fajiu there lived a bird named Jing Wei.在发鸠山上茂密的丛林里住着一只名叫精卫的鸟。

phrase.main: [用以引起注意、加强语气等]：

example.main: There he comes now.瞧，他来了。
There goes the phone.电话铃响了。

phrase.main: 在那一点上：

example.main: There I disagree with you.在那点上我不同意你的看法。

phrase.main: [正式用语] [置于句首、句中] 因此；所以(thus)：

example.main: I think, therefore I am.我思故我在。
A fish is a cold-blooded animal and therefore is very sensitive to water temperature.鱼是冷血动物，因此对水温非常敏感。

phrase.main: [C] 热水瓶；保温瓶
这些；以下这些：

example.main: We can’t read these signs at night.我们在夜间不能辨认出这些标识。
What I want to say is about these two topics: the protection of the environment and the importance of action.我将就以下两个话题进行发言：环境保护和行动的重要性。

phrase.main: 这些：

example.main: We’ll discuss these in detail below.我们将在下面详细讨论这些。

phrase.main: [主格] 他们；她们；它们
人们：

example.main: They say he is a great painter.人们说他是个伟大的画家。

phrase.main: [用于指one, whoever, anybody, nobody或everybody等]他；她：

example.main: Nobody ever admits that they are to blame.没有人承认自己应负有责任。
Stay here and you’ll be able to see everybody as they come in.待在这儿，这样无论谁进来你都能看见。

phrase.main: 厚的；粗的：

example.main: thick paper / a thick book / a thick coat厚纸 / 厚书 / 厚外套
The snow is two feet thick.雪有两英尺厚。
a thick line粗线

phrase.main: 浓密的；茂密的；密集的：

example.main: a thick fog / forest浓雾 / 茂密的森林
The hall is thick with students.大厅里挤满了学生。
Tea leaves collected around White Dew carry a much thicker and longer-lasting fragrance.白露前后采集的茶叶香味更甘醇持久。

phrase.main: 浓重的( strong)：

example.main: a thick Russian accent浓重的俄罗斯口音

phrase.main: [C] (pl thieves) 窃贼；小偷
薄的；细的【反 thick】；瘦的【反 fat】：

example.main: a thin blouse薄薄的女衬衫
a thin stick / line细棍/线
thin arms / fingers纤细的胳膊/手指

phrase.main: 淡的；稀薄的；稀疏的：

example.main: a thin audience in the hall礼堂中寥寥无几的观众
thin blue淡蓝
thin air稀薄的空气

phrase.main: 物；东西：

example.main: I couldn’t see a thing in the thick fog.在浓雾中我什么也看不见。

phrase.main: 事情；事物；事件(matter)：

example.main: do the right / wrong thing做正确的/错误的事情

phrase.main: [常用复数] 情况；形势：

example.main: How are things (with you)?（你）近来怎么样？

phrase.main: [常用复数] (个人的) 所有物；用品；财产：

example.main: Take your things and go.带上你的东西走吧。

phrase.main: vt & vi 想；思考：

example.main: Mary may not say, but she thinks a lot.玛丽可能不说什么，但她想得很多。
If you don’t learn to think when you are young, you may never learn.如果你年轻时没有学会思考，那就永远学不会思考。
Think twice before you do.三思而后行。
I thought to myself, “If he can do it, then so can I.” 我心想，“如果他能做，那我也能。”

phrase.main: [不用于进行时]vt & vi 认为；以为：

example.main: Until 1954 it was thought that no man could run one mile in less than four minutes.1954年以前，人们认为没人能在4分钟内跑完1英里。
The fats in fish are thought to help prevent heart disease.鱼油被认为有助于预防心脏病。
I don’t think so. / I think not.我认为并非如此。

phrase.main: vt & vi 料想；猜想；想象：

example.main: I can’t think how she could figure out all the problems in an hour.我想不出她是如何在一个小时之内算出所有题的。
The plan may prove better than you think.这个计划可能比你预想的要好。

phrase.main: vt 记忆；想起：

example.main: He was trying to think where he’d seen her before.他在努力回想以前在哪儿见过她。

phrase.main: [U] 思想；思考；见解：

example.main: different ways of thinking不同的思考方式
creative / independent thinking创造性 / 独立性思维
What’s your thinking on this question?你对此事有何见解？

phrase.main: 渴；口渴：

example.main: satisfy one’s thirst解渴

phrase.main: 渴望；热望：

example.main: My thirst for knowledge was greater than my pains of hunger.我对知识的渴望胜过饥饿的煎熬。

phrase.main: 渴的：

example.main: Salty food makes you thirsty.吃咸的食物会使你口渴。
thirsty work使人口渴的活

phrase.main: 缺水的；干旱的：

example.main: thirsty fields干旱的田地

phrase.main: 渴求的；渴望的 (hungry)：

example.main: Printing answered a need because people were thirsty for knowledge.人们渴求知识，印刷术满足了这一需求。

phrase.main: 这；这个：

example.main: This is my computer.这是我的电脑。

phrase.main: [指代前文所述事实等或后文所述内容] 此事；以下内容：

example.main: You’d better remember this: Smile to everyone.你最好记住这一点：对每个人微笑。

phrase.main: 这个；以下的：

example.main: Get out of this room.离开这个房间。
They wanted to show us this point: She is innocent.他们想告诉我们以下观点：她是无辜的。
this evening / year今晚/今年

phrase.main: [口语] 这么；这样：

example.main: You need to cut about this much off the end of the pipe.你需要把管头切下大约这么多。

phrase.main: 彻底的；完全的；详尽的：

example.main: Why not give the room a thorough cleaning？为什么不彻底打扫一下房间呢？
I had a physical problem and had to go to hospital for a thorough examination.我身体不适，不得不去医院做个全面检查。

phrase.main: [通常不用于名词前]（人）仔细的；缜密的：

example.main: As a scientist, she is not brilliant, but she is thorough.作为一位科学家，她并非才华横溢，但一丝不苟。

phrase.main: 那些；那些人；那些物：

example.main: Those are my books.那些是我的书。
Those who know it are not as those who love it; those who love it are not as those who find their joy in it.知之者不如好之者，好之者不如乐之者。

phrase.main: 那些：

example.main: Those two problems are hard.那两道题很难解。

phrase.main: 虽然 (although)：

example.main: Though I need money for myself, I’m still willing to help. 虽然我自己也需要钱，但我还是乐意帮忙。

phrase.main: [相当于even if] 即使：

example.main: Though I fail, I shall try again. 即使失败，我也要再试一次。

phrase.main: [用于主句后，引接补充说明]可是；不过；然而：

example.main: He’ll probably say no, though it’s worth asking. 他很可能会拒绝，不过问一下也没什么坏处。

phrase.main: [常置于句末] 可是；然而：

example.main: Our team lost. It was a good game, though. 我们队输了，可是也不失为一场很好的比赛。

phrase.main: [U]思考；思想活动(act, power or process of) thinking：

example.main: A good teacher encourages independence of thought. 优秀的老师鼓励独立思考。
Their bad behavior left me deep in thought.他们的不良行为让我深思。
She sat by the window, lost in thought. 她坐在窗前，陷入沉思。

phrase.main: [C] 想法；主意 an idea or opinion (idea)；[常用 复数] 心思 sb’s mind and all the ideas that are in it：

example.main: Several thoughts crossed my mind as I watched him work. 我看着他工作时，有了一些想法。
— Why don’t you ask Jane for help? 你为什么不找简帮忙呢？
— That’s a thought! I’ll phone her right away.好主意！我这就给她打电话。
Her thoughts have turned to travel.她的心思都转到旅行上了。

phrase.main: [U]考虑；思索careful and serious consideration (consideration)：

example.main: I’ve been giving your proposal a lot of thought / giving a lot of thought to (= thinking carefully about) your proposal.我一直在认真地考虑你的提议。

phrase.main: [C] & [U]关心；顾念a feeling of care or worry：

example.main: In good times we always spare a thought for the bad times. 我们要居安思危。
He rushed back into the burning building with no thought for his own safety. 他冲回燃烧着的大楼，根本不顾及自己的安危。

phrase.main: [U] & [C]意图；打算：

example.main: He had no thought of hurting her feelings. 他无意伤害她的感情。

phrase.main: [U]思想；思潮：

example.main: Life is measured by thought and action, not by time. 衡量生命的尺度是思想和行为，而不是时间。

phrase.main: 关切的；体贴的；深思的
一千：

example.main: One may overcome a thousand men in battle, but he who conquers himself is the greatest victor. 一个人也许能在战场上制胜千军，可战胜自己才是最伟大的胜利者。

phrase.main: [C] & [U]线；线状物
[C] [用单数] 思路；头绪；贯穿的主线：

example.main: a thread running through the film 贯穿这部电影的一条主线

phrase.main: [C] & [U]威胁；恐吓：

example.main: the threat of violence暴力威胁
make threats against sb对某人进行威胁

phrase.main: [C] [常用单数] 构成威胁的人 / 事物：

example.main: Pollution poses a threat to the continued existence of this species.污染对这一物种的继续生存造成威胁。
Drunken drivers pose a serious threat to other road users.酒后驾车对其他路人构成严重威胁。

phrase.main: [U] & [C] [常用单数]（坏事发生的）可能性：

example.main: There was a threat of typhoon. 有刮台风的征兆。
The Great Barrier Reef is now under threat from / of pollution and climate change.大堡礁正在遭受污染和气候变化的威胁。

phrase.main: vt威胁；恐吓；危及到：

example.main: Traffic issues not only affect our everyday life, but may also threaten people's lives.交通问题不仅影响我们的日常生活，而且可能危及到人的生命。
David threatened to report his neighbor to the police if the damages were not paid.大卫威胁他的邻居说，如果他们不赔偿损失他就报警。

phrase.main: vt & vi预示 (...的) 凶兆：

example.main: The dark clouds threatened rain. 乌云密布预示大雨将至。

phrase.main: 激动；兴奋；令人激动 / 兴奋的事：

example.main: My boys beat the best team, giving me one of the greatest thrills of my life.我的孩子们打败了最好的队，这是我一生中最让我激动的一件事。

phrase.main: (使) 极为激动 / 兴奋：

example.main: The extremely tense atmosphere both terrified and thrilled him.极度紧张的气氛让他既害怕又兴奋。

derivative.main: adj[不用于名词前]thrilled

phrase.main: 惊险小说 / 电影；恐怖小说 / 电影
喉咙；咽喉；喉头
[指空间] 穿过；通过：

example.main: They drove through a snowstorm. 他们驱车穿过暴风雪。
Light comes in through the window. 光线透过窗户射进来。
I couldn’t hear their conversation through the wall.我隔着墙听不到他们的谈话。

phrase.main: [指时间] 从头到尾：

example.main: The children were too young to sit through a concert.这些孩子太小，音乐会没结束就坐不住了。

phrase.main: 遍及；在...中间：

example.main: tour through France 周游法国
a walk through the flowers 在花丛中散步

phrase.main: (做) 完...；(耗) 尽...：

example.main: A box of tissues will be needed to get through this moving book!要读完这本感人的书需要一盒纸巾！

phrase.main: [指方法、手段等] 经由；以：

example.main: From then on, we’ve kept in touch with each other through e-mails. 从那时起，我们通过电子邮件保持联系。

phrase.main: 从一端到另一端：

example.main: It’s a bit crowded in here — can you get through?这里有些挤，你过得去吗?

phrase.main: 从头到尾；完全地：

example.main: Don’t tell me how it ends — I haven’t read it all the way through.先别告诉我故事的结局，我还没看完呢。

phrase.main: 直达；通往：

example.main: This train goes straight through to New York. 这趟火车直达纽约。

phrase.main: 接通：

example.main: Please hold the line and I’ll put you through. 请别挂断电话，我给您转接过去。

phrase.main: [用于形容词后]完全；彻底：

example.main: His shoes and clothing were wet through.他的鞋和衣服都湿透了。

phrase.main: 遍及；整个...期间：

example.main: throughout the country / world 遍及全国/全世界
throughout history / one’s life 纵观历史/毕生

phrase.main: 到处；始终：

example.main: The house is painted green throughout. 这座房子完全被刷成了绿色。
The ceremony lasted two hours and we had to stand throughout. 仪式进行了两个小时，我们自始至终都得站着。

phrase.main: vt & vi抛；扔：

example.main: Throw me the ball. / Throw the ball to me. 把球抛给我。
I was thrown by a horse. 我被马甩了下来。

phrase.main: vt猛推；使劲撞：

example.main: She drew the curtains and threw open the windows.她拉开窗帘，一把推开窗户。

phrase.main: vt猛动 / 急伸（四肢等）

example.main: When my uncle arrived, I threw my arms around him to give him a hug.我叔叔达到时，我一下抱住他，给了他一个拥抱。
I threw myself onto the bed and fell asleep soon.我一头倒在床上，很快就睡着了。

phrase.main: 拇指
雷；雷声；似雷的声音：

example.main: thunder and lightning 雷电
the thunder of applause 雷鸣般的掌声

phrase.main: 打雷；发出雷鸣般的声响；轰隆隆地快速移动：

example.main: It thundered a few times, but no rain fell. 打了几声雷，但没下雨。
The train thundered through the small station. 火车轰隆隆地驶过那个小站。

phrase.main: 雷雨；雷暴
星期四（Thur.或Thurs.）
如此；这样in this way; like this：

example.main: Neither pour out all you know nor remark all you see thus to keep a quiet life. 知道的不要全部倾吐，看到的不要都评论，这样生活才可以平静。

phrase.main: [句子副词]因而；从而 (therefore)：

example.main: We failed to find enough evidence; thus we concluded that he was innocent. 我们未能找到足够的证据，因此，我们认定他是无罪的。

phrase.main: (核对用的) 记号；[常用单数] 滴答声
vt给...标记号：

example.main: Your job is to tick the names of those present at the meeting. 你的工作是在出席会议的人员名字前作记号。

phrase.main: vi (钟表等) 嘀嗒嘀嗒响：
票；入场券；罚单：

example.main: a single / return ticket单程/往返票
a ticket machine自动售票机
I'd like two tickets for the movie on Friday, please.请给我来两张周五的电影票。
a parking ticket 违章停车罚单

phrase.main: [C] & [U] [与定冠词the连用]潮 (汐)；潮水
[C] [常用单数]潮流；趋势：

example.main: It takes courage to speak out against the tide of opinion.跟舆论唱反调需要勇气。

phrase.main: 整齐的：

example.main: her tidy handwriting 她的工整笔迹
A neat person likes to keep things tidy. 爱整洁的人喜欢把东西摆放整齐。

phrase.main: vt & vi收拾；整理：

example.main: I must tidy myself up.我得梳理一下。

phrase.main: 领带；带
[常用复数] 联系：

example.main: The law firm has close ties with an American corporation.这家律师事务所与一家美国公司关系密切。

phrase.main: [常用复数] 平局(BrE draw)：

example.main: Each team scored twice and the game ended in a tie.每个队都得分两次，比赛最终打成了平局。

phrase.main: (用带、绳、线等) 系；拴；扎：

example.main: Tie your bike to a tree so as to prevent it from being stolen.把自行车拴在树上以防被偷。
How well children spell is tied to how well they can write.儿童拼写能力与写字能力紧密相关。

phrase.main: 虎；老虎
紧的；绷紧的 ：

example.main: The drawer is so tight that I can’t open it. 抽屉太紧，我打不开。
She is wearing a tight pair of jeans. 她穿着一条紧身牛仔裤。

phrase.main: (时间、空间) 紧凑的；(经济) 紧张的：

example.main: I can’t see you next week because the schedule is very tight. 我下周日程排得满满的，所以不能见你。
There was a tight group of people around the speaker.演讲者周围严严实实地围了一群人。
Money was always tight, but we had a roof over our heads, food on the table, clothes on our backs. 虽然总是缺钱，但我们有房住，有饭吃，有衣穿。

phrase.main: （关系）紧密的：

example.main: a tight community关系紧密的社区

phrase.main: 严格的：

example.main: The airport security is very tight. 机场的安保工作很严格。

phrase.main: 紧紧地；充分地：

example.main: Shut the door tight. 把门关紧。
Sleep tight!睡个好觉！

phrase.main: 紧地；牢牢地
直到...为止：

example.main: We've had very good weather this winter, till now.今年冬天，直到现在天气都很好。

phrase.main: [用于否定句]在...以前；直到... (才)：

example.main: I didn’t know about the news till just now.直到刚才我才知道那个消息。

phrase.main: [用于肯定句] 直到...为止：

example.main: You must keep on fighting till the final victory belongs to you. 你们必须坚持战斗直到最后的胜利。

phrase.main: [用于否定句] 直到... (才)：

example.main: You will never know what you can do till you try. 直到你去尝试你才知道自己能做什么。

phrase.main: [U] 时间；[常用单数] 一段时间：

example.main: a long / short time 长/短时间
To choose time is to save time. 合理安排时间就是节约时间。

phrase.main: [U]时刻；(特定之) 时：

example.main: It’s time for us to start. 我们该动身了。
What time is it ? / What is the time?现在几点了？
at this time of (the) year 每年的这个时间

phrase.main: [C] [常用复数](历史) 时代：

example.main: in modern ancient times在现 / 古代

phrase.main: [C]时光；岁月：

example.main: good / bad / hard times美好的时光 / 倒霉的日子 / 艰难的岁月

phrase.main: [C] 次；回：

example.main: Next time you’re here, let’s have lunch together. 下次你来这儿，咱们一起吃午饭。
Last time I met her, she said she was going to get married.我上次见到她，她说她要结婚了。

phrase.main: [C] 倍：

example.main: His salary is four times higher than mine.他的薪水比我的高四倍。
There were three times as many girls as boys in class. 班上女孩的数量是男孩的三倍。

phrase.main: 安排...的时间；为...计时：

example.main: I saw from the station clock that I had timed my arrival perfectly. 从车站的大钟上，我看到自己到达的时间算得分秒不差。

phrase.main: 时间表；课程表(AmE schedule)：

example.main: a railway / train timetable火车时刻表

phrase.main: [U] (化学) 锡
[C](食物等的) 罐头；听
极小的；微小的：

example.main: This is the tiniest car I’ve seen.这是我见过的最小的汽车。

phrase.main: 梢；末端：

Language, in its broad sense, is a way information is transmitted. 从广义上说，语言是一种传递信息的方法。
The ceremony was transmitted live by satellite to over fifty countries. 典礼通过卫星向五十多个国家实况转播。

phrase.main: 传播；传染：

example.main: This infection is transmitted to humans by mosquitoes. 这种传染病是由蚊子传染给人类的。

phrase.main: 透明的
显而易见的 (obvious)；易懂的：

example.main: a transparent lie 明显的谎言

phrase.main: 移植手术
移植；移栽：

example.main: He transplanted the little tree to the garden when it was the best time for it.趁着时机正合适，他把小树苗移到了花园里。

phrase.main: 运输；输送；搬运：

example.main: At present, lots of food and medicine are being transported from all over China to the earthquakestricken areas. 目前，大量的食品和药品正从中国各地运往地震灾区。

phrase.main: 使进入特定境地：

example.main: Humor transports your mind away from your daily troubles.幽默能使你从日常烦恼中解脱出来。

phrase.main: 运输；搬运：

example.main: The company will arrange transport of goods from the airport. 公司将会安排从机场运输货物。

phrase.main: 交通运输系统；交通工具：

example.main: air / road transport 空运/陆运
Which kind of public transport do you prefer to use: bus or train?你更喜欢使用哪种公共交通工具：公共汽车还是火车？

phrase.main: 运输；客运；货运；运输工具 (BrE transport)
(捕鸟兽的) 陷阱；夹子；罗网：

example.main: set / lay / place a trap for mice 设夹子捉老鼠

phrase.main: (陷害人的) 圈套；诡计：

example.main: fall into / get out of a trap 落入/摆脱圈套

phrase.main: 牢笼；困境：

example.main: the unemployment trap 失业困境
Some people feel that marriage is a trap. 有些人认为婚姻是牢笼。

phrase.main: 设陷阱捕捉；夹住；卡住：

example.main: It’s cruel to trap birds. 捕鸟是残忍的。
I trapped my coat in the car door. 我的外衣被车门夹住了。

phrase.main: 把...困住；使陷入困境：

example.main: Having been trapped in traffic, he was late for work.因为交通堵塞，他上班迟到了。

phrase.main: 留存；储存 (气体 / 水等)：

example.main: Because of the greenhouse effect the Earth is warmed by gases trapped in the atmosphere. 由于温室效应，储存在大气层中的气体使地球变暖。

phrase.main: 垃圾；废物 (BrE rubbish)
vi & vt（长途）旅行；出行to go from one place to another, especially over a long distance：

example.main: travel (around) the world环游世界
travel to work by subway乘地铁上班
Last year, more than 100 million people traveled abroad.去年，有一亿多人出国旅行。
Students in mountain areas often travel hundreds of miles to go to school.山区的学生常常赶数百英里的路去上学。

phrase.main: 行进；被传播：

example.main: The train is travelling at 300 kph.火车正在以每小时300千米的速度行驶。
Light typically travels in a straight line.光通常沿直线传播。
The good news traveled quickly. 喜讯不胫而走。

phrase.main: [U] 旅行；游历the activity of travelling：

example.main: air / space travel 航空/太空旅行
a travel agency旅行社

phrase.main: [C] [常用复数] 旅游journeys to places that are far away, usually for pleasure：

example.main: We met some very interesting people on our travels in Thailand.我们在泰国旅游时碰到一些非常有趣的人。

phrase.main: 旅行者；旅客
旅行：

example.main: go travelling 去旅行

phrase.main: 旅行 (用) 的；巡回的：

example.main: a travelling exhibition巡回展览

phrase.main: 旅行者；旅客
旅行：

example.main: go travelling去旅行

phrase.main: 旅行 (用) 的；巡回的：

example.main: a travelling exhibition巡回展览

phrase.main: 珍视；珍藏：

example.main: The boy treasured the teacher’s good opinion above all else.那个男孩最重视教师的金玉良言。

phrase.main: [U] 金银财宝：

example.main: buried treasure埋在地下的财宝

phrase.main: [C] [常用单数] 珍贵物品；珍宝：

example.main: This photograph from our wedding is my greatest treasure. 我们婚礼上的这张照片是我最珍贵的物品。
The Chinese classical garden is a precious treasure of our ancient Chinese architecture.中国园林是我国古代建筑艺术的珍宝。

phrase.main: 招待；款待；乐事：

example.main: He took his son to the cinema, as a birthday treat.他带儿子去看了场电影，作为生日的款待。
When we were kids, a trip to the park was a real treat.我们小时候，去公园玩真是件乐事。

phrase.main: 对待；看待：

example.main: Treat other people as you hope they will treat you.你希望别人如何对待你，你就如何对待别人。
The disabled should be treated with respect / kindness / consideration.残疾人应受到尊重 / 受到善待 / 被体谅。
I really can’t understand you treating her like that. 我真不明白你为何那样对她。
Your parents treat you as an adult, while mine treat me as a child.你的父母把你当作一个成年人来对待，而我的父母把我当个孩子。

phrase.main: 招待；款待；请 (客)：

example.main: Don’t worry about the cost; I’ll treat you. 别担心费用，我请客。
My father wanted to treat me to a vacation like never before.我爸爸想让我过一个和过去完全不同的假期。

phrase.main: 医治；治疗：

example.main: Some doctors are treating her for her illness.一些医生在为她治病。
The condition is usually treated with drugs and a strict diet.这种病情通常用药物和通过严格控制饮食进行治疗。

phrase.main: (化学) 处理：

example.main: Beijing is able to treat 90 percent of waste water. 北京有能力处理90%的废水。

phrase.main: [U] 对待；处理：

example.main: fair / special treatment公平对待/特殊处理

phrase.main: [C] & [U] 治疗；疗法：

example.main: under medical treatment 正在接受治疗
First aid is a very important first step in the treatment of burns. 在治疗烧伤的过程中，急救处理是非常重要的第一步。

phrase.main: 树；树形图：

example.main: a family tree家谱

phrase.main: 颤抖；哆嗦to shake especially because you are nervous, frightened, or excited：

example.main: tremble with cold / fear 冻/吓得发抖

phrase.main: (轻微地) 摇晃；摇动：

example.main: The leaves trembled in the wind.树叶在风中摇曳。

phrase.main: 颤抖；发抖：

example.main: a tremble of excitement / fear 激动/恐惧得发抖

phrase.main: 巨大的；极快的；强有力的
趋向；趋势：

example.main: the general trend of history 历史的总趋势
There has been a recent trend in the food service industry toward lower fat content and less salt.在食品服务行业，近来存在着低脂少盐的趋势。

phrase.main: 潮流：

example.main: follow the latest world trend追随最新的世界潮流

phrase.main: 试用；试验：

example.main: a (free) trial period试用期
New cars have several severe trials before they are put on the market.新车在投放市场前要经过多次严格的试验。

phrase.main: 审判；审讯：

example.main: In a trial, a judge must decide which eyewitnesses to believe and which not to believe.在审判过程中，法官必须判断哪些证人可以相信，哪些证人不能相信。

phrase.main: 三角；三角形
部落；部族
诡计；花招；恶作剧：

example.main: Her tears were just a trick to deceive others.她的眼泪只是骗人的诡计。
If the neighbours do not give any sweets, the children might play a trick on them.如果邻居们不给糖果，孩子们就可以捉弄他们。

phrase.main: 戏法；把戏：

example.main: perform magic tricks表演魔术

phrase.main: [常用单数]技巧；诀窍：a way of doing sth that works well; a good method：

example.main: Patience is the trick of doing this job well.耐心是做好这份工作的诀窍。

phrase.main: 欺骗；哄骗：

example.main: I’d been tricked and I felt stupid. 我被骗了，觉得自己真傻。
An advertiser might be trying to trick customers into buying a product or a service.广告商可能试图哄骗顾客购买产品或服务。

phrase.main: [非正式用语]棘手的；难对付的：

example.main: a tricky question / task棘手的问题/艰难的任务

phrase.main: 三轮车
三部曲
特立尼达岛
旅行；出行：a short round journey instead of one-way, usually for a particular purpose:

example.main: go on / take / make a trip去旅行
a business trip to Japan 去日本出差

phrase.main: 无轨电车
[常用复数] 军队；士兵：
一群：

example.main: a troop of guests 一群客人

phrase.main: 来自热带的；(天气) 湿热的
[U] & [C] 问题；烦恼；困难problems or difficulties：

example.main: The trouble with you is that you don’t listen. 你的问题是听不进别人的话。
She poured out all her troubles to me (= told me all about her problems) on the phone.她在电话里向我倾诉了她所有的烦恼。
Tom was having much trouble getting up in the morning and was always late for work.那时汤姆早上起床很困难，总是上班迟到。

phrase.main: [U] 疾病；故障illness or pain; sth wrong with a machine, vehicle, etc.：

example.main: engine trouble 发动机故障
She has trouble with her heart. 她心脏有问题。

phrase.main: [U] 困境；险境a situation with a lot of problems：

example.main: The company ran into trouble when a major order was cancelled. 有一个大订单被取消，这家公司陷入了困境。

phrase.main: [U] 麻烦；费事extra effort or work：

example.main: Repairing the radio is more trouble than it's worth (= takes too much time and effort).这台收音机修理起来很麻烦，不值得修。
I can call back later — it’s no trouble.我可以过一会儿回电话，这不费事。

phrase.main: 使担忧；使烦恼；使疼痛：

example.main: It troubles me that I haven’t heard from her recently.最近一直没有收到她的信，这使我很担心。
What is it that is troubling you?是什么让你烦恼？
My back’s been troubling me.我的背一直在疼。

phrase.main: [正式用语]麻烦；打扰 (bother)：

example.main: I don’t want to trouble the doctor with such a little cold. 我不想为这种小感冒去麻烦医生。
Sorry to trouble you, but could you tell me the time?对不起打扰您一下，请问几点了？

phrase.main: 麻烦的；棘手的；讨厌的causing problems, in an annoying way：

example.main: a troublesome boy / task让人头疼的男孩/工作

phrase.main: 长裤 (AmE pants)：

example.main: a pair of trousers 一条裤子

phrase.main: 卡车；货运汽车：

example.main: a pick-up truck轻型货车 / 皮卡货车

phrase.main: 真的；合乎事实的：

example.main: I do not know whether what I’ve been told is true or false.我不知道自己听到的是真还是假。
The results appear to hold true (= still be correct) for other countries.这些结果似乎也适用于其他国家。
The food in this restaurant is good and the same is true of the service.这家餐馆的饭菜好，服务也好。

phrase.main: [只用于名词前]实际的；真实的 (real)：

example.main: True happiness comes from spiritual riches.真正的幸福来自于精神的富有。
A smile may show love or politeness. It can also hide true feelings.微笑可以表示爱或礼貌，也能用来掩饰真实的感受。

phrase.main: [只用于名词前]真正的：

example.main: true love / a true friend真爱/真正的朋友

phrase.main: [口语]确实的：

example.main: It is true ( that ) you can’t judge a book by its cover.确实不能以貌取人。

phrase.main: 真诚地：

example.main: I’m truly sorry that things had to end like this. 事情落到这样的结局，我真的很抱歉。

phrase.main: 确实；真实地：

example.main: That painting is truly beautiful! 那幅画真是漂亮！
In theatres and teahouses you can experience a truly Chinese way of life.在剧院和茶馆，你可以感受到真正的中国生活方式。

phrase.main: 小号；喇叭
树干；躯干；皮箱；象鼻
信任；信赖：

example.main: If you put your trust in me, I’ll not let you down. 如果你信赖我，我不会让你失望。

phrase.main: 信任；相信：

example.main: According to Anne, a true friend is a person whom you can trust. 安妮认为，真正的朋友是一个你可以信任的人。

phrase.main: [与the连用，用作单数] 真相；事实 :

example.main: I told the truth but he thought I was lying.我说了实话，但他认为我在撒谎。
The truth is that no one is perfect.事实是没有人是完美的。

phrase.main: [U] 真实性：

example.main: doubt the truth of the evidence 怀疑证据的真实性
Finally, I must remind you that you have to answer for the truth of what you have said. 最后，我必须提醒你，你必须对自己所讲的话的真实性负责。

phrase.main: [C] 真理：

example.main: stand for the truth 坚持真理
Truth is the daughter of time.时间可以证明一切。

phrase.main: vi & vt 尝试；试图；努力

example.main: Try your strength / luck. 试试你的力气/碰碰你的运气吧。
Try as she might (= Although she might try as hard as she could), Sue couldn’t get the door open.苏想尽办法，但是仍开不开门。
Try not to become a man of success but rather try to become a man of value.不要为成功而努力，而要为做一个有价值的人而努力。
Bob tried hard to learn cooking, but the meals he prepared were terrible.鲍勃非常努力地学习烹饪，但他做的饭菜很难吃。
She never gave up but tried her best to overcome the difficulty in life.她从未放弃过，而是努力克服生活中的困难。

phrase.main: vt 试做；试用；试验：

example.main: If I’m going out for a meal, I prefer to try something different. 如果到外面吃饭，我喜欢尝试不同的饭菜。
John isn’t here. Try phoning his home number.约翰不在这里，试试打他家里的电话。

phrase.main: vt考验；磨炼：

example.main: try sb’s courage 考验某人的胆量

phrase.main: 尝试；试验；试图 (attempt)：

example.main: With another try, they may gain what they dream of.再试一次，他们也许能获得他们梦寐以求的东西。

phrase.main: 海啸
管；试管；电子管；显像管：

example.main: a test tube 试管

phrase.main: 地铁 (AmE subway)：

example.main: the tube (BrE)地下铁道；地铁
go by tube / take the tube乘地铁

phrase.main: 星期二（Tue.或Tues.）
[C] 调子；曲调；旋律：

example.main: When I’m playing a sad tune, I am crying in my heart.我演奏哀伤的乐曲时，自己内心也在哭泣。

phrase.main: [U] 和谐
为 (乐器) 调音；调 (收音机，电视频道)
隧道；地道：

example.main: a railway / railroad tunnel 铁路隧道
the Channel Tunnel 英吉利海峡隧道

phrase.main: 突厥人；土耳其人
[C] 火鸡；[U] 火肉鸡：

example.main: roast turkey烤火鸡肉

phrase.main: [C] (AmE) [非正式用语]（电影或戏剧的）失败之作
土耳其
土耳其的；土耳其人的；土耳其语的
vt & vi转动；旋转：

example.main: turn the tap / switch / key 拧龙头/开关/钥匙
The wheels of the car began to turn. 汽车的轮子开始转动起来。

phrase.main: vt & vi 扭转 (身体部位)；转 (身)：

example.main: She turned her head in surprise. 她惊讶地转过头来。
The children all turned to look at the famous actress as she entered the classroom.当那个女明星走进教室时，所有孩子都转过去看她。

phrase.main: vt & vi 翻转；翻 (书页)：

example.main: Could you turn your chairs to face this way? 你们把椅子转过来朝这边好吗？
Turn ( over ) the page and look through the material.翻过这一页，然后浏览这段材料。
turn to page 5翻到第五页

phrase.main: vt & vi (使) 转弯；(使) 转向：

example.main: She waved to me as she turned the corner. 她拐弯时向我挥了挥手。
I turned the car into the parking lot. 我转弯把车开进了停车场。
The road turns to the left after the church. 这条路过了教堂后向左转弯。

phrase.main: vt & vi (使) 转移：

example.main: She looked at her husband then turned her attention to the children. 她看了看丈夫，然后把注意力转到孩子们身上。

phrase.main: vt & vi (使) 变成；(使) 变为：

example.main: We turn not older with years, but newer every day.我们并非在年复一年地变老，而是日复一日地焕然一新。
The shock turned her hair white. 那次打击使她的头发变白了。
He turned economist at the age of 40. 他在40岁时成了经济学家。

phrase.main: [系动词] [不用于进行时]到达；超过 (某一时间或年龄)：

example.main: She turns 18 in June.她到6月就满18岁了。
It’s turned midnight. 已经过了午夜了。

phrase.main: 转动：

example.main: Give the handle a few turns. 转动几下把手。

phrase.main: 翻动；翻身：

example.main: With a few turns, she slept again.她翻了几次身又睡着了。

phrase.main: (车辆的) 转弯； (道路的) 弯道：

example.main: take a turn to the right / left 向右/左转弯

phrase.main: (异乎寻常或意外的) 转变；变化：

example.main: a horrible turn of events可怕的事态变化
give a new turn to the argument 把辩论引到一个新的方面
Two days after the operation, Dad took a turn for the better / worse(= suddenly got better / worse).手术两天后，爸爸的病情好转/恶化了。

phrase.main: (依次轮到的) 机会：

example.main: It’s finally our turn to do the wallboard in the school hall!终于轮到我们负责学校礼堂的墙报了！

phrase.main: 转弯处；岔路口 (AmE turn)：

example.main: stop at the next turning 在前面的拐弯处停下来
a turning point in history 历史转折点

phrase.main: 旋转
海龟；龟；甲鱼
家庭教师； (大学中的) 导师； (辅导学生备考的) 辅导教师
[television的缩写] 电视；电视机
两次；两倍：

example.main: twice a year 一年两次
He is nearly twice as heavy as you. 他几乎是你的两倍重。

phrase.main: 孪生儿之一；双胞胎之一：

example.main: Twins often look just alike. 双胞胎往往长得很像。

phrase.main: 孪生的；双胞胎的：

example.main: a twin sister孪生姐姐/妹妹

phrase.main: vt & vi (使) 弯曲；(使) 扭曲：

example.main: Twist the wire to form a circle. 把金属丝弯成一个环。
His face twisted with pain. 他痛苦得脸都变形了。

phrase.main: vt & vi 转动 (身体等)：

example.main: The visitor twisted his neck to look at the photograph on the wall behind him. 参观者扭过头看他身后墙上的照片。
He twisted the cap off the bottle. 他旋开了瓶盖。

phrase.main: vt 扭伤：

example.main: Having twisted her ankle, our tour guide had to be taken to the hospital. 我们的导游扭伤了脚踝，不得不被送到医院。

phrase.main: vi 盘绕；盘旋；蜿蜒：

example.main: The river twists and turns through the green fields.河流蜿蜒穿过绿色的田野。

phrase.main: vt 歪曲；曲解：

example.main: The papers twisted everything I said. 报纸把我说的一切都歪曲了。

phrase.main: 转弯；弯曲；转折：

example.main: a road full of twists and turns 弯弯曲曲的路
a twist of fate 命运的转变

phrase.main: 类型 (sort)：

example.main: There are two main types of advertisements— commercial advertisements and public service advertisements.主要有两种类型的广告：商业广告和公益广告。
Men of his type are not to be trusted. 像他这样的人不可信赖。

phrase.main: 典型；模范；具有代表性的人：

example.main: I don’t think she’s the sporty type. 我认为她不是那种喜欢运动的人。

phrase.main: 用打字机 / 计算机打：

example.main: He typed in the name of the word game and hit Search.他输入了文字游戏的名称，点击“搜索”。

phrase.main: 打字机
台风
典型的；有代表性的：

example.main: The painting, named Poppy, is a typical example of Chen’s style. 这幅名为“罂粟”的画是陈(逸飞)艺术风格的代表作。
This sort of hot and spicy food is typical of the food in the south of the country.这种辣味的食物在这个国家的南方非常具有代表性。
Some typical themes of Chinese New Year paintings are folk tales and gods.中国年画的一些典型主题是民间传说和神灵。

phrase.main: 一贯的；平常的 (normal)：

phrase.main: 乌干达
难看的；丑陋的:

phrase.main: 令人不快的；可怕的：

phrase.main: (同类中) 最出色的；最大的；最糟糕的：

phrase.main: 难以忍受的；不能容忍的：

phrase.main: 极其惊人的；难以置信的 (amazing / incredible)：

example.main: She eats an unbelievable amount of food. 她的饭量大得惊人。

example.main: The date of his arrival is still uncertain. 他到达的日期还不确定。

form.main: (be) uncertain + wh- to do sth / wh-从句:

It is uncertain what his role in the company will be.他将在公司担任什么职务尚未确定。
We feel uncertain about the future. 我们对未来没有把握。

phrase.main: 易变的；捉摸不定的likely to change：

example.main: The uncertain weather delayed our journey. 天气变化不定，延误了我们的行程。

(对年长者的称呼) 大伯；大叔
(人) 不舒服的；不安的；不自在的：

example.main: Having taken a drink, I felt rather uncomfortable and got a headache. 喝了一杯酒后，我感觉非常不舒服，而且还头疼。
I feel uncomfortable with strangers.我和陌生人在一起时会感到不自在。

phrase.main: (物) 令人不舒服的：

example.main: an uncomfortable chair令人不舒服的椅子

phrase.main: 不舒服地；不自在地
无条件的；无限制的：

example.main: unconditional love 无条件的爱

phrase.main: 失去知觉的；不省人事的：

example.main: She was unconscious for two days after the accident.事故发生之后，她昏迷了两天。

phrase.main: 未意识到的；未察觉的：

example.main: He is unconscious of his mistake. 他没有意识到自己的错误。

phrase.main: 无意识的；不知不觉的：

example.main: We see examples of unconscious body language very often.我们经常看到无意识的身势语的例子。

phrase.main: 不受控制的；不加克制的
揭开；使露出：

example.main: uncover the lid of a kettle 揭开水壶盖子

phrase.main: 发现；揭露；揭发：

example.main: The book talks about the importance of looking beneath the surface of things to uncover their real meanings.这本书谈到了透过事物的表面来揭示其真正含义的重要性。
uncover their tricks 揭露他们的阴谋诡计

phrase.main: [表示位置]在...下面

example.main: Don’t stand under a tree during a thunderstorm.雷雨时不要站在树下。
He got out from under the bed. 他从床底下钻出来了。

phrase.main: [表示数量、年龄等]低于；少于；在...以下：

example.main: Nearly l8 million children under the age of five around the world are estimated to be overweight.估计全世界有近1800万5岁以下的儿童超重。

under control / pressure在掌控之下/在压力下

It is still under discussion (= being discussed) whether the old bus station should be replaced with a modern hotel or not. 是否应拆掉旧车站建一个现代化的宾馆还在讨论中。

phrase.main: [表示名义、假托等]用；凭借：

example.main: Mary Ann Evans wrote under the name of George Eliot. 玛丽·安·埃文斯用乔治·艾略特作笔名进行创作。

phrase.main: 在下方；在水下：

phrase.main: 处于劣势的人 / 队；弱方
经历；经受；忍受：

example.main: Our astronauts undergo a long period of testing and training.我们的宇航员要经历长时间的考验和训练。
The health security systems of many countries are undergoing considerable transformation.许多国家的卫生安全系统正在经历重大变革。

phrase.main: 在...下方：

phrase.main: vi & vt懂；理解；了解：

example.main: Just tell your parents how you feel — I’m sure they’ll understand. 只管把你的感受告诉父母——我敢肯定他们会理解的。

You don’t need to understand how computers work to be able to use them.你不一定非要懂计算机运作原理才会使用电脑。

phrase.main: [U][常与不定冠词连用]了解；理解：

I am sure we will both gain / get a better understanding of our traditional culture in this activity.在这次活动中，我肯定我们俩都会更好地了解我们的传统文化。

phrase.main: [C] [常用单数](非正式的) 协定：

example.main: come to / arrive at / reach an understanding (=stop arguing and agree) with sb和某人达成共识

phrase.main: 承担；从事to decide to do sth and start doing it：

example.main: undertake responsibility 承担责任

phrase.main: 接受；同意to agree or promise to do sth：

example.main: He undertook to finish the job by Friday. 他同意星期五之前完成这项工作。

phrase.main: 在水下的；在水中生长的
在水下；在水中
[总称] 内衣；衬衣

example.main: undo a button / zip / parcel解开纽扣 / 拉开拉链 / 打开包裹

phrase.main: 恢复原状；取消：

phrase.main: 毋庸置疑地；肯定地：

example.main: Undoubtedly, technology is an important development, and it will have an even bigger impact on our lives.毫无疑问，科技的发展非常重要，它甚至会对我们的生活产生更大的影响。

phrase.main: 不自在的；忧虑的 (anxious)：

example.main: feel uneasy with strangers 与陌生人在一起不自在
feel uneasy about the future 担心未来

phrase.main: 失业的 (out of work)：

example.main: The unemployed hunger for jobs.失业者渴望得到工作。

phrase.main: 失业(状态)；失业人数；失业率：

example.main: unemployment problems 失业问题

phrase.main: 未料到的：

a place unfit for camping 不适合露营的地方
He is drunk and unfit to drive. 他喝醉了，不适合开车。

phrase.main: 难忘的：

example.main: an unforgettable experience / moment / memory难忘的经历/时刻/回忆

phrase.main: 不幸的 (unlucky) 【反：fortunate / lucky】；令人遗憾的：

example.main: an unfortunate accident不幸的事故

phrase.main: 不幸地 (unluckily) 【反：fortunately / luckily】；遗憾地：

example.main: Unfortunately, instead of hitting the ball, he hit his own false teeth! 不幸的是，他没打到球，反而打到了自己的假牙!

phrase.main: 不幸福的；不愉快的；不满意的：

example.main: He was unhappy at / about being left out of the school team.他因未能入选校队而闷闷不乐。
He was late for class again, so the teacher was unhappy with him.他上课又迟到了，因此老师对他不满意。

phrase.main: 不健康的；身心不健全的；不良的
制服：

example.main: in uniform 穿着制服
Pupils at about 90 percent of British secondary schools wear school uniforms.大约90%的英国中学学生穿校服。

phrase.main: [C] 协会；联合会；工会：

phrase.main: [C] 联盟；(联合) 组织；联邦：

example.main: the European Union欧盟

phrase.main: [U] 联合；合并；团结：

example.main: The union of the different lines makes traveling on the London Underground much more convenient. 伦敦不同地铁线路的贯通使人们乘地铁出行更加方便。
Union gives strength. 团结就是力量。

phrase.main: 独特的；独一无二的：

example.main: Everyone’s fingerprints are unique. 每个人的指纹都是独一无二的。
The Panda is unique to China熊猫是中国独有的动物。
Moore wants to use her unique talent to help others find their smiles.摩尔想用她独特的才能帮助别人找到微笑。

phrase.main: (构成) 单位：

(设备等的) 一套；一组

example.main: We should unite with all the forces that can be united. 我们应该团结一切可以团结的力量。
Emperor Qinshihuang united the seven major states into one unified country.秦始皇将七个诸侯国统一为一个国家。

phrase.main: 联合的；团结的；合并的：

He told me that I’d probably have a heart attack unless I started eating less.他告诉我，如果我再不减少食量就有可能患心脏病。

phrase.main: 不像；不同于：

example.main: It’s unlike him to be late; he is usually on time.迟到可不像他的风格，他通常很准时的。
Unlike fast-food places, fine dining shops prefer customers to stay longer and spend.不同于快餐店，精致的餐馆更喜欢顾客在店里久留并消费。

phrase.main: 不太可能的【反：likely】；[只用于名词前] 非想象中的：

example.main: It’s unlikely that she’ll arrive before seven. 她不大可能在七点前到达。

phrase.main: 不必要的；多余的：

It's nothing serious, and it's unnecessary to bother the doctor.不严重，没必要看医生。

phrase.main: 未付款的；不收报酬的
令人不愉快的；讨厌的：

example.main: an unpleasant experience 不愉快的经历

phrase.main: (社会的)动荡； (心里的)不安：

example.main: social unrest 社会动荡

phrase.main: 未说出口的；非口语的
直到...为止：

If you don't understand something, you may research, study, and talk to other people until you figure it out.如果你不明白某事，你可以研究、学习，和其他人交谈直到你弄明白为止。

phrase.main: [用于否定句] 在...以前；直到...才：

Not until the film had begun did she arrive. 直到电影开始她才到。

phrase.main: 直到...为止：

The result of the game was unknown until the last minute. 直到最后一刻人们才知道比赛的结果。
When she fell ill her daughter looked after her until she was better. 她生病的时候，女儿一直照顾她，直到好转。

phrase.main: [用于否定句] 在...以前；直到...才：

example.main: Not until the film had begun did she arrive. 直到电影开始她才到。
Not until recently did they encourage the development of tourist-related activities in the rural areas.直到最近他们才鼓励在农村开展与旅游相关的活动。

phrase.main: 不寻常的；独特的：

It is not unusual (= It happens often) for new business owners to work seventy or eighty hours a week.新成立的公司的老板一周工作70或80个小时很常见。
It is not unusual to (= It happens often) see cured meat hung in the airy cold places such as doorway or balcony for drying.把腊肉挂在门口、阳台等通风凉爽的地方晾晒是很常见的事。

phrase.main: 不愿意的；勉强的：

example.main: If your child is unwilling to discuss something, don’t insist he tell you what’s on his mind. 如果你的孩子不愿说，就别强求他告诉你他的想法。

phrase.main: 向上；向高处；在高处：

example.main: go up to the top of the mountain 登上山顶
Look at the picture up on the wall. 看墙上挂着的那幅画。

phrase.main: 起立；起身：

example.main: stand up from one's seat从座位上站起来
If you are up, just come down to the kitchen.如果你起来了，就下楼到厨房来。

phrase.main: 接近：

example.main: He moved up to the end of the line. 他挪到了队尾。

example.main: The fever is usually up in the night.夜间发烧症状通常会加重。

phrase.main: 结束：

phrase.main: 发生；出现；(作为话题) 提出来：

example.main: What’s up? 怎么了？
I could tell something was up by the looks on their faces.从他们的脸上的表情就能看出一定是出事了。

phrase.main: [与某些动词连用，强调完成] 完全地；彻底地：

example.main: eat up all the dishes 吃光所有的菜

phrase.main: 到；朝：

phrase.main: 向 / 在...上面：

example.main: go up a hill登山

phrase.main: 顺着；沿着：

example.main: walk up the road 沿着公路走

phrase.main: [只用于名词前] 向上的；往上移动的：

example.main: an up line(铁路的)上行线

phrase.main: [不用于名词前] 兴奋的；激动的：

example.main: be up and cheerful 兴高采烈
His blood is up. 他怒火中烧。

phrase.main: 最新 (式) 的；现代的：

up-to-date equipment现代化设备

phrase.main: 更新；使现代化：

example.main: We must update our packaging in order to attract more young customers. 为了吸引更多的年轻消费者，我们必须更新产品的包装。
It’s important for the figures to be updated regularly.定期更新数据很重要。

phrase.main: 最新信息；最新情况；(程序的) 更新
使升级；提升：

example.main: You’ll need to upgrade your hard drive to 320GB before running this software. 运行这个软件之前，你需要把硬盘升级到320GB。
On the flight back, we were upgraded to business class.返航时，我们被升级到商务舱。

phrase.main: 在...上面：

example.main: He sat upon the grass. 他坐在草地上。

phrase.main: 对于；关于：

example.main: I’d like to comment upon your opinion.我想就你的观点谈谈我的看法。

phrase.main: ...之后 (立即)：

example.main: In hot summer, people turn on the air-conditioner upon returning home.在炎热的夏季，人们一回到家就开空调。
Upon arrival at the classroom, we began to study immediately.到了教室之后，我们就立刻开始学习。

phrase.main: 上方 / 部的 【反：lower】；上层 /流的：

example.main: His room is on the upper floor. 他的房间在上层。
the upper class上流社会

phrase.main: 弄翻；打翻：

example.main: upset a bowl of soup 打翻一碗汤
The life boat was upset by the waves.救生船被大浪打翻了。

phrase.main: 打乱；搅乱 (计划、安排等)：

example.main: He arrived an hour late and upset our plan. 他迟到了一个小时，打乱了我们的计划。
upset the natural balance of the environment破坏环境的自然平衡

phrase.main: 使生气；使心烦意乱to make sb worry or feel unhappy：

example.main: This decision is likely to upset a lot of people. 这项决定很可能会使许多人不快。

phrase.main: 使 (肠胃) 不适
(肠胃) 不适的：

example.main: an upset stomach肠胃不适

phrase.main: [不用于名词前] 心烦意乱的；难过的worried and unhappy：

example.main: Then the friend moved away and the writer was extremely upset. 后来这个朋友搬走了，作者感到特别难过。
She was very upset to hear that the holiday had been cancelled. 听说假期取消了，她感到非常失望。
Anne’s sister Margot was very upset that the family had to move.安妮的妹妹玛戈因为她们不得不搬家而感到很烦恼。

form.main: (be) upset about / at / by / over sth:

example.main: My parents were in a huge argument, and I was really upset about it. 我的父母在激烈地争吵，为此我感到非常心烦。
You’re not still upset with me, are you?你不再生我的气了，对吧？

phrase.main: 在楼上；往楼上：

example.main: I ran upstairs and found her in the bedroom, crying. 我跑到了楼上，发现她正在卧室里哭泣。

phrase.main: [只用于名词前]楼上的：

example.main: an upstairs room 楼上的房间

phrase.main: 向上 (的)；上升 (的)：

example.main: I climbed upward until I reached the top of the mountain.我向上一直爬到了山顶。

phrase.main: 向上 (的)；上升(的)：

example.main: I climbed upwards until I reached the top of the mountain. 我向上一直爬到山顶。

phrase.main: 城市的；都市的：

example.main: urban life / development / areas / environment城市生活/发展/地区/环境
Sixty-seven percent of urban residents use the Internet.67%的城市居民使用互联网。

phrase.main: [正式用语]驱策；驱赶：

phrase.main: 出名的 (famous)；众所周知的：

example.main: a well-known writer 著名的作家
It is well-known that paper was first made in China.众所周知，纸最早是在中国制造出来的。
The province is well-known for coal. 这个省以煤炭而著称。
Stephen Hawking is well-known as a physicist.史蒂芬•霍金是一位著名的物理学家。

phrase.main: 西；[常与the连用] 西部：

example.main: the West西方国家(尤指西欧和北美)；美国西部
He lives to the west of the town.他住在这个城镇以西的地方。

phrase.main: 向西的；西部的；(风) 由西面吹来的：

example.main: the west door of the church教堂西门
a west wind西风

phrase.main: 向西：

example.main: He sat facing west, watching the sun go down.他面朝西坐着，看着太阳落山。

phrase.main: [只用于名词前] 西部的；来自西部的：

example.main: Western Development Strategy of China中国西部大开发战略

phrase.main: [常作Western] 西方（国家）的：

example.main: Western culture / nation西方国家的文化/民族

phrase.main: 向西(的)：

example.main: in a westward direction 方向朝西
The plane took off westward.飞机向西起飞。

phrase.main: 向西 (的)：

example.main: in a westward direction 方向朝西
The plane took off westward.飞机向西起飞。

phrase.main: (潮) 湿的【反：dry】；下雨的：

example.main: Take an umbrella or you'll get wet.带把伞，否则你会被淋湿的。
Generally speaking, I do not like wet weather.总的来说，我不喜欢下雨天。
We were wet through (= completely wet).我们全身都湿透了。

phrase.main: 鲸
(pl wharves) 码头
[疑问代词] 什么；什么样的人 / 事物：

example.main: What are you having for dinner?你打算吃什么？
What happened to him?他发生了什么事情？
What do you think of my painting?你觉得我的画如何?

phrase.main: [连接代词，引导名词性从句] ...的人 / 事物：

example.main: What surprised us most there was the beauty of the scenes. 最让我们惊讶的是那里的美景。
Pick yourself up. Courage is doing what you’re afraid to do.振作起来，勇气就是做你害怕去做的事。
China is not what she used to be.现在的中国与过去不同了。
Wisdom is to the mind what health is to the body.智慧之于头脑，犹如健康之于身体。

phrase.main: [表示疑问] 什么样的；怎样的：

example.main: What lessons can we learn from this?我们从中可以吸取什么教训呢？

phrase.main: [表示感叹] 多么的；何等的

example.main: What a great place to stay in!多么好的一个居住地啊！

phrase.main: [疑问代词] 究竟是什么：

example.main: Whatever do you mean?你究竟是什么意思？
Whatever in the world is going on here?这儿究竟发生了什么？

phrase.main: [连接代词，引导名词性从句] 任何的事 / 物：

example.main: Your support is important to our work. Whatever you can do helps.你的支持对我们的工作很重要，你做的一切对我们都有帮助。
Do whatever you want.你想做什么就去做吧。

phrase.main: [连接代词，相当于no matter what，引导让步状语从句] 无论什么：

example.main: Whatever you do, if you want to become great at it, you need to work day in and day out.不管你做什么，如果想做好，你就需要日复一日地钻研。
The building must be saved, whatever the cost. 无论代价有多大，这座建筑必须要保留。

phrase.main: 任何；无论什么；不管什么：

example.main: She would tell him whatever news she got. 她得到任何消息都会告诉他。
Whatever dictionary you have, lend it to me. 不管你有什么字典，借给我。

phrase.main: [非正式用语] 不管发生什么：

example.main: We told him we’d back him whatever. 我们告诉他，不管发生什么事我们都会支持他。

phrase.main: 小麦
车轮；方向盘：

example.main: We hope to ensure that older drivers stay safe behind / at the wheel (driving a car).我们希望确保老年司机行驶中的安全。

phrase.main: 轮椅
[疑问副词] 什么时候：

example.main: When did you come here?你什么时候到这儿来的?

phrase.main: [连接副词，引导名词性从句] 什么时候：

example.main: When the delayed flight will take off depends much on the weather. 延误的航班何时起飞主要取决于天气状况。
I’d like to know when they’ll come back.我想知道他们什么时候回来。

phrase.main: [关系副词，引导定语从句] 在那时：

example.main: This was the moment when I made my decision.这是我作出决定的时刻。
The last time I went to Scotland was in May, when the weather was beautiful. 我上次去苏格兰是在五月份，那时的天气好极了。

phrase.main: 当...时：

example.main: When going for a work, take along a small garbage bag.去散步时，随身带个小垃圾袋。
When in Rome do as the Romans do. 入乡随俗。

phrase.main: 一 / 刚...就...；那时：

example.main: We'll start when the team captain comes.队长一来我们就出发。
We were about to go for a picnic when it began to rain.我们正要去野餐，突然下起雨来。
Jack was working in the lab when the power cut occurred. 停电时，杰克正在实验室里工作。

phrase.main: [引导条件状语从句，相当于if] 如果：

example.main: Turn off the switch when anything goes wrong with the machine. 如果机器发生故障，就关上开关。

phrase.main: 既然；考虑到：

example.main: Why use metal when you can use plastic?既然能用塑料，为什么要用金属呢？

phrase.main: 虽然；可是even though sth is true：

example.main: She claimed to be 18, when I knew she was only 16.她自称18岁，可是据我所知她才16岁。

phrase.main: [疑问代词，用作since, until, till等介词的宾语]什么时候：

example.main: Till when can you stay?你能待到什么时候？

phrase.main: [关系代词] 那时：

example.main: We came back on Tuesday, since when we have been working in the repair shop. 我们星期二回来的，从那时起就一直在修理车间工作。

phrase.main: 每当：

example.main: Whenever we met with difficulties, they came to help us. 每当我们遇到困难的时候，他们都会来帮忙。

phrase.main: 无论何时：

example.main: We try to help whenever possible.只要有可能我们都会尽量帮忙。
When I was a child, I could watch TV whenever I wanted to.我小时候，无论什么时候想看电视都能看。

phrase.main: 究竟什么时候：

example.main: Whenever did I make such a promise? 我究竟什么时候许过这样的诺言？

phrase.main: [疑问副词] 在 / 从哪里；向何处；在哪一点上；处于何种情况；到什么阶段：

example.main: Where were you living before you came here?来这儿之前，你住在哪里？
Where will he be if he fails the test?如果考试不及格，他会怎么样？
Where did the plan go wrong?计划在哪个地方出了问题？

phrase.main: [连接副词，引导名词性从句] 在哪里：

example.main: Where I will spend my summer holiday is still uncertain.我还没确定去哪里过暑假。
Without his support, we wouldn't be where we are now.没有他的支持，我们不会有现在的成就。
Jane moved aimlessly down the tree-lined street, not knowing where she was heading.简漫无目的地走在林荫路上，不知去往何处。

phrase.main: [关系副词，引导定语从句] 在那里：

example.main: He runs away to London, where he meets a man called Fagin. 他逃到了伦敦，在那里遇到了一位名叫费金的男子。
We live in a society where exchanging presents is an important part of communication. 在我们生活的社会里，互赠礼物是人际交往的重要组成部分。

phrase.main: 在...的地方；向...的地方：

example.main: Keep your toolbox where you can get at it.把工具箱放在你能够得着的地方。
Jane stopped where a small crowd of men had gathered.简在一小群男士聚集的地方停了下来。

phrase.main: 到...的地步：

example.main: Things are now where we can do nothing. 事情已经发展到我们无能为力的地步。

phrase.main: 不论何处：

example.main: Where there is a will, there is a way. 有志者，事竟成。

phrase.main: 哪里：

example.main: — We’re going on a long journey.我们打算出一次远门。
— Where to?去哪里？

phrase.main: 然而；反之：

example.main: He must be about sixty, whereas his wife looks about thirty. 他肯定六十岁左右，而他妻子看起来只有大约三十岁。

phrase.main: 无论在 / 到哪里：

example.main: Wherever I go, I always meet interesting people. 无论去哪里，我总能遇到有趣的人。
Keep in touch with family members wherever you are in the world. 不管你在世界上的什么地方，都要跟家人保持联系。

phrase.main: 究竟在哪里：

example.main: Wherever did you find that beautiful sweater? 你到底在哪里发现那件漂亮的毛衣的？

phrase.main: 是否：

example.main: I don’t know whether you like flowers ( or not ).我不知道你是否喜欢花。
Whether it will do us harm or good remains to be seen.究竟此事对我们有害还是有利，还有待验证。
His first question was whether the teacher had arrived yet.他的第一个问题是老师来了没有。
It is not a problem whether we can win the battle; it's just a matter of time.我们是否能赢得这场战役不是问题，这只是时间问题。

form.main: [在not sure / certain, doubtful 等后] 引导从句：

example.main: He wasn’t sure whether he ought to laugh or cry.他哭笑不得。
I don’t know whether to accept or refuse. 我不知道应该接受还是拒绝。

phrase.main: [引导让步状语从句] 不管... (还是)：

example.main: Quality input ensures quality output, whether it is speaking or writing. 不管是说还是写，高质量的输入才能确保高质量的输出。

phrase.main: [疑问代词] 哪一个；哪一些：

example.main: Which do you prefer, desktops or laptops? 台式机与笔记本电脑，你更喜欢哪个？

phrase.main: [连接代词，引导名词性从句] 哪一个；哪一些：

example.main: Which of them will win the game is hard to say.很难说他们中的哪一个会赢得这场比赛。
I asked her which she chose as her favorite TV program. 我问她选了哪一个作为她最喜爱的电视节目。
The question is which you like best.问题是你最喜欢哪一个。

phrase.main: [关系代词，引导定语从句] 那一个；那一些：

example.main: Tell me about the film (which) you saw last night.跟我讲讲你昨晚看的电影吧。
I borrowed the book Sherlock Holmes from the library last week, which my classmates recommended to me.上周我从图书馆借了《福尔摩斯》这本书，它是同学推荐给我看的。
My friend showed me around the town, which was very kind of him. 我的朋友很友善，他带我到镇上四处逛了一下。
China is a large country in which many different dialects are spoken.中国幅员辽阔，方言众多。
He wrote many children’s books, nearly half of which were published in the 1990s.他写了许多儿童读物，其中将近一半是在20世纪90年代出版的。

phrase.main: 哪一个；哪一些：

example.main: At which station should I change trains?我该在哪个车站换乘?
Which university did you go to, Oxford or Cambridge?你去的是哪所大学，牛津还是剑桥?

phrase.main: [疑问代词] 究竟哪一个：

example.main: Whichever do you like?你究竟喜欢哪一个？

phrase.main: [连接代词，引导名词性从句] ...的那个人 / 物：

example.main: Whichever of you gets there first will get the prize.你们之中谁最先到达那里谁就能得到这个奖品。
Take whichever you like.你喜欢哪个就拿哪个。

phrase.main: [连接代词，引导让步状语从句] 无论哪个 / 哪些：

example.main: Whichever they choose, we must accept their decision.无论他们如何选择，我们都必须接受他们的决定。

phrase.main: 无论哪一个 / 哪一些：

example.main: Take whichever seat you like.你喜欢哪个位子就坐哪个。

phrase.main: [引导让步状语从句] 不管哪个：

example.main: You will be there by 5, whichever train you take.无论你乘坐哪趟火车，5点前都可以到那儿。

phrase.main: 当...的时候；和...同时；在...时：

example.main: Never get on or off a bus while it is moving.公共汽车没停稳时千万不要上下车。
Would you look after the children while I do the shopping? 我买东西的时候你能不能照看一下孩子？
I hurt my leg while playing football.我踢足球时把腿弄伤了。

phrase.main: [表示对比] 然而：

example.main: I was never very neat, while my roommate Kate was extremely organized.我从来不是一个很爱整洁的人，而我的室友凯特却极有条理。

phrase.main: 虽然；尽管 (although)：

example.main: While online shopping has changed our life, not all of its effects have been positive.尽管网上购物已经改变了我们的生活，但并非它所有的影响都是正面的。

phrase.main: 只要：

example.main: While there’s life there’s hope.只要活着就有希望。

phrase.main: [常与 a 连用]一段时间；一会儿：

example.main: once in a while偶尔；间或
Would you like to come in and rest for a while?你要不要进来休息一会儿？
The file may take a short while to download.下载这个文件可能需要点儿时间。

phrase.main: 鞭子
鞭笞；抽打：

example.main: whip a horse on策马前行

phrase.main: 低声讲：

example.main: James leaned over to whisper something to Michael.詹姆斯俯身跟迈克尔低声说了点什么。
Even though it was only October, my students were already whispering about holiday plans.尽管才刚到10月，我的学生们已经在嘀咕假期计划了。
You’ll have to whisper or he’ll hear you. 你得小声说，否则他会听到的。

phrase.main: 低语；私语；耳语：

example.main: speak in a whisper 低声说话

phrase.main: 哨子；口哨：

example.main: give a loud / low whistle响亮地/轻轻地吹了声口哨
The lifeguard blew his whistle.救生员吹响了哨子。

phrase.main: 吹口哨；鸣笛：

example.main: You probably sing or whistle when you are happy.当你高兴的时候，很可能会唱歌或吹口哨。
The train whistled.火车鸣响了汽笛。

phrase.main: 白色的；苍白的；白种 (人) 的；（咖啡 / 茶）加奶的：

example.main: His face was white with fear.他吓得脸色苍白。

phrase.main: [U] 白色；[C] 白种人；蛋白
惠特尼
[疑问代词] 谁；什么人：

example.main: Who were you speaking to?刚才你在和谁讲话?

phrase.main: [连接代词，引导名词性从句] 谁；什么人：

example.main: Who will go makes no difference.谁去都一样。
It is still not decided who should be our manager.谁来当我们的经理还没有决定。
The key is who can carry this heavy box.关键是谁能搬动这么沉的箱子。

phrase.main: [关系代词，引导定语从句] ...的人；他 / 她 (们)：

example.main: The man (who) I saw is called Smith. 我见到的那个人叫史密斯。
People who receive kindness are likely to offer it to others.得到好意的人很可能把它给予他人。
Richard, who worked for a business company, was eager to work for himself.理查德在一家商务公司工作，他渴望自己当老板。

phrase.main: [疑问代词] 究竟是谁：

example.main: Whoever said that?究竟是谁讲的那些话?

phrase.main: [连接代词，引导名词性从句] ...的那个人；...的任何人：

example.main: Whoever wants to go to the Antarctic must be physically strong.任何想去南极的人必须身体强壮。
The gold medal will be awarded to whoever wins the first place in the bicycle race.自行车比赛得第一名得人会获得金牌。

phrase.main: [连接代词，引导让步状语从句] 无论谁；不管什么人：

example.main: To show our respect, we usually have to take our gloves off whoever we are to shake hands with.为表示我们的敬意，通常无论我们要和谁握手都必须脱下手套。

phrase.main: [只用于名词前] 全体的；全部的 (entire)：

example.main: work with one’s whole heart全心全意地工作
The whole city was destroyed in the earthquake.整座城市都被地震摧毁了。

phrase.main: 完整的；完好无缺的 (complete)：

example.main: a whole cake整个蛋糕

phrase.main: [用the whole] 全部；全体；[常用a whole] 整体：

example.main: Some of his ideas are interesting, but the whole of it is ridiculous. 他的一部分想法很有趣，但整体来看很荒谬。
Nature is a whole.自然界是一个统一体。

phrase.main: [疑问代词] 谁：

example.main: Whom did you see?你见到了谁?
Of whom are you speaking?你说的是谁?

phrase.main: [连接代词，引导名词性从句] 谁：

example.main: Whom your daughter went to the park with is unclear.你女儿跟谁去的公园还不清楚。
What I want to know is whom we will vote our new monitor. 我想知道的是我们将选谁当新班长。

phrase.main: [关系代词，引导定语从句] 那些人；他 / 她：

example.main: She’s the lady whom we met yesterday.她就是我们昨天遇到的那位女士。
The man with whom I shook hands just now is an artist.刚才和我握手的那个人是位画家。
She had a daughter, whom she loved very much.她有个女儿，她非常爱她女儿。
Many people, some of whom are not overweight, are going on diets. 许多人在节食，可其中有些人并没有超重。

phrase.main: [疑问代词] 谁的：

example.main: Whose dictionary is it?这是谁的字典?

phrase.main: [连接代词，引导名词性从句] 谁的：

example.main: Whose car was stolen must be made clear.必须查清楚是谁的车被偷了。
I wonder whose these keys are. 我想知道这些钥匙是谁的。
The first thing we should discuss is whose home is the nearest to school. 我们应该讨论的第一件事是，谁家离学校最近。

phrase.main: [关系代词，引导定语从句] 那个 / 些人的；他 /她 / 它的；他们 / 她们 / 它们的：

example.main: Rescue workers built shelters for survivors whose homes had been destroyed.救援人员为那些家园被毁的幸存者盖起了避难所。
The school shop, whose customers are mainly students, is closed for the holidays.这个学校商店的顾客主要是学生，它在假期时不营业。

phrase.main: [疑问副词] 为什么；为何：

example.main: Why didn’t you select a nice research subject?你为什么不选一个好的研究主题呢？

phrase.main: [连接副词，引导名词性从句] 为什么：

example.main: Why you didn’t visit your teacher must be explained to me. 你必须跟我解释一下为何没去看望你的老师。
I wonder why he was late.我不明白他为什么迟到。
That’s why I like playing football.那就是我喜欢足球的理由。

phrase.main: [关系副词，引导定语从句] ...的原因：

example.main: This is probably the number one reason why this class is so popular. 这很可能是这门课如此受欢迎的首要原因。

phrase.main: [过时] [表示不耐烦、惊异等]：

example.main: Why, look who’s here!哎呀，看看这是谁！

phrase.main: 宽的；宽阔的：

example.main: a wide river 宽阔的河流

phrase.main: 宽...的；宽度为...的：

example.main: The river is 10 metres wide.这条河10米宽。

phrase.main: (眼睛) 睁大的：

example.main: She stared at him with wide eyes. 她睁大眼睛瞪着他。

phrase.main: [常用于名词前]广泛的：

example.main: a wide range / variety / choice of goods 品种繁多的/各种各样的/大量可供选择的商品
Jenny has a wide circle of friends.珍妮交友广泛。

phrase.main: 充分 (张开) 地：

example.main: The door was wide open.门大开着。
I don’t remember ever smiling so wide.我不记得自己曾笑得如此开怀。
Open your mouth wide.把嘴张大。

phrase.main: 广泛地 (commonly)：

example.main: Electronic devices are widely used these days.如今，电子产品应用广泛。
He travels widely and enjoys adventures and challenges.他四处旅游，喜欢冒险和挑战。
Her books are widely read.她的书读读者很多。

phrase.main: 大大地；非常地：

example.main: The two books are widely different.这两本书截然不同。

phrase.main: 广泛的；分布广的；传播广的：

example.main: a widespread disease 广泛传播的疾病
The consequence of a rising sea level would be widespread flooding. 海平面上升将会导致大面积的洪涝灾害。
The high cost prohibits the widespread use of the drug. 这种药品因价格昂贵而不能广泛使用。

phrase.main: 寡妇
宽度；幅度：

example.main: a width of four feet / four feet in width4英尺宽
a road of great width 很宽阔的马路
What’s the width of the bed?这张床多宽?

phrase.main: 妻子
野 (生) 的：

example.main: wild animals / flowers 野生动物/野花

phrase.main: 荒芜的；荒凉的：

example.main: The island is a wild and lonely place. 该岛荒无人烟。
He is abandoned in a wild area and has to find his way out.他被丢在野外，必须找到出路。

phrase.main: （行为）无法无天的；放荡的：

example.main: The boy is wild and completely out of control. 这个男孩很野，完全没法管教。

phrase.main: （感情）强烈的；疯狂的：

example.main: His rock music makes the audience go wild. 他的摇滚乐使听众疯狂。

phrase.main: 荒地：

example.main: He went to Africa to see lions, giraffes, and elephants in the wild. 他到非洲去看野外的狮子、长颈鹿和大象。

phrase.main: 野生生物
[C] & [U] 意志；决心：

example.main: have a strong will 有坚强的意志
an iron will / a will of iron钢铁般的意志
In spite of what happened, he never lost the will to fight.尽管有如此遭遇，他从未丧失拼搏的意志。

phrase.main: [C] 遗嘱：

example.main: make a will 立遗嘱

phrase.main: [U]意愿：

example.main: I was forced to sign the agreement against my will.我被迫违心地在协议上签了字。

phrase.main: [表示单纯的将来] 将要；会：

example.main: We will catch the 3:30 train. 我们要赶3点30分的火车。

phrase.main: [表示意志、意愿、建议、决心等] 愿；要；定要：

example.main: I will do my best to help you. 我会尽力帮你。
Will you type this, please? 你是否可以把这个打出来呢?

phrase.main: [表示功能] 能；行：

example.main: This will do if there is nothing better. 如果没有更好的，这个也行。

phrase.main: [表示推测] 可能；大概：

example.main: That will be the delivery man at the door, I suppose.我想门外可能是送货员。

phrase.main: [表示习惯、经常性、倾向性等] 惯于；总是：

example.main: She’ll listen to music, alone in her room, for hours. 她总是独自一个人在房间听音乐，一听就是几个小时。

phrase.main: [通常不用于名词前]愿意的；乐意的：

example.main: Successful people are always willing to do every little thing well.成功的人总是愿意做好每一件小事。
If we are willing to learn, the opportunities are everywhere.如果我们愿意学习，到处都是机会。

phrase.main: [常用于名词前](人、行为等) 自发的；出于自愿的：

example.main: I know that I wasn't a willing student, but I wasn't slow to learn new things.我知道自己不是一个主动学习的学生，但我学习新事物并不慢。

phrase.main: vi & vt (在...中) 获胜；赢：

example.main: win a race / a game / an election 在赛跑/比赛/选举中获胜
She won by four points. 她领先4分获胜。

phrase.main: vt 赢得；获得；博得：

example.main: win the gold medal 获得金牌
Winning a scholarship gave Martin the chance to go to college. 获得奖学金使马丁有机会去上大学。
He is a good teacher and wins respect from his students.他是一名好老师，赢得了学生们的尊重。

derivative.main: adj[只用于名词前]winning

phrase.main: 风；气流：

example.main: strong / high winds大风

phrase.main: vt 卷绕；缠绕：

example.main: Wind a bandage firmly around the wounded leg.用绷带紧紧地裹住受伤的腿。

phrase.main: vt & vi上紧...的发条：

example.main: You must wind (up) this clock once a day.你得每天给这个钟上发条。

phrase.main: vi & vt(道路、河流等) 弯曲；蜿蜒：

example.main: The river winds to the sea. 这条河蜿蜒流向大海。
Highway 90 winds its way along the coast.90号高速公路沿着海岸线蜿蜒而去。

phrase.main: 窗户；窗口；橱窗：

example.main: The thief entered by / through the window.小偷是从窗户进来的。

phrase.main: 获得信息的渠道：

example.main: Reading those books opened a window for me to another world.读这些书为我打开了一扇通往另一个世界的窗户。

phrase.main: 有风的；风大的
葡萄酒；酒
翅膀；机翼；侧翼；侧厅
获胜者；成功者
冬；冬季：

example.main: in ( the ) winter 在冬季

phrase.main: 擦；抹：

example.main: wipe one's eyes with a tissue用纸巾擦眼睛
wipe glasses dry 把杯子擦干
He wiped his hands on his blue apron. 他用蓝色的围裙擦了下手。

phrase.main: 擦掉 (液体、污垢等)：

example.main: They wiped away the girls’ tears. 他们擦掉女孩子们的眼泪。
He wiped the sweat from / off his forehead.他擦去额头上的汗。

phrase.main: 金属丝 / 线；电线；电话线
无线的：

example.main: a wireless router无线路由器

phrase.main: 智慧；明智：

example.main: a man of wisdom 智者
a wisdom tooth智齿
With your words of wisdom, I suddenly felt unlimited freedom to dream. My whole world opened up.听完你说的至理名言，我突然感到梦想无边界，我的整个世界开启了。

phrase.main: (人因阅历丰富而) 有智慧的；英明的：

example.main: The older, the wiser.越老越聪明。/姜是老的辣。
Life makes a wise man smile and a foolish man cry.生活让智者微笑，让愚者哭泣。

phrase.main: (行为、决定等) 明智的；高明的 (sensible)：

example.main: a wise move / choice / decision明智之举/明智的选择/明智的决定
If you are learning new worlds, it is wise to use small cards with the words written on them.如果你学习的是新单词，使用写有这些单词的小卡片是明智之举。

phrase.main: 明智地；精明地
vt [后接表示虚拟语气的从句]要是...就好了：

example.main: I wish I were taller. 我要是个子高一些就好了。
I wish I didn’t have to work today. 要是今天我不用工作就好了。
I wish I had taken your advice. 我当初要是采纳了你的建议就好了。
I wish I could speak French. 我要是能讲法语就好了。

phrase.main: vi & vt 想；希望：

example.main: You may leave now, if you wish. 如果你想走，现在就可以走了。
Anyone wishing to try race walking should first consult a coach.任何想要尝试竞走的人应该首先咨询教练。
Why don’t you wish your son to accept this post? 你为什么不希望儿子接受这个职位呢?
I wish the problem settled. 我希望这个问题已经得到解决。

phrase.main: vt祝愿：

example.main: Finally, I rose to leave, wished him well, and headed for the exit. 最后，我站起身来，说了一些祝福他的话，然后向出口走去。
I wish you every success / a happy birthday.祝你万事如意 / 生日快乐。

phrase.main: vi盼望；想要：

example.main: It's no use wishing for the impossible.企求不可能的事情是无用的。

phrase.main: 愿望；希望； [常用复数] 祝愿：

example.main: Jason was determined not to go against his father’s wishes. 贾森决定不违背父亲的意愿。
Mary sends you best wishes for a Happy New Year.玛丽衷心祝愿你新年快乐。

phrase.main: 和...一起：

example.main: I still miss the days when she was with us. 我依然很怀念她和我们在一起的日子。

phrase.main: 赞同 (某人)：

example.main: Are you with me or against me? 你是支持我还是反对我？

phrase.main: 具有；带有；包含

example.main: a cup with a handle 有把儿的杯子
Success is the ability to go from one failure to another with no loss of enthusiasm.成功是，你即使跨过一个又一个失败，但也没有失去热情。
cost 500 dollars with tax连税在内价格为500美元

phrase.main: 对于：

example.main: These topics are very popular with students.这些话题很受学生欢迎。
Be patient with other people. 对别人要有耐心。

phrase.main: 随着：

example.main: change with the temperature随温度而变化
With that last remark, she turned and left. 说完最后那句话，她便转身离开了。

phrase.main: 由于；因为：

example.main: I felt like crying with happiness. 我高兴得想哭。
jump with joy高兴地跳起来

phrase.main: [表示使用的工具、手段等] 用：

example.main: Cut it with a knife.用刀把它切开。

phrase.main: [表示行为方式] 以...；带着：

example.main: We should overcome our weaknesses and fears with courage and determination. 我们要用勇气与决心来克服自己的弱点与恐惧。
He prepared everything with great care. 他精心地准备每件事。

phrase.main: vi & vt（使）撤离；（使）退出：

example.main: The tennis player withdrew from several tournaments due to injury.那位网球运动员因伤退出了几场锦标赛。

phrase.main: vi & vt收回 (发言、意见等)：

example.main: The minister withdrew his statement later.后来部长收回了自己的言论。

phrase.main: vt 提取 (存款等)：

example.main: I wanted to withdraw $4,000 from my bank account.我想从我的银行账户里取4 000美元。

phrase.main: vi & vt脱离（社会）；不与人交往：

example.main: He began to withdraw to himself, believing he would never be able to lead a normal life again.他开始变得不爱与人交往，觉得自己再也不能过正常的生活了。

phrase.main: [U] & [C]退出；撤走；取款（额）；脱瘾（过程 ）：

example.main: the withdrawal of UN forces联合国部队的撤离
You can make withdrawals of up to 20,000 yuan a day.你一天最多可以提取2万元。

phrase.main: 在...范围 / 时间以内；不超过：

example.main: I completed the task within 40 minutes.我在40分钟内完成了任务。
Put the tools within your reach.把工具放在你能够得着的地方。
Should they keep their conclusion within the team or share it with other employees? 他们是应该将结论保留在团队内，还是与其他员工分享？

phrase.main: 没有：

example.main: Without your help, I would have failed in the examination. 没有你的帮助，我可能就通不过考试。
She went to the party without being invited. 她未受到邀请就去参加了聚会

phrase.main: [C]目击者；见证人；证人：

example.main: We have a witness to the killing. 我们有一位这起杀人案的目击者。

phrase.main: 目击；亲眼所见；见证：

example.main: From seeing the wildlife to witnessing sunrises, the whole experience was amazing.从观赏野生动物到观看日出，整个经历都令人惊叹。
The late twentieth century witnessed the rapid development of China's economy.20世纪末中国经济迅速发展。

phrase.main: 巫师；能手；奇才
狼
妇女；女人
vt & vi(对...) 感到惊讶 / 诧异：

example.main: I wonder at his beautiful singing. 他优美的歌声让我感到很惊讶。
He wondered about her response, and just to clarify, he asked her another question. 他对她的回答感到很好奇，为了弄清楚，他又问了她一个问题。

phrase.main: vt想知道：琢磨：

example.main: Do you ever stop to wonder why you’re going to college?你停下来想过为什么要上大学吗？

phrase.main: [U] 惊异；惊叹：

example.main: Even a tiny outdoor experience can create wonder in a child. 即使很少的户外体验也会让孩子产生好奇感。
The beautiful scenery around here gave me a sense of wonder.这周围的美景令我感到惊叹。

phrase.main: [C] 奇迹；奇事；奇才：

example.main: The pyramids were among the Eight Wonders of the World金字塔是世界八大奇迹之一。
It's a wonder that you didn’t lose your way in the dark.你在黑暗中居然没有迷路，这真令人惊奇。
Jim, you’re a wonder! I would never have thought of doing that. 吉姆，你真是个人才！我怎么也想不到可以那么做。

phrase.main: 极好的；灵验的：

example.main: Do you believe that “wonder drugs” will be invented to treat diseases like AIDS in the future?你相信未来会研制出治疗像艾滋病这类疾病的“灵丹妙药“吗？

phrase.main: 奇妙的；精彩的；极好的：

example.main: a wonderful surprise/idea惊喜/妙计
The food was wonderful with reasonable prices, and we enjoyed several local dishes.食物很棒，价格公道，我们享用了几道当地菜。

phrase.main: [U] 木头；木材；木料
[C] [常用复数]树林；森林：

example.main: As kids, my friends and I spent a lot of time out in the woods.小时候，我和朋友们经常在外面树林里玩。

phrase.main: 木制的：

example.main: a wooden house木屋

phrase.main: 僵硬的；呆滞的：

example.main: wooden movements 僵硬的动作

phrase.main: 羊毛；毛线；羊毛织物
羊毛制的；毛线的：

example.main: She is wearing a woolen coat. 她穿着一件羊毛外套。

phrase.main: 羊毛制的；毛线的：

example.main: She is wearing a woolen coat. 她穿着一件羊毛外套。

phrase.main: [C] 字；词；单词：

example.main: I know the tune, but not the words. 我熟悉曲调，但不知道歌词

phrase.main: [C] 话；言语：

example.main: a man of few words话不多的人
He didn’t say a word about it. 他对那件事只字未提。

phrase.main: [U] [用单数] 消息；传闻：

example.main: We sent word to Mrs Spencer to bring a boy.我们给斯宾塞太太捎口信说要带个男孩子来。
Word came that another train station would soon be ready in our city. 据说另一个火车站不久将在我市建成。

phrase.main: [U] [用单数] 诺言；保证：

example.main: Angela was as good as her word. 安吉拉说话算数。
He gave her his word that he would never be late again. 他向她保证再也不迟到了。
He is a man of his word. 他是个守信的人

phrase.main: vi & vt (使) 工作；(使) 劳动：

example.main: He worked tirelessly for the charity throughout his life. 他毕生为慈善事业孜孜不倦地工作。
She worked herself too hard. 她工作起来太努力了。
Her husband worked two jobs to cover the bills.她丈夫做两份工作来支付账单。

phrase.main: vi 从事职业：

example.main: Why do you choose to work in an international travel agency?你为什么选择在一家国际旅行社工作呢？
I once worked as a reporter for my school broadcasting station.我曾经在校广播电台当过记者。

phrase.main: vi & vt(使) 运行；(使) 运转：

example.main: My mobile phone worked well yesterday, but I simply couldn’t turn it on this morning.我的手机昨天用着还好好的，但今早就无法开机了。
Do you know how to work the coffee machine? 你知道怎么操作这台咖啡机吗？

phrase.main: vi 起作用；有效；行得通：

example.main: It takes sunscreen about fifteen minutes to start working.防晒霜大约在（涂抹）15分钟后开始起作用。
The medicine works more effectively if you drink some hot water after taking it. 你吃完这种药后再喝点热水，药效会更好。
We won’t know how the plan works till we have tried it out. 直到我们尝试后才能知道这个计划是否行得通。

phrase.main: vi努力取得：

example.main: Jennifer received great support from her family as she worked to earn her degree.詹妮弗在努力获得学位的过程中得到了家人的大力支持。

phrase.main: [U] 工作；劳动：

example.main: Though I had a lot of experience and a Master’s degree, I could not find satisfying work.虽然我有丰富的经验和硕士学位，但我没能找到满意的工作。
She earned excellent grades through hard work. 她通过艰苦的努力取得了优异的成绩。

phrase.main: [U] 工作成果；产品：

example.main: Every designer hopes that his work can stand the test of time. 每位设计师都希望自己的产品能经得起时间的考验。

phrase.main: [C]著作；作品：

example.main: No matter how frequently performed, the works of Beethoven still attract people all over the world.不管多么频繁地被演奏，贝多芬的作品依旧吸引着全世界的人。

phrase.main: [用复数]工厂：工程：

example.main: a steel works 钢铁厂
Public works公共/市政工程

phrase.main: 工人；劳动者；工作者
[常用单数]工作场所
车间；研讨会；研习班

example.main: I was conducting a workshop when someone knocked at the classroom door.我正在开研讨会时，有人敲教室的门。

phrase.main: [用作 the world] 世界；地球：

example.main: people all around/over the world全世界人民

phrase.main: [用作 the world，集合名词] 全世界的人：

example.main: The moment the 28th Olympic Games were declared open, the whole world cheered. 当宣布第28届奥运会开幕时，全世界都为之欢呼雀跃。

phrase.main: [常用单数]界；领域：

example.main: the newspaper / academic world报界/学术界

phrase.main: 社会；生活；生活圈子：

example.main: When she lost her son, her entire world changed. 自从失去儿子以后，她的整个世界完全改变了。
Soon I will graduate and become part of the real world.很快我就会毕业，成为现实生活的一部分。

phrase.main: 世界性的；遍及全球的：

example.main: a worldwide organization 世界性的组织
Gasoline now has an almost worldwide use. 现在差不多全世界都在使用汽油。

phrase.main: 在全世界：

example.main: About 400 earthquakes occur worldwide every day. 全球每天发生大约400次地震。

phrase.main: 虫；蠕虫
[常用于名词前] 用旧的；穿坏的：

example.main: two worn armchairs 两把破旧的扶手椅
a worn sweater穿旧的毛衣

phrase.main: 疲倦的：

example.main: a worn face 一脸倦容

phrase.main: 磨破的；穿旧的
焦虑的；担心的

example.main: a worried look 焦虑的神情
She was very worried about her sick mother.她非常担心生病的母亲。
Alia was worried that the fires of war would destroy the books.阿利亚担心战火会毁掉这些图书。

phrase.main: vt使焦虑；使担忧to make sb anxious about sb/sth：

example.main: What worries scientists now is that the African elephant has become an endangered species.现在令科学家担心的是非洲象已经成为濒危物种。
It worries me that he keeps changing his mind.我发愁的是他一直在改变注意。

phrase.main: vt 骚扰；烦扰；使不安 (bother)：

example.main: The noise never seems to worry her.这噪音似乎从未让她感到厌烦。
Don’t keep worrying him with a lot of silly questions.别老用这些愚蠢的问题烦他。

phrase.main: vi 担心；发愁：

example.main: Don't worry. We still have plenty of time.别担心，我们还有很多时间。
Stop worrying about the past and live in the present.别担扰过去，要活在当下。

phrase.main: [U] 焦虑；担忧；烦恼 (anxiety)：

example.main: She lost weight because of all the worry about her son’s illness.她因为担心儿子的病情而消瘦了。

phrase.main: [C] 令人担忧的事；让人发愁的事
[bad和ill的比较级] 更坏 / 差 / 糟的；病情更重的：

example.main: Your work is bad but mine is much worse. 你活干得不好，而我干得更糟。
The patient is worse this morning. 今早病人的病情恶化了。

phrase.main: [badly和ill的比较级]更坏；更糟；(病) 更重；更猛烈：

example.main: I slept worse in hot weather. 热天我更加睡不好。
It is raining worse than ever. 雨下得比以往都大。

phrase.main: [U] 更坏的事
崇拜；敬神
崇拜；敬奉
[bad和ill的最高级]最坏的；最差的；病情严重的；最恶劣的：

example.main: It was by far the worst speech he had ever made.这是迄今为止他发表的最糟糕的演讲。
This is the worst accident for years.这么多年来最严重的一次事故。

phrase.main: [badly和ill的最高级]最坏地；最差地；最恶劣地：

example.main: Of the four of us, I sang the worst. 四个人当中，我唱得最糟糕。

phrase.main: [与the连用]最坏的人 / 事：

example.main: The worst of the storm seemed to be over. 最猛烈的一阵暴风雨似乎已经过去。

phrase.main: 值...的；相当于/ 具有...价值的：

example.main: The old stamp is worth about 5,000 yuan.这张旧邮票价值5 000元左右。
An hour in the morning is worth two in the evening.一日之计在于晨。

phrase.main: 值得：

example.main: Although we take an hour a day for exercise, it is well worth it. 虽然我们每天都要锻炼一小时，但一切都是值得的。
Although this apple doesn’t taste of anything special, it’s still worth a try.尽管这种苹果吃起来没什么特别的味道，但仍然值得一尝。
Good opinions are worth sticking to because they can benefit us all.好的意见值得坚持因为它们对我们大家都有好处。
It is worth visiting the art museum.那个美术馆值得一去。

phrase.main: 价值：

example.main: millions of pounds’ worth of damage价值数百万英镑的损失
Every 60 seconds, a truckload's worth of plastic enters the ocean.每60秒，就有一卡车的塑料进入海洋。

phrase.main: 值得的;相当于……的价值
无价值的；无用的
值得花时间 / 精力的：

example.main: a worthwhile job值得做的工作
The smile on her face made it all worthwhile. 她脸上的笑容使得这一切都很值得。
We decided to give the money to a worthwhile cause (=one that helps people).我们决定把这笔钱投入到高尚的事业中。

form.main: it is worthwhile doing / to do sth:

example.main: It is worthwhile comparing / to compare prices.有必要比较一下价格。

phrase.main: [只用于名词前] [正式用语]值得敬重的：

example.main: a worthy cause崇高的事业
a worthy champion 当之无愧的冠军

phrase.main: [不用于名词前] 值得的：

example.main: She is a teacher who is worthy of respect.她是位值得尊敬的老师。
He insisted that the problem worthy of attention be discussed at the meeting.他坚持在会上讨论那个值得关注的问题。
She is worthy to receive such honor.她应该获得这个荣誉。
The young man is worthy to be taught.孺子可教。

phrase.main: [表示过去将来] 将：

example.main: He said he would see me again the next day. 他说第二天再来看我。

phrase.main: [表示过去的意志] 打算；要：

example.main: He would not leave before he finished his work. 完成工作之前他不会离开。
I promised that I would do my best. 我答应过要尽力而为。

phrase.main: [表示过去的习惯](从前) 常常：

example.main: On Sundays he would come to see his aged parents.他每到星期天就来看望年迈的父母。
Whenever Tom was angry, he would eat a lot. 汤姆一生气就会吃很多东西。

phrase.main: [表示委婉的推测] 大概：

example.main: You would never know how much your mother cares about you. 你大概永远不知道你妈妈有多关心你。

phrase.main: [用于虚拟语气，表示愿望] 如果能...的话：

example.main: If you would send me the papers, I should be grateful. 如果你能把那些文件寄给我，我将万分感激。

phrase.main: [用于虚拟语气，表示结果] (如果...的话) 会：

example.main: You would have better grades if you studied hard every day. 如果你每天都努力学习，就会有更好的成绩。
If I hadn't been faced with so many barriers,I wouldn't be where I am.如果我没有面对过那么多的障碍，就不会有今天的我。
What would you do if they should disagree? 万一他们反对，你会怎么办？

phrase.main: [常用于被动语态]使受伤；伤害：

example.main: He was wounded in the leg and almost unconscious.他的腿受了伤，几乎不省人事。
I was deeply wounded by her cruel remarks.她那刻薄的话深深地伤害了我。

phrase.main: 创伤；伤口：

example.main: The soldier had a wound in his chest. 这位士兵胸部受伤。
Do not rub, as the wound may get infected.不要擦拭，因为伤口可能会感染。

phrase.main: （用…）包；裹：

example.main: I’d like to wrap (up) Christmas presents in pretty paper.我喜欢用漂亮的纸把圣诞礼物包起来。
Zongzi are wrapped in bamboo leaves.粽子是用竹叶包的。

phrase.main: （用…）缠绕；围住：

example.main: He wrapped a scarf around his neck. 他在脖子上围了一条围巾。

phrase.main: 花圈；花冠；圈状物
使失事；使遭难；损害：毁坏:

example.main: The ship was wrecked on the rocks. 船撞毁在礁石上。
The accident wrecked his health.这次意外事故损坏了他的健康。

phrase.main: 沉船；遭严重毁坏的车/船等：

example.main: Divers discovered the wreck of an old German warship. 潜水员发现了一艘古老的德国战舰。
My car was a total wreck after the accident. 那次事故后，我的车成了一堆废铁。

phrase.main: (与...) 摔跤；扭打：

example.main: In the game, you must wrestle with each other and try to knock the other player to the floor.在比赛中，你必须与对方扭打，并试图将对手击倒在地。

phrase.main: 奋力对付；努力处理to struggle to deal with sth that is difficult (battle)：

example.main: I have been wrestling with the problem for weeks.我好几个星期都在努力解决这个问题。

phrase.main: 皱纹：褶皱

example.main: Grandfather has many wrinkles on his face. 祖父的脸上有许多皱纹。

phrase.main: vt & vi(使) 起皱纹；皱起：

example.main: He wrinkled his forehead, confused and worried by the strange event.他皱起眉头，对这件怪事感到莫名其妙又十分担心。
His face wrinkled when he smiled. 他微笑时脸上出现了皱纹。

phrase.main: 腕；腕关节
vi & vt写；书写；写信：

example.main: The pen writes smoothly. 这支笔书写流畅。
write a letter to sb给某人写信
Don’t forget to write to me. 记得写信给我。
It's said that history is written by the victors.据说历史是由胜利者书写的。

phrase.main: [常用writings]著作；文学作品：

example.main: the writings of Shakespeare 莎士比亚的作品

phrase.main: [U] 书写；写作

example.main: a writing desk 写字台；书桌
writing paper信纸

phrase.main: 错误的；不正确的：

example.main: Sorry, you have the wrong number. 对不起，你打错电话了。
You’re wrong about Tom; he hasn’t married at all.你弄错了，汤姆根本没有结婚。
You’re wrong to leave your child alone at home.你不应该让孩子单独待在家里。

phrase.main: 不道德的：

example.main: Telling lies is wrong. 撒谎是不对的。
It was wrong of you to steal money. 你偷钱是不对的。

phrase.main: 出故障的；有毛病的：

example.main: There was something wrong with my computer yesterday.昨天我的电脑坏了。

phrase.main: [常用于名词前] 不合适的：

example.main: This is the wrong time to make a visit. 这不是拜访的时候。

phrase.main: 错；不对：

example.main: You’ve spelt the word wrong. 你把这个单词拼错了。

phrase.main: [U] 坏事；过失：

example.main: Her son can do no wrong in her eyes.在她眼里，自己儿子不可能做错事。
the difference between right and wrong 是非之分
If you’re the person who is in the wrong, just admit it!如果你是理亏的那个人，尽管承认吧！

phrase.main: [C] 不公正的事；冤屈：

example.main: They have done me a great wrong. 他们对我非常不公平。

phrase.main: 世界野生生物基金会 (World Wildlife Fund)
X光 (检查)；X射线：

example.main: My son has a pain in his stomach and is going to have an X-ray. 我儿子胃疼，要去作X光检查。

phrase.main: 牦牛
院子；庭院：

example.main: a farm yard 农家院
a yard sale (在自家院子进行的)旧货出售
We sat in my grandparents' yard while the full moon shone above us.我们坐在祖父母家的院子里，满月当空。

phrase.main: [长度单位，=0.914米] 码
哈欠：

example.main: He gave a yawn and then fell asleep.他打了个哈欠，然后就睡着了。

phrase.main: 打哈欠：

example.main: His speech made the audience yawn. 他的演讲令听众直打哈欠。

phrase.main: [口语] 是；对 (yes)
(日历) 年
年度；学年：年级：

example.main: I am in my first year at senior high school.我是高中一年级学生。
We were both in year ten and we got on well.我们都读十年级，相处得很融洽。

phrase.main: ...岁
[复数][非正式用语] 很长时间：

example.main: I haven’t played the piano for years. 我很久没弹钢琴了。

phrase.main: 每年的；一年一度的：

example.main: Mr Davis takes a yearly trip to Europe. 戴维斯先生每年去欧洲旅行一次。

phrase.main: 每年；一年一次地：

example.main: Interest is paid yearly. 利息每年支付一次。

phrase.main: vi & vt 叫喊；大声喊 (说)：

example.main: “Help me!”she yelled at the top of her voice (= very loudly).“救救我！”她声嘶力竭地喊道。

form.main: yell (sth) at sb to do sth:

example.main: He yelled at her to be careful. 他大声叫她小心。

phrase.main: 黄色
黄色的；发黄的
是：

example.main: Answer with a yes or a no. 回答是或不是。

phrase.main: [对肯定的问句的回答] 是；是的：

example.main: — Will you come? 你要来吗?
— Yes, I will. 对，我要来。

phrase.main: [对否定的问句的回答] 不：

example.main: — You weren’t invited, were you? 没有邀请您，是吗？
— Yes, I was. 不，邀请了。

phrase.main: [同意对方的话或对自己的话加以肯定] 对；是的：

example.main: Your work is good, yes, very good. 你的工作干得很好，对，干得很好。

phrase.main: 昨天：

example.main: He arrived yesterday.他昨天到的。

phrase.main: 昨天：

example.main: the day before yesterday前天
yesterday morning / afternoon / evening 昨天上午/下午/晚上
Yesterday will not be called again. 昨日一去不复返。

phrase.main: [与but相比，比较的意味较强，常与and连用] 然而；可是：

example.main: The story is simple yet interesting. 这个故事简单但很有趣。
She is a funny girl, and yet you can’t help liking her.她是个滑稽的姑娘，可你会禁不住喜欢她。

phrase.main: [用于否定句中，常置于句末以及not后] 还；尚 (没)：

example.main: We haven’t finished the work yet. 我们还没有完成这项工作。

phrase.main: [用于表示肯定的疑问句] 已经：

example.main: Have you seen the film yet? 你看过那部电影了吗？

phrase.main: [与if, whether从句连用] 已经：

example.main: I doubt if she has written the paper yet. 我怀疑她是否已经写了论文。

phrase.main: [强调程度的增加] 更：

example.main: I have yet more exciting news to tell you. 我还有更令人激动的消息告诉你。

phrase.main: 酸乳；酸奶
你；你们
人；任何人：

example.main: You have to be careful with people you don’t know.对不认识的人要小心。

phrase.main: [集体名词，常与the连用] 年轻人；青年：

example.main: Microbloging is popular with the young. 年轻人很喜欢发微博。

phrase.main: 幼小动物；崽
年轻的；年幼的：

example.main: a young mother 年轻的母亲
Young babies sleep a great deal. 幼儿睡的时间长。
young trees小树
Some people know what they want to do from a young age.有些人年轻时就清楚自己想做什么。

phrase.main: 新兴的；新的：

example.main: a young company 新兴的企业

phrase.main: 年轻有活力的；青春的：

example.main: She looks young for her age. 她看起来比实际年龄小。

phrase.main: [形容词性物主代词，只作定语] 你的；你们的
[名词性物主代词，可作主语、宾语、表语] 你的；你们的：

example.main: My hands are clean, but yours are dirty.我的手干净，但你的(手)很脏。
I like my toy. I don’t like yours. 我喜欢我的玩具，我不喜欢你的(玩具)。
That book is yours. 那本书是你的。

phrase.main: [在信末署名前与truly, faithfully, sincerely等连用] 敬上
你自己；你亲自：

example.main: Chris, tell us a bit about yourself.克里斯，给我们讲讲你自己吧。
You yourself told me the news. 是你亲自把这消息告诉我的。

phrase.main: [U] 青少年时代：

example.main: He worked with wood during his early youth. 年轻时，他做过木匠。

phrase.main: [U] 青春；朝气：

example.main: Her face still kept its youth. 她的面容青春尤驻。

phrase.main: [C] 青年男子； 小伙子
[集合名词，常与the连用] 年轻人；青年：

example.main: The youth of today has / have greater opportunities than ever before. 现在的年轻人拥有的机会比以往任何时候都要多。

phrase.main: 美味的；可口的；赏心悦目的
斑马
新西兰的
(数字的) 零；(温度的) 零度
(数字的) 零；(温度的) 零；最低点：

example.main: twenty degrees below zero零下20度
a zero-carbon city 无碳城市

phrase.main: 津巴布韦 (非洲东南部国家)
(BrE) 拉链；拉锁
vt & vi 拉开拉链；拉上拉链：

example.main: She zipped up her dress. 她拉上了衣服的拉链。

phrase.main: (AmE) 拉链；拉锁
地区；区域；地带：

example.main: a nuclear-free zone无核区
a time zone 时区
economic and technological development zones 经济技术开发区
an earthquake zone地震带

phrase.main: 动物园
飞驰；急速上升
